reviews.text: Quick and basic deli in Chinatown--no Banh Mis or Asian-inspired sandwiches, but just the regular American stuff. Pastrami, ham, reuben, etc are all on the menu. All good stuff. Oh, and the portions are pretty large. Not enough to feed two, but enough to keep one satisfied.
Excellent. Got the avocado and cheese sandwich, which includes a whole bunch of veggies. Including tax paid 5.75, and it was a filling meal. Simple, yet tasty.
Awesome deli, a real mom and pop place. Great sandwiches. We loved the dutch crunch. Nice fresh ingredients. This was the only place open at 7AM in the immediate area. Cheap. Cash only.
Big, yummy simple sandwiches. As others point out, it's small and can fill up fast. Lots of business folk from Montgomery street. But definitely one of the best values around.
Giant sandwiches and lots of fixings is what you'll get here! The sandwiches are cheap too! I like ordering the sandwiches with dutch crunch bread.

Had the turkey avocado sandwich on Dutch Crunch bread. Everything on it and chips and a drink for $9.60. The sandwich was pretty dang good. Good portion size and fresh ingredients. Small place with three two person tables and a little sit up bar by the window. You need Cash. I wasn't the only one looking for an ATM close by. The owner was friendly and the service was quick. I will be back and I recommend trying it out! I am only giving it 4 stars for not accepting credit cards.

Just love this little mom and pop deli... Only a few tables.  Looking for a great Sammy? Excellent find. High quality meats and cheeses. Get the Dutch Crunch bread!! The hubby and I come to SF yearly and have stopped in every visit since we found it 3 years ago. Sweet, sweet couple run the place.  Great little lunch spot.

I've been going to this place ever since I was a child. The owners are super nice and friendly. Their sandwiches are SUPER DELICIOUS. I brought my boyfriend here once and he preferred this place than subways or Ike's. I would definitely recommend this sandwich place to anyone.
I ordered a corned beef sandwich after looking up on Yelp to find a good place. I felt it was worth the $7 that I paid. The place had all those treats that I enjoyed as a kid (i.e bungles).

Great sandwiches for on the go.Very friendly mom and pop shop that makes fantastic sandwiches. Huge selection of breads and meats.Was very impressed when I saw the guy in the little kitchen hand cutting freshly cooked chicken breasts for their excellent chicken salad. Plus, a nice place too grab a beverage for the road.
Friendly service and great value for money.  If I still worked near there, I would definitely go back.
The sandwiches are CHEAP, HUGE and YUMMY. (doe only)
Best egg & cheese bagel I can find. Espresso is good too. Always fast (I'm usually there ~9AM).
While visiting I thought surely they would have good pho being in china town. Not quite. The curry chicken was decent.

Pretty tasty sandwiches at a super affordable price! As others have said, it does seem like a small family run business, but they are really friendly. The sandwiches are not like sandwiches from all the other popular spots (no special sauces/spreads or crazy names). I got a turkey sandwich on Dutch Crunch. It was good. I like that they toast it, but because they do, you might have to wait a little while for your order.

Delicious and not too expensive. I always order the Roast Beef, Smoked Salmon, Egg Salad or Chicken Salad sandwich. The wait is usually pretty quick, unless you go at 11-12pm, when everyone goes out for lunch and the line is crazy long....

Friendly man at the counter. Small place with about 12 chairs. Cleanliness is as clean as it gets for a sandwich place. It's really stuffy in there... Prices are definitely affordable. Portions, not as long as Subway but definitely as thick.

Ok. I go there at 3:45, there are some people inside still eating their sandwiches. I approach the Asian women behind the counter and I asked for the turkey sandwich with avocado and the chicken salad sandwich. Then she asked me "anything else?" I said, no. Suddenly the people who were eating leaves and the Asian women, the owner, tells me. "One second please" I stayed quiet. Then She goes to the door to look outside, then she comes inside, turned off the lights and she tells me. " I cannot make your sandwich anymore, and she said next time come earlier" so I asked her, what time do you close? She tells me 4. If she did not want to make food any more, she could have told me at the beginning and not make me wait and suddenly tells me she does not want to make it anymore. I'll never go there again.
I got the chance to finally try this place and it did not disappoint.
I always go here for something quick and cheap! It's nice to support a small business in the financial district too! Great bagels and sandwiches!

This place is very good and very cheap. You totally wouldn't expect this place to be good, it looks like a family-run Asian mini-mart but they have deliciously fresh and large sandwiches that are rare to find at such a price in SF. So surprised there's basically no line ever either! Definitely a go-to lunch spot for me, working a few blocks away.
Great local gem. Doesn't look like much but the sandwiches are great and good prices!

My first morning in the City I asked my roommate where to go for breakfast. Without hesitating he said, "Good Luck Cafe." For the last two and a half years I've been going back on a near weekly basis for either breakfast or lunch.

They have a smoked salmon sandwich, like what! The sandwiches are decently priced, especially for downtown/FIDI. It's a local spot with good food (they even have bagel sandwiches for $3). I think I need to try a few of their other menu options to really give this place a fair review, and I was unable to pay with card so that's a bummer. The staff is really friendly though, and it's clean.
very good sandwiches, good prices. they just forgot to give me my change back. i did not want to ask anymore. change was like 79 cents

Completely unassuming bagel place but it's really great! Bagels were fresh as well as all the ingredients. The service was fast and friendly. Prices are cheap. The seating is sparse but it doesn't need to be fancy. Super quick walk from the Hilton where we were staying. I would come back for the veggie bagel sandwich anytime!
This is a sandwich shop owned by an older couple who speak little English. I come here regularly because:

Amazing little sandwich shop I passed by a lot but never tried until today. The bread is fresh and perfectly toasted. All the meats they use looks very well kept and name brand. The veggies are fresh and have the perfect combination when you get everything. It's also a steal at the price range of $6-8 even with additions! Definitely try though only if you have cash on you.

Cash only so don't bring your credit card here. Cute little shop that makes sandwiches.  They have little asian goodies like yan yan sticks, pocky sticks, and candy! I ordered the roast beef on a dutch crunch with jalapeños to give my sandwich that extra spice in my life:) A little slow to make the sandwiches but what can you expect when only one person is making them (or at least when I was there.)
This place rules. It's the best kept secret for a great sandwich at a great price in the Financial District/China Town. It's cash only so hit the ATM first.
Agree with what others had said. Great little spot with delicious sandwiches.  Will be coming back here often.
Great deli. Got my staple- turkey avocado and pepper jack on dutch crunch. It was fantastic. Fresh ingredients. Well assembled. No complaints.
Clean, fast, friendly, delicious, fresh, loads of choice, not too fussy, well executed. Everything you need from a sandwich bar. Love this place.

I don't know why, but I LOVE this place. Perhaps it's the feeling I get for supporting a small mom and pop shop. I've been here probably over 50 times in the past few years and I get one thing. The chicken salad sandwich with everything. Dutch crunch bread. Add jalepenos. Man, it's taste so good!!!  Can't get a simple, amazing sandwich for such an affordable price. They get my business. I fill my stomach with goodness. I save money. Everyone wins!  :)

Good Luck Cafe's kitchen is smaller than a hot dog stand, they sell bagel sammies(2.5), sammies (6ish) using boar's heads meat, sodas, expresso. since there was a small line. skipped the sammie since i had only 5 minutes for my quarter....
Great and simple sandwich shop!
Cash only!

Simple. Hearty. Delicious. I was craving a good hearty sandwich on Dutch Crunch bread (I just moved back to the Bay Area after 9+ years... Dutch Crunch bread was on my list of things to eat). I ordered a chicken sandwich on dutch crunch with avocado (hold the mayo and tomato), and it was the best darn sandwich I've had in a long time. It tasted so fresh and it hit the spot. The sandwich itself is huge and with a bag of chips, it came out to $8. That's what I'm talkin' about! I highly recommend GLC!
Simply delicious sandwiches made by a very friendly couple!
Food: 4

Dirt cheap and delicious.  This is a prime spot for take-out dim sum.  Language and waits not a problem at all.  Astounding amount of tasty stuff for a few bucks.  Bring cash--the credit card machine is still out of service.

Very cheap, delicious dim sum.  Better to go early in the day as it is fresher and you have more choices.  We got 6 pieces for $3.80. Wonderful mid day snack.  Ask for the spicy sauce they keep in the fridge, although it is not homemade, it's awesome.  We had the shrimp/veggie(our favorite) BBQ pork buns were awesome(boyfriend says) the pork dumpling we had wasn't so much our fav bc it was dried out.  It's a take out spot.

Point to order dim sum freshly cooked and/or straight out of the steamers. There are a couple of cozy tables between the counter and the beverage refrigerators. Eat in or take out. Good flavors, great 'snap' to the shrimp in the har gow, very reasonably priced. I'll be back. Only problem was that there was no mustard available for my take out order. .
This place gets three and a half stars
The best sesame buns ever! They also had this spinach shrimp thing that was so good! Everything was really good. Just pick what looks good. Informal communal table in back. Cash only. The best!
Excellent quality for Chinese Standard of Dim Sum. I discovered via a food tour and I am really impressed. This will be my go to place.

I went here wanting to look for some authentic dim sum.   The reviews were mostly positive on Yelp so thought I'd check this out.    With a name like "DELICIOUS", you can't go wrong, right?  Well...I was disappointed to see how tiny the place was...only one table and then there's a back area with staff.   Not much in terms of ambiance but it made up in authenticity since I was in Chinatown.    I decided on two shrimp dumplings, tofu, and one potsticker, which only set me back $2.50.  Not bad at all.    I was hoping they'd have the mini golden egg custard tarts that I've eaten at a couple larger dim sum places, but they didn't have it (or she didn't understand me...*LOL*).  I didn't see it though so I'm thinking they didn't have it.
The name nailed it.
Not much to choose from the day we stopped in.  All I can say is, fabulous har gow!
I love cheap lunches!

I feel bad giving this place two stars cause I love to support the hole in the wall small business, but I just don't like being served cold food, nonetheless cold dimsum. I suppose I could just time it so I come right when things are just brought out, or I could find a microwave, but the thing I love most about dim sum is it coming to me piping hot from a cart. It loses its charm when it's been sitting out on trays for hours covered in saran wrap.

Delicious Dim Sum is a simple and straight forward restaurant, much like its name.  It's tiny - there is only one table inside, so you'll probably be taking your order to-go.  There is usually just one lady at the front, with a second worker coming down periodically to refill the dim sum trays.  There are handwritten menus along the wall, and though they don't have any English menus, the lady at the counter will happily go through her entire dim sum selection and explain what each item is.
Definitely the best har gow (shrimp bonnet) around the block - though smaller in size.  Skin is thinnier than others and the shrimp is crisp.  Great foundations for a successful har gow.

This is only a partial review, but from the small sample I've had the pleasure of trying, my heart has been won over. I ordered an order of the har gaw and the siu mai, two staples dim sum items I use to judge the worth of any dim sum place.
Great dim sum nice people really inexpensive. Nothing fancy but right to the point. Would definetly return for more.
This place is my go-to place for cheap dim-sum in SF now. After happening upon this place two years ago, I've been back several times whenever I'm in the chinatown area.

Craving for some delicious, quick, cheap dim sum? Look no further, this is it!  3 har jiao (and most of their items) for just $1.80!  We spent $16 bought enough food for 4 meals!  *seating limited. You may have to stand outside of their store. There's only one table, yes only one, in the entire store.
Stopped in on the way to the office since I have a short day and need to make the most of my time at work with no lunch hour out.  Spending my time in the useful occupation of yelping, then.
We ordered potstickers and shrimp cilantro dumplings. They were cheap and good. How're there was an eyelash steamed into the dumpling.

As the name suggest, this place is pretty delicious. This place is also cheap for a quick fix. We ordered the following for $19: 6 Sui mei, 6 haw gow, 3 chive dumpling, 3 bbq steam bao, order of shrimp noodles and a 7up.
Good dim sum but nothing earth shattering. Great prices. This place is busy and there was a long line
I woke up and the thought kept nagging at me like a child repeatedly chanting for a cookie: We had to get dim sum today.
Dont let the looks fool you. The place is great food worth the wait. Just have your finger ready to point no english menu.

They really need to expand.   There's one table so you basically have to get it to go, but they have the best dumplings I've ever had.  The veggie and shrimp ones are very highly recommended.  The fried ones are good too.  and the price is awesome.  Must try!

Fresh, plump dim sum for bargain prices. The har gow is delicious and so are the chive dumplings in the translucent wrappers. I think they oil the dumplings so they won't stick together but it leaves a slick film on the lips. The sticky rice wrapped in banana leaf is fragrant and hearty but also too oily for my taste. Take out only.
cheap, fresh, delicious

I came here because "Good Mong Kok Bakery" was out of everything! Delicious Dim Sum was fully stocked and I pretty much ordered one of everything. It is a to-go place with only one table in the back. We decided to eat in the back. Chinese ladies were as usual, strictly business and not too friendly. We sat in the back and enjoyed our meal. Dim Sum was perfect temperature and soft.. Shrimp dumpling was not skimpy as most places. Prices are very decent, if not cheap. As we were done with our meal, one of the ladies pretty much slammed a whole rack of frozen dim sum onto our table and began using it as her own table. What the... Maybe she knew we were done eating because we had put all the trash together to throw away..? Whatever, dim sum was good and I expected her to be rude anyways. Haha. She shouted "thank you!" as we left.
Their shrimp dumplings are their biggest sellers. Hubs likes the chive dumplings. You can pass on the pan fried turnip cake - too dense.They also have lots of buns and pastries to choose from.

I walked forty minutes from the Caltrain just to get some Delicious Dim Sum! These perfect little dumplings are flavorful, cheap and has a lot of filling. My favorite dumpling is the shrimp and cilantro dumpling followed by the shrimp dumpling and pork dumpling. For about $7, I got 7 dumplings, 2 eggrolls, 1 potsticker and a sesame ball! Don't forget the soy sauce and chili paste that you can find on the tiny dining table in the back. Sure there's nowhere to sit if the one table is taken. Just eat outside standing up. Once you eat these delicious dumplings, you won't even care anymore!
I love this place very cheap and excellent food and service.  Every time I am in China town I stop by here for food. I would say for $3 you can be full.
'Delicious Dim Sim' isn't just a braggadocios name, it's a literal one as well!

We had no idea how lucky we were to snag the one and only table in the entire place until a family that looked like they were straight out of a National Lampoon's Vacation movie mad dogged us until we left. Or were we really lucky? I just don't know. In our defense, we were the only people in this joint when we walked through the door, which didn't last long - the place was quickly swarmed.

The main reason we checked this out this place out is the review of our very own San Diego Elite Yelper - Maria C and her friend Tracy.  We did realize, it's a takeout place with a small table if you decide to eat there (Maria said so).  They do have soft drinks avail to drink.
This is indeed delicious dim sum. This is a great place for a quick, cheap and delicious bite.
Dim Sum is Delicious.
Great Dim Sum for a few dollars. Just hole in the wall Snack place. Veggie ones the best

Very yummy dim sum dishes at less than $2 per order.  Each order comes with three pieces and is freshly made.  Since this place is popular, the food turnover is excellent.  The staff doesn't really speak English and the place is cash only, no dine in.  Those are the only downsides, but for a quick breakfast for on the go, this is a great place for some quality dim sum!  We ended up buying the food and walking a few blocks over to eat at the Transamerica building/park.
Their steamed Dim Sum selections are delectably delicious!

The "Soup Nazi" came to mind as I was ordering the dim sum....food was great, but friendliness was not at the top of the list. Don't get me wrong - it's more of a compliment than a negative thing! You just need to know what you're ordering and not ask any questions.

I am. It sure why there is a huge line at the the dim sum house on Stockton as opposed to this one. This one is excellent and their dim sum portions are large. The shrimp har how is awesome but I like the stuff green veggie ones the most. Ladies were always nice to me as well
Order ahead and early - no line when I get there at 11:20am

This tiny hole in the wall restaurant has got to be one of the best place I've ever had Chicken katsu Curry.  Chicken was amazingly moist.  Battered was thinly coated so it's crispy on the outside.  Curry sauce was flavorful.  I asked for spicy and it had enough kick to it.  There were only a few seats (stools) though.  Just grab a quick lunch/dinner and go type restaurant.

The curry here is delicious and filling. They are really generous with the meat and sauce. Not much seating room so be prepared to take out if you can't get a seat. Totally worth it though! The staff are very nice too. Even if you're not normally a fan of curry, you will probably enjoy their Japanese curry. It's so yummy!
LIQUID GOLD.

Muracci's is the place to go on a nice chilly day in the city. It's worth making the 15 minute walk to the FiDi for their Japanese curry. The place can get very busy during the lunch hours on the weekdays, so try and make it out there before noon.

I love Japanese curry, and Muracci's is definitely one of the better places in SF. I think the meat Muracci provides is top notch, but I think there curry isn't "the best" in SF. The curry is still awesome though. I'd recommend the Chicken Katsu Curry with Veggies.
delicious. order online and then walk in, don't be afraid to skip the line & walk up to the front for your order!
One of my favorite lunch place.

I've heard many raving reviews of Muracci's from friends and coworkers. I finally had a chance to go as I was at Topsy's across the street. I got the Chicken Katsu with Curry. I think the curry was awesome, it had the perfect amount of spice. However, you don't get as many pieces of chicken katsu as I would like, but at least the breading ratio to chicken is appropriate. You're not just eating fried junk.  The people working there are fairly nice and attentive. Overall, it was an alright experience.
I've been dying to try Muracci's and I finally am working in SoMa/FiDi!
So soooo delicious. I got the chicken curry and the flavor was incredible and bold. I will most definitely be back for it. It lost 1 star because I felt there were few pieces of chicken in the curry.
I don't like here, food is fine, but the shopkeeper is not honest. I ask one extra rice , he ask me to pay price as the steamed rice. That's not about $1.00, that's the attitude for business.
The curry here is average. Nothing spectacular. Prices are moderate. We just stopped here for lunch while in the financial district. The place is tiny. Needs more flavor in the sauce.
I can't describe how much I miss having a good Muracci's for lunch, no matter what day of the week it is.
Tastes good, but a bit heavy for me. Probably a 3.75 stars, impo.

Love love that this place exists! Legit japanese curry!! I heard they're are long lines for lunch, but theres not much of a price difference between lunch and after that. I went around 5:30, it closes at 7. There wasn't many people, or a line, and I got to sit down and eat. I got the Chicken katsu which was breaded perfectly from the panko. The sauce I got "Mild" but it still had a bit of a kick in the flavor! I got it with white rice, and nothing beats japanese white rice made in a japanese rice cooker! My only problem was the Chicken Katsu was only a few pieces. Probably 10 at most.  I never finish my food, let alone the meat, and at this place there was so little chicken that I finished it... /: I'd go again once more to try the Pork Katsu and their Curry Pan. But I won't get the Chicken katsu since it wasn't filling.
It was very good and a large portion. However way too pricey for a curry plate. Starts around $8. After a vegetable here and a tofu there, you're looking at $12+ meal.
The line looks long, but your food comes super quick so don't stray away from this place just because of the line.
I went around 6pm and they were out of katsu (and pretty much everything else except chicken and beef). So go early if you want variety!

Japanese curry is one of the most popular dishes to eat in Japan. They have curry over rice, curry over noodles, or curry bread. My favorite? Definitely the curry over rice. The chicken katsu over rice was served on a large plate with some pickled vegetables. You can pick between white or brown rice, or you can even do half half. You can also pick the level of spiciness.
First time and loved the curry!  No wonder this place gets packed at lunch!  Went before NOON and was able to grab the only little table!
The food was ok and the service was terrible. The kid at the front didn't notice us and we had to go to him twice to get seated.
I used to really hate Japanese curry.. for some reason I always imagined it to have a lot of cornstarch and be just too.. thick.

I used to love this place so much. Delish curry and love the pickles. Today I had a sad experience. I used the restroom and left my curry on my table I was sitting out and the guy cleaning up threw out my curry. I was very sad because he did not offer to make me another batch or anything.
This place had really good Chicken Katsu. The line wasn't too bad either, although we went pretty late into lunch (1:15pm) so that may have helped a lot.
Yummy curry from a tiny hole in the wall (emphasis on the TINY!)

We went to Akiko's trying to get a table for dinner, however they were all full. Seeing this place was really close by with good reviews we decided to stop by. No line at all 30 minutes to closing so that was a plus!
The food here is not consistent. Sometimes is too spicy and sometimes is not. The last time I tried is too spicy that I have to keep drinking water and still couldn't finish the meal.
Went to Muracci last night, because Yelpers seem to love this place.

Made it in time before they closed. I was so sad to hear when I first walked into the door thr owner said "no more ebi or any katsu" one look at me he said hold on let me check. Came back and whisper to me just for you we still have katsu left. I was so happy made my day for a first timer trying their curry. Anything curry this is the way to go. Happy belly!
Must try:
I give this 4 solid stars.
Pros:

Whenever I try Japanese curry at a restaurant, I'm always disappointed. This place does it right! I love their curry. It's not watered down and very flavorful. Their curry pan is also delicious and very cheap.
Chicken karaage was awesome. There's always a long line during lunch so call ahead.

OMG, where has Muracci's been all my life? Nothing will ever be the same since I tried Muracci's for the first time three days ago. Since then, I can't stop thinking about curry tonkatsu.  At night, I lie in bed thinking about curry tonkatsu, and my first thought upon waking up, is curry tonkatsu. I've had curry tonkatsu twice in three days, and although I had one for lunch a few hours ago, I'm thinking about getting it again for dinner.
must try if you're ever in the area. I love their chicken katsu curry. sometimes if they're not busy they'll let you replace rice with noodles but you'll just have to pay a little more.

I had the Chicken Teriyaki. The chicken is cooked fresh on the grill and the teriyaki sauce tasted great. I only had one issue: they didn't give me enough of the sauce. It was the perfect amount for the chicken, however there was none left for the rice (so i didn't end up eating much of it).
Good food. Katsu don and curry were great. Quite dirty though - dirty table, dirty chair. Would highly recommend to go.
I found Muracci's on the SF.Eater's best meals under $10 list and since I work in FiDi I decided to give it a whirl.
The most amazing Chinese food I have ever had!!!! Low key hole in the wall that is worth trying!!!

OMG, the food at this place is amazing! Quality, quantity and price are on point! If you don't know what to pick from the menu I really REALLY recommend the chicken curry plate, and to be honest I think one plate is more than enough for 2 people. The only downside is the service, if it wasn't for that I'd give it 5 stars because the food flavor really blew my mind

Chinatown is always my favorite area to go when I'm craving legit asian food, and never go expecting amazing customer service or a beautiful interior. I came across this place and read about their Salt and pepper crab. I was a little disappointed when I found out that the price had raised from $16 to $19. It was a bit too salty for my liking yet I ended up taking it home and eating it the next day and it was just right. Nothing too special or horrible about this place. Knowing that I have other favorites in the area, not sure if i'd come back.

I read through the reviews, found the location on a busy Saturday night and was placed at large table with two other couples. Ok, communal seating, fine. I ordered 2 beers, steamed rice, salt and pepper shrimp, and a beef stew hot pot. I was served two beers and hot tea first. As the lady cleaned the table and the tea cups with the same dirty tag, I passed on the tea. Then 2 minutes later came a small plate of shrimp...ten minutes later, some rice, and then 5 minutes after that a beef stew clay pot. Very strange way of serving as the shrimp were cold by now. The shrimp we ok, much more salty than peppery, and the beef stew should be called tripe and tofu stew because that made up 80 percent of the dish. I'll definitely pass on this place next time in China town.
good stuff, don't often eat in chinatown, good spot to eat, good food!
Best Chinese food I've ever had. This is a real hole-in-the-wall, you'll miss it if you don't look carefully. It's upstairs with a street level entrance, and looks super sketchy, but it's amazing.

We had the seafood clay pot, honey walnut shrimp and salt and pepper port with rice. Everything was delicious, especially the clay pot with chunks of garlic and ginger. The restaurant is in a small room upstairs.
Best clay pots:

Best Chinese food I've ever had!  Fresh potstickers. They were thicker than I'm used to which i like and the sauce was perfect for it. Sweet and spicy. The Kung pao chicken was the prefect amount of spicy and the meat was tender. The mongolian beef with prawns was also very good.  Fairly large portions. I would highly recommend eating here.
Been coming here ever since I was little! I always bring friends visiting from out of town here for some 'authentic' cantonese food. It's one of the only restaurants worth visiting in Chinatown.
I love this place despite of its shady-ness. I've been there 4-5 times, every time I loved the food but wished they had a better dining environment.
Best spring rolls I've ever had. Great place to sit and enjoy the view over grant street and relax for a few while eating!
I had spring rolls and Singapore style noodles.   Both were excellent.  Servings were much larger than I expected so I only ate half my meal.

I was craving salt and pepper crabs, but didn't want to pay the premium at R&G Lounge. I was disappointed that although they advertised crabs for 19$, they didn't have the inventory. However, I was able to substitute the crab with lobster (not on menu although ginger lobster is). The lobster was on the small side, but was tasty and satisfied my cravings for deep fried shellfish.
The service is horrible and you're lucky if you get a drink but the food is really good and makes up for the crappy service
8/31/14: Amazingly disappointing.  I spent significant effort convincing my friends to get Chinese food this night, and after they finally agreed we ended up with this...
I will give a negative 5 stars if possible! Ordered a lobster and it looked more like a crawfish! Apparently, they treat tourists differently from the locals!

Lunch specials are very cheap which is why it's around 3 stars. I ordered the braised tofu with fish lunch special, husband got the mongolian beef and a side of potstickers (6). They forgot to put fish in my dish, but when I brought it up, they were quick to fix it. There was only 1 chef and 1 sous chef when I was here so food took a very long time (from waiting in line to getting food it was 45min).
Food, service, and atmosphere are all good & worth the visit. Complimentary green tea is a pleasant, inviting touch :)
good food!

I crave Chinese food on average twice a week so I've tried just about every decently-reviewed place in Chinatown. You'll walk up a shady flight of stairs to get to the often-crowded HK Clay Plot, but don't be alarmed, you're in for a treat. I've been here 4+ times and I'm a firm believer.

I'm glad we came here after the incident at R&G Lounge where we receive horrible service and were rudely ignored by the lady at the front desk. Here at this restaurant, we were kindly greeted by the waitress and everyone was very polite. Good service and good food. Very pleased with this place.

We ordered the family combo meal for 4 which serves about 4-8 people. It was definitely a lot of food!  Was there on a Saturday night around 8:30 and they were packed!  The food was awesome its authentic home made food!  Also this place is hot! You don't want to be cozy here!  :) You have to wait in a queue and when tables are open the waitress will come out to ask for who's next.  This restaurant is upstairs, just look out for the signs outside!

This place is so good that my tight circle of friends would not dare to speak of it by name.  We called it "the upper room".  This is because we did not want other people at work finding out about it and then when we show up there for a nice lunch to see a table full of jerks from work there.  This place has spiritual significance to me because it was the first time I tasted Caola Ila Scotch.  It was where I met Lilly my favorite Chinatown waitress - who use to work at the Utopia - who introduced me to snow pea leaves as a vegetable dish to be enjoyed.  So, now that I am retired, I can sing loud and long about this very special restaurant.

We were looking for a late lunch in Chinatown and used Yelp to find Hong Kong Clay Pot.   We were seated only 45 minutes before they were to close but 3 or 4 tables were seated after us and we did not feel rushed.
This place has a tiny little entrance with stairs that lead up to the small restaurant. I thought it would be a lot bigger but instead, I walked up to what seemed like the size of a coffee shop.

After searching yelp for good place to eat in the Chinatown area of San Francisco my family decided to try Hong Kong Clay Pot.  The location was great being at one end of our grant street trek and near the fortune cookie factory.  At first we were not too sure about climbing the stairs, as well as the ambience of the surrounding area, but the extra climb paid off.  When we arrived we were promptly seated at one of the large round tables.  The lady that greeted us was very nice, and very to the point, in fact everybody who helped us were quite friendly.  The dinning room was decorated with simple yet traditional décor.  My family and I ordered the Mandarin family dinner for four which came with won ton soup, sweet and sour chicken, prawn fried rice, pot-stickers, garlic prawns, and Mongolian beef (which we substituted with chicken chow mien), and beef with greens (bok choy).  I also ordered the curry chicken clay pot as well.  Let me start off with the pot-stickers, which were the first to go.  The size of them were huge compared to many other restaurants, and both orders were cooked perfectly; crisp on the bottom warm filling and soft on the top, yes we ordered more.  The curry chicken was also outstanding; it came out still boiling in the clay pot filling the table with its aroma.  Overall every plate of food we had was great.  All of the tastes were fresh, the bok choy tasted like fresh bok choy, while not being masked by the beef gravy.  The sweet and sour wasn't heavy or greasy, the won ton soup light and flavorful.  If I could give four and a half stars I would.  Overall great food, great price worth the stair climb.
I like the authentic food. It's not fake Americanized Chinese food. We had the ong choy, the salt & pepper pork chops and the frog legs. The pork chops were the best!
It is very very delicious!!!  I love the vegetable! "Fermented tofuwater spinach"
Lobster is quite good. A lot of ppl coming in...
Eating in Chinatown is a gamble, and I don't have any knowledge.  So we relied on yelp.  Hong Kong Clay Pot got 4 stars, so we figured it was safe.

We were visiting San Fran and tried this place out because it had better reviews than other places. Quick seating and food was delivered quickly. We ordered pot stickers, Mongolian Beef, and Kung Pao Chicken. Pot stickers were ok but we enjoyed the beef and chicken. Both were on the spicy side. If you look like a tourist (which we were) they will give you the regular menu that's much more expensive. Make sure and order off the lunch/specials menu. It's 1/2 the cost!
Get here early cause this place gets packed. The food is legit, Mongolian beef is bomb! It's pretty crammed inside so if your shopping or have a stroller (we did) leave it in the car.
Look carefully, you have to find the set of stairs sandwiched between two shops.
The wait was over an hour at 8pm. We got in at 7, after 30 minutes. But every minute was worth it! Excellent Chinese, and the clay pits looked awesome (missed it unfortunately).

Cheap and good hole in the wall Chinese food in Chinatown. If you are not really looking you will miss it. Came for dinner and there was a line out the door and down the stairs. Had the salt and pepper shrimp, seafood clay pot, chicken pan friend noddles and cashew chicken.

While the signage above the doorway is not obvious the address and Yelp maps are spot-on. One door was propped open with the lunch and dinner menus in a small basket. Head up the steep but do-able stairs and go right at the top. (to the left are the restrooms). With sitting for about forty (if they were crammed) this is not a huge place, but you've got about ten tables in one large room. most tables are for four (two comfortably) there are several larger rounds with lazy-susan spinner in the middle that work for six to eight.
Doesn't seem like much on the outside but huge portions for good prices. Good food as well!
Bless You Yelp! We followed the recommendations and  Everything was delicious.  We were the only non Asians there and might not have tried without the note about the sketchy stairs.

Talk about a hole in the wall! Almost literally!!! Passed it twice and didn't see it. Its just a set of stairs in between a few vendors. Look for it using the address! Once you get to the top of the stairs, you enter a small little restaurant. Very tight! but its authentic! Food was pretty good! The reviews on yelp were pretty accurate. I'm not sure about the women's bathroom, but the guys was TINY.

The food was ok. We had the pork roast and the tongue, which everyone talked about. The portions were large, the meat tender.. But that orange gravy sauce wasn't worth all the fuss.. Would recommend against using the bathroom! Friendly staff though
Had a great pork lunch today and sure did hit the spot.  Hubby had the oxtails and his gravy was also good.  This time I asked for corn instead of cabbage.

introduced by a friend we went.  people are nice. a typical Chinatown fast service restaurant. ordered pork chop and ox tail.  they are covered with the same type of sauce. cant tell what it is. looks like curry but isnt it.  very plain in taste... but very cheap too.  too much meat and not enough vege.

The waiter/cashier here is friendly.  Portions here are huge.  She gave me complimentary soup to go with my lunch order.  I ordered beef with tofu and the food came out hot and fresh.  I'm completely sold.

One of those hole in the wall restaurants in Chinatown. Like what my parents always say don't judge a restaurant by its appearance. Got seated and served fast. I got their black pepper short ribs over rice which came with a bowl of soup. The short ribs were nice and tender with gravy on top which went well with rice. They give you big portions for the price you pay for. In the end they also gave us cherry flavored jello. The staff here is very friendly and they make you feel like you are at home. Overall not a bad place to eat if you do not mind the ambiance of if you are just looking for a quick place to eat and get out. I will return later to try their pork chops as that is what they are known for.

This is an old-school hole in the wall restaurant that has been around for a long time. Five stars for their roast pork! It is really flavorful, moist, and tender....and I'm not the biggest carnivore. You get a choice of having gravy on top or curry along with some cabbage and rice. But I'm taking off a couple stars because their plates and utensils were not that clean the last time I went. When I said something, I'm pretty sure the waitress just took everything to the back and wiped it off with a towel...I could see her with the towel as the restaurant is not that big. When you ask for water, it comes out in a random cup, that could be from home, with questionable cleanliness also. Typical of a hole in the wall I guess.

The food was way too saucy, the tea was bland and Lemon jello square was not a very tasty finish. The service was very abrupt and substitutions were not allowed. Too many other choices to stop here again.
I liked this place.  Popped in for a quick lunch while in Chinatown.  For like $8 we got 3 courses, the food was pretty good, and the lil lady working was very sweet.
Best: Orange Peel Chicken, Pork Fried Rice, Mongolian Beef & Wonton Soup

This is a tiny hole-in-the-wall shop with some really freaking great food! The experience starts with a complimentary potsticker that rocked my socks. One of the best I've had and hugenormous as well. I ordered the oxtail over rice, which came out really tender and flavorful. After the meals were done, we were given complimentary jell-o. What a nice and refreshing way to end the meal! Though it was a tiny place, the ladies in the cafe were very nice and helpful and made us feel welcomed.
The food is cheap. It's greasy. It's Chinese.

It's small, kinda dirty and every single menu had different prices. The waitress (possibly the owner) was pushy with the soup and pretty much everything else. Unidentifiable objects in the soup. Meal came with "potstickers" which ended up being a single sticker on a small plate. All that said, the lemon chicken wasn't terrible but I can't say I'd come back again.

Went here after other highly reviewed placed had a 20 min or so wait. I have to say I was expecting a lot more. Sure you get a dim sum, bowl and soup with your meal but it was pretty standard and nothing if not below in terms of flavor of what I could find back in Phoenix, AZ which you'd think isn't saying much. It wasn't busy that's a plus but I needed to go to the restroom and was told they don't work which forced me to go to the nearby foot massage place and awkwardly ask if I could use theirs. Then, and I'm sure it's simply a matter of saving some money. When it was time to pay (little less than $15) I gave them my card only to be told they don't take them, cash only (which is marked nowhere outside as I double checked. I thankfully had $15 and so could only tip a few cents but that's something they should tell you or put signage for if so. One and done here.
I guess I'd be what you'd call a "new school" customer of New Lun Ting Cafe a.k.a. the "Pork Chop House" by the real Old G's.

I first discovered this restaurant in 2005 when boss at my old job used to order takeout from this place. I figured the food would taste like any other typical chinese restaurants in chinatown. Oh boy was I wrong. Their roast pork with corn and gravy is sooo tender!  I don't know how they do it but I guarantee you won't find better tasting pork in SF. Although the restaurant itself is tiny, I've never had a problem getting a seat in the mid afternoon on a weekend. I'll admit that it is a hole in the wall that many may over look and the decor definitely needs to be updated, but I like it like that. It's comfortable and the waitress is always really nice. Eat here. You won't regret it!

I came here for a late lunch, and we were seated right away. In busy Chinatown, this place is off of the main street and not the most impressive. However, opening up the Yelp app and seeing the four star rating, my friend and I decide to give it a try.
WOWZA, don't let the busier counterparts around fool you.

This restaurant is about as about good as it gets. I'm not normally one for Chinese restaurants; most tend to be way too greasy for me. But this little one had well-cooked, delicious food in generous servings. They have an excellently large variety of dishes to choose from, conveniently spread over several different menus. I got roast pork and my cousin chose to get a duck. Other members of our group bought lam and veggie items. All the dishes were amazing in both taste and presentation. The prices were relatively low, which is especially helpful as they unfortunately do NOT take credit cards. The friendliness and quality of the staff helped complete this extremely enjoyable dining experience.

A great hole in the wall find in a sea of otherwise questionable Chinese restaurants!  Annie the proprietor is fabulous and helpful.  The roast pork is great and worth returning to have.  Great spot and cheap
No wait to sit down (came at lunch time on a Wednesday)
I have tried their Roast Pork with Gravy Rice plate twice now.

This place is awesome! My dad and I both ordered the Roast Pork/Corn beef with rice and cabbage. Wow! Both meats were super juicy and tender! I love this hole in the wall restaurant. My dad's been coming here since 1968, and this is the first time I got to try it. The staff is friendly and down to earth. I will definitely be coming back!

Did the roast pork over curry - like everyone recommended, order the extra gravy.  Any meal comes with a bowl of soup (tasty vegetable soup!) and hot tea.  Total was $8.30 after tax, which is very reasonable for the portion you get, a huge portion of very tender pork (watch the fat...it is flavorful but...well...your call if you eat it all hehe) and the curry makes it go very well with the cabbage and rice.

first of all my family loves this place ! "pork chop house"  it is cheap eats. me not so much I don't really like curry and the pork has a curry gravy on it. floors are sticky and don't like the bathroom.
Tea & soup were good. Food was bland. Ordered the roasted pork and beef chow fun (forgive misspellings.) Pork was very fatty. Beef was very low quality. Jello is a nice touch.
Love this kind of G-food.

Great food.  Wife ordered pork chops, I ordered beef tongue, son ordered curry chicken and another (the picky eater) ordered a hamburger.  Everyone loved the food.  Great place.  I'd give it a five but the owner's sister said to give it a four because they don't want to raise the bar too high.  I laughed and agreed to her request.  Next time I'm back in San Francisco, I'll be back at to get more good home cooking at New Lun Ting.

This place, while not very attractive from the outside, is wonderfully authentic and has outstanding, warm service. The server was very patient with non-Chinese, explaining what was popular and what might suit american tastes (unfortunately exclusive of one another). The server recommended the Chinese beef stew. Wow. It was great. Don't expect luxurious cuts of meat. Instead we had some unique curs including tendon. I never had that but it was awesome. Don't judge a book by its cover applies here.

I ordered a chicken curry dish that was disappointing. Chicken was fatty and the dish only had white rice and chicken with curry sauce, nothing else. I have a struck gluten and dairy diet so I knew I had to be careful but I did not enjoy my dish much at all. Service was attentive despite the language barrier.
Get the roast pork
bomb dot com food!

5 stars for the pot stickers. 1 star for the sweet and sour chicken.  Please note, large quantities of red dye number 37 does not make the dish taste better! The veggies were good but very little chicken.  Note:  I made the mistake of going to the restroom to wash my hands... Think interstate gas station restroom.
Even though I've lived in SF for 30 years, last Sunday was the first time I've been to New Lun Ting Cafe. I wondered how come no one has told me about this place sooner. It is so good.
Their Roast Pork Rice with gravy and corn is TO DIE FOR. It's super juicy, moist, and tender. There mighty be a few hard to chew areas, but the fatty areas are just so, so good.

This is diner has stood still and unchanged for some 40 years. No gimmicks, no Groupon deals, no wifi....just down to Earth home style cooking! Big portions, good tasting and not costly. A working man's joint at that.
I couldn't sleep last night because all I could think about was the roast pork over rice from the pork chop hizzouse!
What can I say about the place we all lovingly referred to as 'Pork Chop House', when only Bachelors would eat there.
Wow, I can't believe I have walked past his place countless times in the last 2 years without trying it.

To be fair, this review is only for the wonton noodle soup. I have not tried other dishes. The soup was overloaded with MSG and wontons were mediocre - not recommended. One extra star is given for the jello they served as a complimentary dessert which helped me to leave feeling a little happier. On the contrary to my experience, the restaurant was pretty packed with Chinese diners so other dishes must be better.
Been passing by Lun Ting ever since I started my consulting Gig @ BPMCPA.  Today...I finally took the plunge!

I'm ABC and my point of reference is NYC Chinatown, and unfortunately I have yet to eat Chinese food in SF that I would eat again. Sorry, but Yin Du was no exception. Their noodle soup with brisket came with broth, noodles and brisket. What? Not even a sprig of cilantro? And 25% brisket, 75%gristle!?
They have improved! Noodles have a nice bounce, the wontons plump and juicy, and the soup full of flavor.  Super happy with it. :)
They're not excellent.
Best congee in the city! My friend and i have been looking for a real home-cooked porridge like Asian style and now we got this spot.

Nice bowl of good soup here, I got the wonton noodle soup and the broth was great and wontons were well prepared. I got a side order of the Chinese broccoli and my bill was like $10...pretty good deals! Portions were alright, I could've left feeling more full

The best won ton noodle I've had in the city. Everything is handmade from scratch. You literally watch them wrap the wontons before they cook it. The wontons are big and plump and the wrapper is silky smooth and just thin enough. The noodles are also not too heavy and they don't give you too much so it doesn't overpower the wontons. They also throw in some veggies, which is always a plus. The broth is also amazing - so simple, but so flavorful.
Small shop located near the edge of Chinatown. I actually been here a couple of times and this is a great family owned restaurant for a quick and cheap lunch!
Great beef brisket wonton noodle soup loved it! My son couldn't stop eating it and very friendly service!

Craving for wanton noodles, heres the place. Old school traditional wanton noodles soup. The skin of the wanton is so thin that it just melts right into your mouth, the broth is just the way I would want it, exactly the kind of street food you would expect in Hong Kong. There are some off menu specials and I've yet to try them, but I'm sure you could ask; I'm pretty sure its stir fried liver and kidneys with ginger and spring onions, looks like most of the tables are having at it! Anyhow, it's affordable and the portions are just enough. Think I've been here more than 6 times ever since I've moved in 2 months ago!
Cheap, ok noodle house in Chinatown. Not too much to it. $5 for a bowl of wonton noodles. We just wanted Asian noodle soups and did a quick yelp search. It's whatever. Cheapie and ok.

Best beef brisket I've ever had! Rice noodle and wonton are also good. The owners are always nice and work really hard. When it gets busy they would seat you with other people to share a table... well it's Chinatown. Cash only

Stopped in here for lunch while walking around Chinatown.  It looked busy, always a good indicator, and was a small place down Pacific rather than a large restaurant on Grant - I prefer that my patronage is helping a smaller family shop than large touristy restaurant.  The beef brisket wonton noodle soup was great!  It had a flavorful broth, noodles and wonton were done well, and the brisket was good texture (melt away while having some substance).  As a single, I did end up sitting with some other folks - family style seating - which I don't mind but be prepared if you're not used to this, even as a group of two or three you will likely have company.  I would have liked to try some other menu items but the soup filled me up good enough.  Would recommend for good soups.
Yummy! homemade goodies!

Great noodles - they are nice and crunchy just the way they're supposed to be! Soup is delicious and not over seasoned with msg. Found a new spot for wonton noodles for sure! Correction on business hours though. They close at 7:30 everyday. Not at 8. And they will turn you away even if you walk in at 7:33pm :(
went here for breakfast since I wanted something simple. The service was good but the only thing is that this place is cash only

Came here from all of the great yelp reviews.  We must have came in on an off day on the Mid-Autumn Moon Festival.  The staff was really overwhelmed and their stress definitely came off strong along with poor service even for Chinese standards.  Long lines at restaurants isn't anything new but I think this place never experienced it before.  The only waitress would hurriedly stick people in any seat that was open.  Getting anyone's attention was next to impossible so I had to go to the cashier each time I needed anything.  As expected, small portions but the noodle soups and dry noodles were pretty good.  Skip the combo congee.  Its burning hot, tasteless, and lacking in meat.  My tongue is still numb from it writing this review days later.

We have been looking for a good wonton noodle soup and porridge for some time (we love the wonton noodle and porridge in New York).  When we saw the 4 star rating on yelp we were excited especially when we got there, there was a line waiting for a table.  We finally sat down sharing a table with another couple, we ordered 2 wonton noodle soup and a bowl of porridge.  The wonton was so so, small and not enough shrimp, the noodles are softer than the authentic Cantonese noodles.  The porridge was not good at all, the pork liver looked like it's been sitting out overnight, it was tough and very dark in color, the consistency of the porridge was very soupy.  We strike up a good conversation with the couple we shared table with, and when we left we forgot to leave a tip, the woman (she wasn't even our wait person) ran out the restaurant after us yelling "you didn't leave a tip", we went back in and paid the tip.  It was very humiliating, the whole restaurant was watching us as we went back.  There wasn't any service, it was a sit down fast food, no refill on our drink, just took our order and brought our food.
Wow, pretty good flavors for the beef noodle wonton soup, and super cheap prices.  Granted, portion size is a bit small, but still a great value.  I would totally go back.

My favorite noodles.  This place is great.  Don't sit at a table for 4-6 if you're 1-2 or sometimes people will try to sit down with you.   I guess that's how people roll at yin du.  It's never happened to me but I've seen it a bunch.

This is my favorite gem of chinatown. It's unpretentious and has very affordable traditional Hong Kong food that transports me straight to nostalgia. I always get either the congee or the wonton with beef brisket. It's really savory and great portioned. No msg.
Probably my 10th time here now and each time I come here, I always get the wonton beef stewed noodle soup. They are to die for.
How could I ever give this place a bad rating when everything is so cheap and fulfilling? I swear that everything on the menu was under $6. So worth it.
$4.78 is what I pay for, for an order of to go wonton noodle soup! Noodle, wonton and vegetable ratio is perfect.

Truthfully, the one thing that drew me to come into this restaurant is the huge picture of a wonton noodle soup plastered on the window. That picture just looks perfect. (Kind of like judging a book by its cover...)

This place is a winner.  Packed with locals and you might need to share a table.  The place is extremely clean and prompt friendly service.  We received a complimentary cup of hot teas when we sat down.  My sister and I ordered each a noodle bowl with wontons and noodles. We shared a plate of chicken curry and rice.  The total bill was $16.43 for two of us. What a deal!  Will definitely coming back on our next visit. Also a very clean bathroom.
Had the wonton soup.  Was very tasty.  The fact they don't take credit is about the only bad thing I can say about the place.  Would go again.

The best service ever! Unexpected for a noodle place this small. The beef brisket with noodle, noodle soup or rice is really tasty! If it wasnt for the long drive, we would have ordered food to go too!!!

Five bucks well spent. It's standard good wonton soup - nothing exceptional but it's a reasonably priced lunch and great on a cold gloomy day. However,  I could've skipped the cold milk tea -- it was not worth the extra beverage splurge. We came around 1:30 pm so there were still a good amount of people but a nice cozy spot available for Moe M. and me to catch up over some steaming bowls.

Yes yes yes finally, another place in Chinatown that I actually like. While their offerings remind me, in a way, of a severely limited version of Hai Ky Mi Gia's menu, I suppose their dishes are actually fairly different. Okay, ignore that comparison.
Had 4 and 8 and a side of pig feet. Heaven!!!

Cheap comfort food in a CLEAN Chinatown shop! The boyfriend and I ordered the stewed beef and wonton noodle soup for $4.95 each! I regret not getting any noodles because the portions were on the small size, will remember for next time. The bf suspected his ho fun were packaged rather than fresh, but no biggie. The wontons were also smaller but tasted like fresh homemade ones with thin skin and firm filling. The broth and beef really hit the spot! I wanted to order some rice so I can have something with which to finish that tasty flavorful broth.
This is a small, spartan joint right beside a certain other Chinese restaurant that's packing them in. But that's not the point.
Get the roast pork and broccoli with oyster sauce! Soo good! Our service was great, constant refills of free tea.
They make good wonton noodles. I've had wonton noodles from HK, and Vancouver and these Wonton noodles are alright, good in SF standards.
Great wonton noodle soup. the stewed beef rice noodle soup is also a gem! The milk tea is amazing! Great value for the money
Pretty good food.

The service is terrible.  They don't refill your tea or water.  Also, they just drop off the food and expect you to pass around the food to the right person.  The wonton is made only with pork.  I couldn't taste any shrimp in there.  The noodle is pretty good.  It is snappy, the way I like it.
We ordered #4, #16, #23 #36, as well as a pork wonton noodle soup. Everything was delish!

It's cash only but you'll only need a few dollars. Save the money you'd use for coffee and a muffin to come here instead. The wonton noodle soup with duck is really good. Clean and clear broth with tender pieces of roasted duck and wontons swimming in egg noodles.

It's a slight trek from FiDi, but it's definitely worth it if you want a good deal. Legit wonton duck wonton noodle soup for $4.95. They give around three pieces of juicy duck with the noodle soup, and it's cheaper than Hon's wonton noodle soup down the street, which increased their prices to $5.25 for a bowl now.
So much fun! The servers are all true Italian and are always in high spirits singing and dancing to fun Italian songs.  The food is excellent!  What more could you ask for?  Excellent for birthdays!

Been here a couple times on my visits to SF. Most of the food is delicious. I made the mistake of getting the basic pasta in ragu last time (I'm a sucker for anything lamb), and it was very bland and the meat was dry. Really hope I recheck this review again before i go back because I definitely don't want that again. The other entrees my party ordered were definitely worth going back for.
Amazing!! Dropped in on Saturday night with friends. We did make a reservation.
D E licious!  Custom made gnocchi with the lamb ragu was great.  Tiramisu was one of the best I've had.
My friend introduced me to this Italian restaurant and I love it!

Went there on a Saturday night and they were extremely busy.  Seems the focus of quantity and getting as many customers in and out as possible.  My pasta dish was OK, but could have used a little more flavor. Servers were friendly but, had to wait a long time for my food and drink orders
Ordered the Pesto fettuccine. Absolutely amazing - reminded me of pasta in Rome. Service is wonderful - all the waiters are very nice and always at your service.
Last night we came here for the first time...

It's cold, I'm hungry and good pasta sounds right. We're in Little Italy and the expectation was there. However, when eating time came, my papardelle pasta tasted like spaetzle (thick, hard and too doughy), the ground lamb was cooked on really high heat so the meat was dry and the sauce was okay. It's not okay to serve bad pasta. I had no faith to continue on with dessert.

Excellent service. We were made to feel very at home within seconds and hope to return and bring our older children next time. Clearly many are returning customers who know the staff and owner well. Everything was excellent!

1st night in San Fran and someone suggest North Beach.  Looking for a great steakhouse NOT knowing we were in Little Italy.  Hey, we are both Italian, so not a bad find in my mind.  Problem was the streets were saturated with restaurants boasting tempting ambience and menus......we kept walking and walking and walked into the gentlemans club area of town and thought...great. what now?  Feet hurting and bellies growling we looked across the street and said...let's just eat here.  WHAT A FIND!!!!  We were so delightfully surprised at how good the food was and how happy and attentive the staff was.  I had the pasta with asparagus and salmon with cream sauce and my husband had the rigatoni with sausage , mushroom and brown sauce.  When in San Fran again, this a definite go to!!!

I absolutely love, love, love this place!!  We ate there two nights in a row in September, ten months after our first visit. I'm not kidding - the wait staff remembered us, where we're from, who was with us, etc. Such wonderful customer interface. Oh, and the food is amazing!! We had seared diver scallops, shrimp risotto and a wonderful Brunello di Montalcino.. The desserts were equally yummy. I inquired if they ever offer Torta della Nonna and the owner offered to have it for us next time, if we give him two days notice.  Can't wait to go back. Molte Grazie!!

I read through the other reviews and agree with all the 5 star reviews. This place delivers on both exceptional service and great quality of food. If you look at my other Yelp reviews I don't give out 5 star reviews that often so this place really impressed me!
I was in San Francisco for less than 48 hours and REALLY needed some Italian food in my belly. North Beach is obviously where it was, but how to decide on which restaurant?

I came here with a large group to celebrate my cousin's birthday on a Saturday night. Street parking is a nightmare, but I was lucky enough to find a spot nearby. We had reservations for 7:30pm but were not seated until our entire party arrived. We ordered a variety of dishes, but some of my favorites included the octopus carpaccio (carpaccio di polpo), spaghetti neri (squid ink pasta), paccheri golosi, and the mezzi rigatoni alla norcina. I've never tried octopus carpaccio before, but I am glad that this was my first encounter with the dish. The pasta dishes were executed perfectly- pasta was cooked al dente, portioned well, and full of flavor! Our group also ordered the fritto misto, which wasn't bad, but I felt the portion was a bit small, and the shrimp was overcooked as well. My sister ordered the seafood risotto, and although the risotto itself was cooked well, the mussels definitely overpowered the dish :(  Anyway, on to dessert! GET THE PANNA COTTA! Trust me, it was amazing. The following day I kept telling my boyfriend about how much I enjoyed the panna cotta, and I'm sure he wanted to slap me because I would not shut up about how good it was! Haha. I have to say that it was probably the best thing I ate that night, seriously, just do yourself a favor and order it! The staff was just exceptional! Very friendly, attentive, hard-working, and very happy! I love that they yell across the restaurant and speak Italian to each other, definitely adds to the overall atmosphere of the restaurant. I probably wouldn't recommend trying to have a heart-to-heart conversation here, as it is very loud, but this place is definitely a great place to celebrate any occasion Italiano styleee! Will definitely be back for more!! Grazie, È Tutto Qua!

This is seriously one of my favorite restaurants.   It always cures my nostalgia for Italy.   Great food, but the people are even better.   True Italians.   Yelling throughout the restaurant in Italian and always very happy.   You can't but be happy around them.

Sorry, dont understand the rave reviews...  Okay, the waiters are cute.  The restaurant was a bit too loud for me.  I had the pasta with seafood and while tasty, the calamari was overcooked and chewy (shrimp was good.)  The ravioli definately did not taste like home made and was just so-so.  The bread i can only describe as too flour-y.

This place was good. Came to eat here a night before a half marathon so we had to make reservation for a group of 10. Once we  were seated and we ordered, the food took like 45 minutes to come out, which I guess since it was extremely busy, it was understandable. Overall the food was great, I had the Fettuccini con Pesto and it was great!!!
This place offers some of the best italian food in Sam Francisco. I love their thin crust pizza. Can't wait to go back!
Super friendly staff. Great with our kids. They even remembered us from our last visit about 6 months ago. Food is delicious. Never had a meal we didn't enjoy.

Food is fresh, but the environment is too loud and the floors were filthy. The waiters enjoyed singing and playing, but barely wiped the table. They crank the music like it's a disco so they yell across the room to be able to hear each other. A lot of clapping, but not very attentive. The ingredients are fresh, but overall the pasta was quite bland as was their salad.

We just dined here last night.for our niece's birthday.  Since she had a soccer tournament in Petaluma and it would have too late to meet for dinner once they got all the way home to Redwood City, we decided to meet in SF for dinner. We had reservations and weren't seated right away, but not soon after getting a cocktail, so it was really no problem.  We had excellent service- these guys work hard and they are constantly on the move.  We were seated upstairs and I can only imagine that these guys get so tired going up and down the stairs.
Wonderful desserts. Great environment. Love the energy and good food here. Good place to visit.

I think there's no shortage of great Italian eateries but this one showed up in a few other travel site's recommends.. we didn't have much of a wait for not having a reservation that is. We were seated outside (ANY other day I'd have been fine with it because it was nice and warm.) But for some reason, when you see most of the eateries that are table lined on the street at night they are close off to the street and seem cozy.  Here, they are back a bit from the curb (which is always a plus) but there's no barrier to make you feel cozy. So once we sat down I looked around I decided I wanted to sit inside..the host was most gracious to get a table inside fairly quickly so that was really nice.. all in all for a busy Sat night without a reservation, we waited about 40 min or less.
You can't go wrong with anything on the menu here this place is simply amazingn along with the great staff and full bar
Where to even begin with this one!
Love the food and love the ambiance. The place is good for dates and family style dining. The waiters are amazing..energetic and resourceful

One of the best Italian restaurants I have been too! All the servers have great energy, very good looking and heavy Italian accents! Can't complain about one thing. The pasta dishes are to die for! We went there the both nights we stayed in the city, so delicious. We will definitely be returning customers.
The atmosphere is extremely loud ( we went not knowing that Italy was playing soccer that evening for the World Cup). However, the food was delicious! I would go back.

Authentic Italian food in North Beach. Being Italian myself, I can't help loving this restaurant. Their pizza is delicious and not too heavy, the menu offers a lot of choices and I especially like their Paccheri golosi.

Awesome dinner!  Everything was delicious. Bread was excellent. The desserts were great. Try the pannecotta!  The only thing lacking was the lamb was slightly under sasoned and the wait staff was trying to rush us out. We got a kick out of the wait staff speaking Italian.
Came here cuz of the yelpers...
This place is fantastic!  It's really great Italian food and the bustling ambiance is really fun.

Aunthentic Italian food located in the heart of Little Italy in San Francisco. Very busy place on a weekend. Service was helpful and kind. The food was not all that great. We came here because we were looking for a place to eat. As always, we yelped nearby places and came here because of the reviews. Totally dissapointed, my friend and I got sick from the pizza for the next three days :(
Went on a very busy at night. Food was good. Great service. The waitor spoke with an Italian accent and was knowledgeable on the food.

Stumbled upon this place as I was trying to look for a place for a late dinner. We decided to go here since it was one of the few restaurants that was still quite packed at 10pm. And glad we ended up here. Service was great, food was delicious! What more can you ask for?
Great hospitality and service. Must get the Bruschetta one of the best I've tasted.
My company had a reserved four-course meal here, and lemme tell you, every single damn course was DELICIOUS.
Food was great, service excellent. The place can get a little loud but that is because everyone is having so much fun. We ordered scallops and pasta. Overall great experience.
So great. So loud. So yummy. Homemade pasta that morning. Homemade bread. Waiters yelling in Italian to each other. I loved every second of it! :)

Golden Star is a Vietnamese restaurant owned by Cantonese folk in Chinatown. This might sound scary and bring up images of pound of MSG, but it really is not too shabby. I came for a Tuesday lunch with a friend, and there was already a wait for a table at 12. They are quite quick to get people in and out of the door, so you probably won't be waiting too long.

I HAD AN ANT IN MY SOUP!!! Terrible place! No customer service what so ever! We came in and the guy that was serving us was extremely unfriendly. But we didn't care much. UNTIL I saw a freaking ant in the soup I ordered! Unacceptable! I complained to one of the waiters, he didn't charge me for the soup but when he brought the check this lady came and started blaming me for not telling them earlier. Are you kidding me? Seriously? You really think that if I saw that ant earlier I would be eating your freaking soup?! You must be out of your mind! I have no idea why this place is still running. Never going back here again!
take me out to the pho game
Pho here is as good as it gets outside vietnam itself.

mMm......one of my fav. pho places for lunch! What i loveeee about this place is that they have REAL fish balls and fish cakes!!! Reminds me of when I was a kid any living near Chinatown. Yum, yum, yum! Fish balls meaning not the generic do do fish balls (uhm..ew?) but fish balls made of fish! Everytime I come here for lunch, I order that. I also love this place because they have freshly fried egg rolls. mMm...unlike the place near my work where they gave me colllddd and chewy egg rolls. RUDE! oh, and what else is a plus? their waiters are super nice! Love the service and love the food. Always stop by here when i'm feeling pho-y. Yummm!

I came here for lunch while on a business trip in SF and was not disappointed!  Although the restaurant seems a bit small and always busy they are surprisingly fast and definitely fit the lunch hour.  I tried the chicken rice plate; the chicken itself was nicely seasoned and juicy although the skin could have been a bit crispier.  I also tried the Vietnamese coffee which really gave me a mid day pick me up.

Solid good Vietnamese food.  Definitely try to eat family style so you can explore more options, and as with most Vietnamese restaurants be prepared for a loud environment.  I highly recommend their sweet and sour fish soup for any cold days where you want something warm and soupy.
Burger king outclasses this environment, but en the fancier vietnameese places envy the flavors and sensations golden star provides.
I don't get why other people gave this place a high rating. First of all, the street where this restaurant's on is just filthy. The stench doesn't help either.

This place has everything I want in a pho restaurant - super efficient, quick and consistent.  There is no BS here and you get exactly what you're expecting.  BF ordered his pho with only meat and no noodle and there was a LOT OF MEAT in there.  Cash only!
Ummm,  I don't know what all the fuss is about. This place was not good...

Stopped in for a snack - Soda chanh moi + egg rolls. Both hit the spot! The preserved plum drink brought back great childhood memories but I wish it was a bigger serving. The egg rolls used a rice paper wrapper which is not typical except when I have it at home. That was good but I needed more lettuce to wrap each roll. :) Nice break from the Chinese selection in the area.

I don't get the pho here but their vermicelli and rice dishes are really good!  My favorite is the vermicelli noodles with BBQ pork and imperial rolls.  I also like their Vietnamese coffee hot or cold.  I recommend calling to order for pick up because the place can get packed during lunch with a wait list sometimes.  The people that run the place are always really friendly and the service is fast.
The four spice chicken with imperial roll was decent. Average pho. Service was mediocre.
Excellent pho and great service.  This is a cute neighborhood spot.  No frills but the food is fresh and the portions large.

I had the Four Spice chicken with imperial roll. The chicken was juicy and well-seasoned, and the rolls were crispy and tasteful. I'm not a big fan of rice and the portion of rice was huge, so I didn't eat too much of it.
Came here with a few friends after looking at the reviews on yelp.

Excellent pho, cozy restaurant, and believe it or not, great service (something I never experience in Chinatown)!  I ate the Five-Spice Chicken and it was wonderful, tasty with generous portions of chicken as well as the noodle soup. Definitely recommend this place if you're in the Financial District/Montgomery area! ...Oh did I mention it was only $9? :)

Traditional Vietnamese restaurant just on the edge of Chinatown. The fried rolls were good but they used a different wrapper then the wonton wrappers I've had everywhere else. The pho was decent and was $6.50. The bowl wasn't massive but a.good size. I believe that Msg is used the broth which I do like. The cafe sua (thai iced tea) was good. They brought it out with the dripper and let it drip right in front of you. Pretty fun. I will try elsewhere next time.
MEDIOCRE PHO. RUDE SERVICE. BEWARE.
The reviews had me expecting more. Considering the Pho in the Bay Area, this place isn't bad. The broth was a little bland and noodles could have been cooked better. Their vermicelli was also so-so.
This place is definitely Golden alright. I've been to this place before when I was 12 years old and a tourist in SF, and now that I'm 22 years old and I work in SF I'm a regular during lunch hours.

I came down with some sort of cold this week so I have been hitting all the soup places near my work and Golden Star is definitely one of the best places that hit the spot. It is quite a walk to this place tucked away in China Town, but for the extra time it takes to get her, they make it up with speed.
Pho soup base was good. Felt they don't use lots of MSG.  Only negative was CASH ONLY.
Very limited menu for vegan options. I think there are only two items, although you might be able to substitute for tofu in a couple of places.

Hot steaming bowl of pho#1 is served with stoic and efficient service. But the broth tastes so good you don't need to add any condiments to make it more flavorful. Today, the noodles were slightly al dente and they skimped a bit on the meat, but I still left satisfied.
Still my favorite dining experience in Chinatown after all these years. Staff has remained the same and are quick to turnaround Vietnamese staples.
five spice chicken with imperial rolls, bomb! chicken is very flavorful, and they don't skim on the portions either.

I remember coming to Golden Star ages ago with high expectations since so many people and lists have ranked them at the top for pho. I returned with lower expectations and still was disappointed by everything from their famous pho to the five spice chicken.

Ordered to-go #33 after checking out those delicious photos on YELP. Called in and picked up within 10mins. The restaurant smells sorta like a elementary school gymnasium, kinda glad I ordered to-go because I don't think i would be able to stand that smell while i ate. Food was pretty good should've opt in on that fried egg on top for additional $1.25. But you live and you learn. Differently would order TO-GO again.

There aren't many restaurants I go back to more than a few times since there are thousands of places to eat in the city... but... BUT... Golden Star is by far the best place for fresh Pho. Tried a bunch of other places throughout the city but I always come back here. Fast and delicious.
The pho is one of the best in the area. Beef is tender and the noodles are smooth. Five spice chicken is also good! Their BBQ pork is ok.
Looking for pho for breakfast? Broth was perfect and service was incredible. Fresh shrimp spring rolls were excellent.
Great pho, I love the five spice chicken here.  The pork chop rice dish is pretty good, too.
Pretty good bowl of Pho for lunch! Conveniently located between FiDi and Chinatown.
I got the number 18 and it was delicious. I highly recommend. Must come back for sure!!

Amazing Pho! Really impressed by the fast service and how nice the service was. This was our first time trying Pho and they took the time to explain everything to us. We never felt rushed and were amazed at how many people they could comfortably cram into such a small space. We recommend the Seafood Pho. Delish!
Phenomenal chicken pho. I usually prefer beef stocks for it is nice to change it up every once a while. Five-spice chicken pho + shared spring rolls is a pretty damn nice meal.
This is an excellent hole in the wall pho establishment to start the week off.
The five-spice chicken was quite good.
Quick service. But Hunan chicken lacked any real flavor. Bland. Hot and sour soup was very thick and again no real flavor. Overall disappointed.
The best restaurant in Chinatown and in all of San Fran. Do yourself a favor and eat there!!

Chinatown is a place you must experience in San Francisco and then you must experience the food.  Hunan Home's came recommended from a friend who is always here.  Love how its traditional but still new age a bit.
Quick service. Clean. delicious food. We had the hot and sour soup, orange chicken, and basil chicken and all were delicious. Great Chinese in the fidi/ Chinatown border.

Chinatown is just full of little surprises like Hunan Home's Restaurant. I stopped by after a long day biking through the city, and was hoping to find some authentic Chinese food, free from too much western influence.
