I came here during a vacation to San Francisco, and this was the highest rated Chinese restaurant in Chinatown.

this is only for the kung pao chicken, 2.5 stars.  i like my kung pao on the pure side...chicken, chilis, bit of green onion, peanuts.  most places go overboard with bamboo, bell pepper, celery (ouch).  other yelpers warned me about the bamboo so i had that taken out.

I set up a lunch for my boyfriend and our families here. We arrived early - around 11:20am to ensure we'd get a table for 10. One of the hostesses was very accommodating and asked if we'd like to wait inside while everyone showed up. I appreciated the gesture however I thought she could've been a little bit more warm and welcoming.

My boyfriend and I went here due to the good reviews. Unfortunately, this place did not meet our expectations...especially with their "high" ratings and cost. We ordered the Hunan  beef and shrimp/chicken fried rice. In honesty, the dishes lacked in flavor. How could this be? A Chinese restaurant in the middle of the biggest Chinatown in the country and no flavor in their dishes?! We left very disappointed.

We had the chow mien noodles and chicken with asparagus and hot n sour soup. The noodles were a nice al dente firmness. The black bean chicken asparagus would have been nicer with some rice. The hot and sour soup was good much like the ones that I have had before.
Visiting from Atlanta, saw the reviews and decided to check it out. The food was just ok, expected great with all the hype. Nothing that tasted better than items I could have gotten back home.

I really like this place.  Everything we ordered was yummy.  The restaurant was spacious, which was a nice surprise, considering this is in the heart of Chinatown.  It's clean, but very well-worn, which gives it a cozy feel (not sure how they pulled that off).  Service was great: waiters are fast and efficient.  They are helpful if you ask for suggestions, but not overbearing.  The host was very friendly, but again, not overbearing.  They don't get 5 stars only because the food is not "to die for," but trust me, I stuffed myself.  I will definitely go here again, and I recommend it without hesitation.

i love a place that maintains its great food..   I try to come here every time I come to town.  consistently great quality, hot from the kitchen.  Perfectly seasoned and great service.  Hot and sour soup.  loaded - great flavor - just the right amount of kick.  Hot egg rolls that you know were cooked in fresh oil.  Something new this time - pot stickers in a garlic sauce.  Don't know how I missed it on previous visits - but wow! love love love.  The garlic beef and orange chicken were wonderful.  I can't wait to go back!
My first visit tonight was outstanding. The food was well prepared and the atmosphere was friendly and inviting. The manager made me feel like a local. Highly recommend.
Very good food. We had the Hot and Sour Soup, Potstickers, Orange Peel Chicken, and Hunan Sautéed Pork.
We stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner as it's got a ton of great reviews.  It's nothing fancy or special-looking, but in its well-worn state has a cozy quality about it.

One of our longtime favorites to visit when coming to San Francisco. Peking duck - an absolute must, but must be preordered a day in advance. Delicious, friendly, in midst of China town. A jewel we became aware of by shear coincidence a couple years ago when asking locals for recommendations.
I was there for a weekday lunch.  Nothing special.

We got the family meal type b for 3 people. Service was fast and friendly but we came craving friend rice but we were not allowed to update our meal. We don't mind paying extra but the only option was to buy an additional portion.  The family meal was a lot of food already,  No need for more.  Other than that good place to experience China town. We are not from here so we were looking for  a good experience
The food here was amazing!
Great food and amazing service!  We all loved the food, the kindness of the waiter and the hot tea was a nice touch.
Fantastic hot and sour soup. The wontons in hot sauce were delicious. Tender beef and chicken.....quick service. This guy HUSTLED! A great stop in Chinatown!
Good service and good food!

Why I haven't written a review is beyond me, went here for lunch today had to review finally! the sizzling fish is amazing , sizzles right in front of you when they bring It. Eggplant is bomb love the garlic sauce and not too spicy, the environment is nice, I love walking around Chinatown after to relax. Parking is a bit hard as you are in Chinatown I've lucked out and found parking down the block on Columbus; it's hit or miss. The potstickers wow well thank you for making it my little nephews all time favorite thing in the world; he refuses to eat potstickers anywhere but Hunan homes.. we've tried!! bill is fairly good compared to the quantity and quality of food and can't wait to come back!!!
how have i not posted a review on this place.

Born and raised in China Hunan province, this is one of the most random shameless use of Hunan and Hunan food in menu I've seen. Upon entering, I noticed none of the tables were Chinese. We ordered fried tofu as appetizer which was decent. But the two main courses were total westernized rubbish that shouldn't exists at the heart of Chinatown: the first course used tomato sauce for starch, authentic Hunan food never use starch in the first place, let alone tomato sauce in starch. The second one was Hunan Smoked Pork: it's NOT even Hunan style smoked pork. It's obviously Cantonese style: red, grilled, sweet instead of black, smoked, spicy and full of flavor. Hunan food is also normally famous for its spiciness, oily over high fire, both of our main dishes taste bland and sour. I understand why it is getting four star overall reviews despite our experience. It is perfectly westernized Cantonese food with a random Hunan branding, the dining area is also tidier and cleaner than regular Chinese restaurants, catering to its western customers. The server were all dressed up giving you this upscale vibe (the service though is no better than regular Chinese restaurant, we were basically invisible to them after ordering, and it took a long time for the to notice that we are ready for the check, when wife stands up and starts leaving our table, but we don't care and we still tip). But make no mistake, this is no Hunan food, not even good Chinese food. There is no shame in catering to its specific market segment. It might very well be a more profitable market. There is also no shame starting from westernized Chinese food if you really do enjoy its food, kudos for trying something different. The shame is in the restaurant's use of the word "Hunan" and reference of Hunan food on its menu. And this is especially for the foodies who are looking for  authentic Chinese food and also as a note to myself: observe the makeup of a restaurant's customers before trusting Yelp's overview ratings.
Chinese food in Chinatown is a must and this is the place to go. The service was fantastic! And the food was even better. If you find your way to Chinatown, you have to give this place a try.

The food was as good as I've read on Yelp!  The Hot and Sour soup really was amazing and the Orange Peel Chicken was probably the best I've ever had.  The service wasn't the best but that was to be expected.  I'll go back next time I'm in town!
Excellent food! Flavorful, savory, spicy
We picked up family in SFO for the day and took them here. First time for all of us and thanks to the information from Yelp reviews, it won't be the last!

Great food that you get fast.  This place is all business, cranking out the food  very quickly.  But it's good. Had wonton soup, prawns with lobster sauce, and Hunan pork. All were some of the best I've had.  Service was great. Atmosphere is your standard Chinese restaurant.  There are a lot of choices in Chinatown - this is a good one.
good food but the Receptionist need to be smiling more. lol
Me and the bf usually come here when were around the area and get a to-go order of Hot and Sour soup, which in my opinion is one of the best Hot and Sour soups in the city.
My favorite Chinese spot in San Francisco! Great experience from the food to the ambiance. The hot and sour soup is the best I've ever had! It's a must on each visit. Beef curry is also a stand out!

In a city with probably 10,000 or so Chinese restaurants, this could be #1. It's certainly my personal favorite. Every dish comes out piping hot and has tons of flavor; leave the soy sauce at home. Special shout out to the hot and sour soup. Add a few giant Tsing Tao's and you have a great meal.

Really nice atmosphere and staff, and loved the food! I had the orange chicken, and was probably the best I ever tasted! The servers also came over to teach us about the different ingredients like the chili, and how we were supposed to eat that. Will defiantly come back here on a later opportunity.

Why didn't anyone tell me about this restaurant? This is where I am glad there is Yelp. Just had lunch here and will certainly be a regular since I work nearby. Clean place, attentive service and good food.

We got the chicken with spicy green beans and it was sublime. The heat was strong but not overpowering. The flavors were awesome under the heat. A special lunch treat. We also had the hot and sour soup which was also spicy, but not overly so. In addition the pork in the soup was also very flavorful. The other dishes coming out looked fabulous. We wish we could have stayed and ordered more. We will definitely go back.
Excellent food and service! We absolutely enjoyed everything we ordered from the egg roles to the orang chicken, pork...everything!! Worth the wait!  Try the Chinese beer while you wait!

On the filight in, a San Francisco native suggested either R&G Lounge or Hunan Home.  The wait was an hour and a half at R&G, and that sounds like the norm.  As luck would have it, there was one open table at Hunan Home.

I'm just going to go right ahead and make the bold statement that Daisy wings are the best in Chinatown, yes, way better than Capital wings, like blow them out of the water better. I don't know if it's the size of the drummettes, hint of ginger, light batter, or ridiculously low price per pound that take these wings to the next level...but these things are on point each and every time I stop here. All you need to do is take one bite and you are on the train to Guy Fieri's flavor town. Yup, that reference just happened.
Come for the fried chicken wings!!!

Chicken chicken chicken!!!  That's all I get here.  All my coworkers chip in money for one of us to come here to buy pounds of chicken drumsticks, chicken wings, and mini chicken drumettes.  Yes it's not the healthiest of meals but when you splurge on calories, you splurge on the good stuff!  New Golden Daisy has a chicken product suitable for the most pickiest chicken eater.
YES YES YES
Best chow mein and fried chicken drummettes in the city!!!
We went to New Golden Daisy to try out the Chicken Wings. They may be as good as suggested, but they were cold and cold chicken just is not that good so I didn't exactly enjoy them.

NO ONE can beat their crispy fried drummettes and chow mein. They have to add sugar to their chow mein, otherwise it wouldn't be that good. The skin on the chicken wings are SO crispy! It always satisfies my cravings for fried chicken. YUM! We ordered our roast piglet for our wedding day here, 7 years ago. I still remember. For cheap chinese food, they definitely are the BEST!!!!!

ok there are good days and bad days at this place you can kind of tell if the chicken has been refried it has an old oil taste to it yes, I have bought it when it was not fresh. I go by often and look at it before buying it basically if the drummets look light color then it should be ok if it looks dark no ! cha sui /bbq pork is pretty good here. chicken average. duck is pretty good. roasted pig is ok too.you just have to check it out to be sure the skin is nice and crispy and there is meat on it sometimes there is not a lot of meat on the roasted pigs.

Literally the worst food I've ever had. I ordered half a duck and about 80% of it wasn't even edible. I also ordered the sweet & sour pork and it was made from all types of random parts of the pig. I had to continuously spit it out into a napkin. And if that isn't bad enough, the food wasn't warm at all. It was like eating leftover Chinese food from the fridge. Not exactly sure how this place has four stars. Even the staff was very unpleasant. I highly encourage you to take your business else where.
- Locale Destination -

While waiting in line for Good Mong, my friend was starving and wanted to get something. I waited in line while he dropped in and grabbed some fried chicken and noodles. The fried baby chicken drumsticks were on point with the seasoning, fresh and crunchy. The noodles, not so much. They were kind of cold and bland.

This is my go-to spot for fresh BBQ pork when I want to make nuo mi fan (Chinese sticky rice).  I have tried other Chinese BBQ spots and have found this place to have the freshest, most flavorable BBQ meats where you can specify if you want more lean or fatty cuts.  Amazing prices too -- 5 dollars and change today for a pound of BBQ pork!

I randomly found this place while looking for a quick eat near our hotel.  Read on yelp that their fried chicken drumettes are pretty good, so we made the 10 minute walk from our hotel.  This place is dirt cheap.  It's not a sit down restaurant, but rather a to-go establishment, as their food selection is pre-made and sitting under heat lamps.

Chinese Chinatown Fried Chicken.  If you ever crave chinatown chicken, this is the type of fried chicken you are looking for.  I believe it was $4/lb.  I recommend telling them $4 worth of chicken or however much for example $5 worth and they'll attempt to give you $5 worth.  You ask for a pound of chicken and they'll give you about a lb-ish and charge you for the exact amount (e.g $4.20). As a guy, save yourself the trouble and avoid dealing with change.
Really felt like getting noodles today. So I walked around and walked around. I passed by this place and their reviews weren't bad and it looked like a fresh batch of noodles.
Cheap food on the run when Good Mong Kok is packed.

Cheap and Good!!!  We walked out of the store with .5 Lbs. Barbecue Pork, .5 Lbs. Chicken Wings, .5 Lbs. of Chow Mein, and .5 Lbs. of fat noodles.  Everything was great and cost $10.  There is no seating, strictly take out.  Grab the food, some napkins and find a park bench or a curb and enjoy.

FRIED CHICKEN!  The signature stamp of delicious fried chicken wings and drumettes in SF Chinatown!  Order them up when it is freshly fried so it has that warm, fried crisp with the light garlic flavor!

I take the Muni or Drive to chinatown to this Chinese BBQ Deli for 1 thing i know they do really well. Chai-Siu Pork Riblets. This is cooked the same way as the Honey BBQ pork. It has that same sweet honey caramelized coating on the outside with the neon red coloring.
Cheap good meat. Seriously.
Best mini drumettes and chow mein! Having been coming here since I was a kid! Always tasty and will always be back for more!!  They had thick and thin chow mein!
the duck was super greasy, and not very meaty. (hey that rhymes!)
(See pics) Review #1314. There are a good number of Chinese BBQ shops on Stockton Street. They are a perfect place to take care of your full meal.

Imagine a lost wanderer in the middle of SF's Chinatown, asking every passer-by or maitre D at a restaurant, awkwardly, "where can I find BBQ duck in this town?" After a series of mixed directions "up that hill. keep going right" "Oh I don't know.." I finally saw chickens hanging in the window. YES THERE IS BBQ DUCK!

If hole in the wall places usually have the best food out there, then New Golden Daisy should have the best food known to man. A dirty, decrepit butcher shop right off of Stockton Street? It practically speaks for itself.

I'll be honest - the drumettes are not the best in the world. However, they are terrific value. They're good enough and they're less than $4.50 for a dozen. Yes, that's right. You can get a good lunch for less than five dollars. You will however need to eat it in the street with all the chinatown shoppers bustling around you.

Can't believe this place has received so many positive reviews. The fried chicken was tasty enough (which is the only reason they aren't receiving one star), but made with poor grade chicken as far as I could tell. The prices are really low, but you get what you pay for. I asked for napkins with my order since there is no sit down service and was told in an abrupt manner, "No napkins" which makes sense when you look up the place's low health inspection ratings, but how can a take-out place have no napkins? I could hardly even bring myself to glance at the back area, which was filthy. If tasty is more important to you than quality or cleanliness, then this is the place for you.
***4 Stars ONLY for their little Drumsticks ***

When it comes to value, you truly get your money's worth from this place - for the 1lb of chicken drummettes that I ordered, I got 12pcs and it was only $3.75!  Granted, these are just drummettes - but you gotta admit, there aren't many other places out there that will give you that much for that stated price.  You could easily get 2-3 servings from this.

I came here around 4pm on a Friday in search of these amazing chicken wings that everyone keeps raving about.  I initially thought that the place was a cheap, sit-down restaurant, but it's actually set up like a togo place--just trays of different dishes, and prices/pound labeled in front of each tray.
come on! really? come on! how this place even made it into consideration for best fried chicken in america amazes me.  don't get me wrong, the drumettes aren't bad, but best in the nation?

I come here for my fried chicken and chow mein kinda wish I got it today cause the fried rice isn't as good but its nothing a little hot sauce can't fix! I like this spot cause its real old school and the chefs serve you really fast. This the spot right here oh yeah and its real CHEAP!!!!
ohh come on, people kept saying this was the best chicken ever? really? OMG you peeps don't know chicken then.

I LOVE fried chicken...so finding out there was a place a couple blocks from my home that sells amazing AND cheap chicken meant that I definitely had to check it out! Getting there was a bit of a battle, trying to navigate through all of the slow-moving people ogling at fruit and groceries, and walking in was also scary as the people working in the back did not seem extremely friendly. I pointed at the fried chicken, and said "1 pound" in Chinese and handed over a 20 for them. A pound of fried chicken was only ~$5!!!!
Did someone say chicken wings? In Chinatown?

5 Stars for their $4.00 chicken before tax. This shit is off the rocker. Crispified to perfection and always flavored right. I usually get a box, eat half, and save the rest for late night munchies. They pop right back into place after you put them into an oven at 350 deg. for 8 minutes. Trust the process, I do this often.

Come here for great prices/value on pretty good catered food which they will deliver to your event for free as well (if it's close by although I am not sure where they make the cut off). I love that they are pretty fast and efficient although it would definitely help if you can speak Cantonese since their staff don't speak English well or at all. Speak to the boss/owner if you need to order for your company via a merchant/organization check.

The location and atmosphere were a little intimidating (especially if you had never been to china town before), however once you get past the displays of meat hanging in the window, the food was very good. I recommend getting the chicken drumsticks. They were amazing!

I tried the drumsticks.  I guess I just don't have the same tastebuds as everyone else because they were not all that.  They were good!  Don't get me wrong!  But just not what I was expecting.  Cheap though!
MMM DEM CHICKEN DRUMSTICKS!!!

I am totally in love with this place!!  Walked in on a Saturday night after seeing Chicago the musical.  We had dinner reservations on the other side of town at Boulevard but had enough time to come in and really check this place out I've been hearing so much about.  Don't you love it when you hear about a place and you get excited about it and it ends up being what you expected.  Every Yelper should feel this way on more than one occasion.  My husband and I were greeted at the door by a very nice young woman who took us to a very nice part of the bar area where we could see everything.  We asked a cocktail questions to find the best fit and even though we had dinner reservations we went for their oysters and fried cheese balls (and excuse me for not typing the proper name for it).  What a delight it was.... the oysters were fresh, the sauces were perfectly made.  And when those fried cheese balls arrived with this creamy sauce on the bottom, I almost passed out.  Had we not had other plans we would have tried everything on their modest but delicious menu.
Great ambience, crowd and drinks. Unique for the area and popular enough to know without being a crowd. The food maintains the premise and could be a draw independent from the main attractions.

Must go!! Great old school atmosphere especially when the band is playing. If you're at the bar.... ASK FOR MATT!!! He is hands down the best bartender ever!! Once you see him in action you'll know what I'm talking about!
Cool bar with live jazz!
Really enjoyed .. and we actually liked !!

We came here to check out the band Gaucho. The bar has a great old school atmosphere.  The band provided a feeling of relief getting to the end of a long Monday night with a solid drink in hand. For a Monday night it's a perfect escape bar and we will be back.
pretty good sized pours and decent pricing.  I like it :)  Wasn't tooooo crowded, especially for a Friday, but then again we were there around 730 8pm.  Not a bad place for a stiff whiskey drink :)

Our new favorite bar in SF. The cocktails are terrific, the atmosphere friendly and fun, the music great, and excellent food. What's not to like? Try the Martinez cocktail (or any other) and the mushroom pot pie - fabulous. There's also some Bourbon custardy dessert that is to die for. A little rich, surprise.

So, my boyfriend took me for the first time and I have to say I was quite impressed. The bar itself has a cool rock-star feel to it as soon as you walk in. It's dark but the high ceilings, the nice ambience inside and the jazz music on the background is quite relaxing upon entrance. My go-to drink? "South Side Cocktail" - Gin, lemon, sugar, mint, seltzer. Simple, plain for some but oh - so - yum. I have only been here 2x but I always want to come back for more. My bf always orders the Scottish eggs. He enjoys them every time. We also had the meatballs. It was alright. We plan to come back this weekend so I am hoping to try their entrees. The Comstock Burger is trying to call my name. Ha. The other thing I enjoy here is the live Jazz band that plays upstairs on their 2nd floor. My bf's friend plays his saxophone there at times. The band plays incredible songs that make your entire experience quite fun and relaxed. I definitely recommend that you try this place. Cocktails range from $8 - $12. Trust me.. You will come back here again after you try their drinks. And notice their bartenders' outfits. Pretty hot, I say.. Bow ties!
What an amazing experience! Managed to snag a late dinner reservation and I was shocked to find an amazing live band playing!! Definitely will be a regular here.

Very Unique!! Came here with sis after dinner for a night cap. The bartender was handsome and made a great drink  I read a couple of reviews or complaints about smoking outside. THANK YOU for telling people NOT to smoke in front of the bar. It's the LAW !! I don't want to smell smoke while I'm eating and drinking. Very quaint place, cool decor

I went in with high hopes but was actually a little disappointed. My drink was too sweet and not all that strong. The appetizers were also overpriced IMO.  I might go back, but it wouldn't be my first choice.
This is a cute little bar! Had an old school feel to it. I liked it a lot. It was a great spot to have a drink after walking around all over the city while visiting!

I started coming to Comstock because I have a super crush on one of the bartenders.... But the place kept me coming back! When I first walked in, I thought it was just another fancy cocktail place that I wouldn't feel comfortable in but boy was I wrong! I've gone by myself on more than one occasion and have made new friends just from the people sitting around me. There's a good mix of regular customers and people new to the area. It's the only bar I go to in North Beach/Chinatown because it's a nice change from the crazy college type bars that I normally go to with college friends- and I feel super comfortable. The staff is friendly and remember your face when you come back. I've trusted the bartenders to make whatever they feel I would like, and I've yet to be disappointed. Lots of character in the set up, music, and even in the attire of the staff. Love it all!
Four solid stars.  The food is good; the drinks are great.  Friendly staff, fantastic bartenders, what more do you need?.

Comstock Saloon is super cool! It's huge with plenty of seating and a good Western vibe, from the decor to the music. The bartenders are friendly, and it's fun to watch them make drinks that are seriously out of this world. The popular "must-drink" thing to order is the Sazerac ($9) which has rye, sugar, Peychaud's, and absinthe. Tell me something has absinthe and I'm game.
The Scotch Eggs are great as are the lamb meatballs. Don't miss the 1907 built bar. Why does yelp requor e more words? Let's see how this goes

Our new favorite bar when we're in SF.  Well prepared and stiff drinks!  Be sure to check out seating in both parts of the saloon.  We walked in one side and didn't realize until we left that there are two sides that connect at the back.
The point: Historically relevant bar with phenomenally talented bartenders. Definitely worth going :D !
Best Bar in the Chinatown/NB
Yeeeee-haw! What a neat little wild west hitching post! Here are a few reasons to pony up to Comstock:

I went this weekend to go one last time before I leave the neighborhood (Last time was my birthday doin' the champagne thing) but it's under renovation so sadly to say I can't "Tip the cup" again in a very cool place. It had a very old school feel, some of the glassware, tiled floors, wood bar. Very nice ambiance in the bar portion.
I am editing this review based on recent experiences at (trying to get into) this place.

I had been meaning to come here for a while and finally made it last night. This place is really something special, it is like stepping into a western saloon. The ambiance/decor is just awesome, rich mahogany and all the waiters looked the part. Everyone was extremely nice and the drinks mixed to perfection. I had the half chicken, little ham had the scotch eggs and fried green tomatoes. I really recommend this place, there is a reason GQ ranked it as one of the top cocktail bars in America

Went to get drinks here with friends late at night and were treated excellently. A man greeted us and showed us a place to sit, and was really friendly on getting our orders. The drinks took a while to get to our table, but they were good and no complaints from anyone. Never had their food before, but I'm willing to come here again to try out the food and have another amazing cocktail. Also, I love the environment of this bar. It has a vintage/classy vibe that's also low key and casual at the same time, I saw people dressing in basically sweats to have a drink here and they were treated nicely as well.

Not your average bar! Bartender used only the finest and freshest ingredients. He mixed drinks like an artist and never seemed flustered. Only suggestion is to be patient for your drink! It will be worth the wait.

Go to the bar and try the BAR KEEPS WHIMSY.  This allows the bar tender to handcraft a cocktail based on your specific likes, completely tailored to you.  Mine was an excellent mix of gin,  orange liquor, bitters, orange rind, and topped with a quick flame from the orange rind!!!!  It was just as incredible to watch it being made, as it was delicious!!!!  When in San Francisco, do yourself a favor, visit the Comstock Saloon!!
We had only 1 thing - the Derby.  perfectly refreshing drink to finish our big walk on a weekend afternoon.

Stumbled upon this gem and it topped off our night to a perfect evening. Live music on a Friday night, great staff, and great history of the place. I would recommend going in the back room and finding a waiter who can tell you about the places history.

Friends and I were looking for a place for a nice drink as we're new to the city.  Stumbled on this place and got a set of Old Fashioneds.  They were pretty darn good.  Definitely coming back for more.
Awesome place. Cool vibe. Good Food.  Great drinks.  Nice People ;)
Five stars for when my favorite bartender is working, and three stars for the rest of the time.
I love the cocktails here. Happy hour is alright. Ambiance is great, live music and a throw back to 1920's decor, I love.

I'd been here many times but there was always too much of a wait for a seat but this time, happy hour, we waltzed right in. The derby was the hh special and it was really well-done and refreshing. Food was kinda pricey but it looked delicious. Will have to come back another night for that. The service was great and attentive too, we were checked on pretty frequently. Lots of character to the place without seeming like they're trying too hard.

More proof that SF has more character than just about any city I know.  Go here to be transported back to the turn of the century (20th century, that is) when bars were saloons and bartenders had mustaches that curled up to a fine point.  They are, to a man (and woman), characters who nonetheless know their way around a cocktail.  Pick from the list, ask for your own or let them pick for you at their whimsy -- they won't disappoint.  I can't quite say the same thing about the menu filled with old timey (?) delights like liver or bone marrow.  Just like grandma would eat, I suppose.  About the only thing I'd be up for trying are the sliders.
I have only been for drinks. They always seem to have live music and a really cool vibe.
This place is always on the top list of unique SF bars and it did not disappoint.

Went it this place on Monday night for a few drinks after dinner and so glad I did, ended up working our way through the cocktail menu with some great guidance from the excellent bar staff. Drinks were smooth and very well mixed. The menu looked very good and the food we saw on tables looked delicious, unfortunately we had eaten but would go back to eat. Being a Monday there was live music which was upbeat and lively, great staff and friendly patrons, struck up a few conversations and had a thoroughly good time. Carefully though, easy to get very drunk on those cocktails!!
Really nice hipster bar with live music on Monday, which was interesting.  Almost as interesting as, you know, my life decisions to come to a bar on a Monday.

Came here many years ago and thought it was great. Came here again recently, and it was just ok. Probably because they didn't have my preferred drink of choice and a lot of their "craft cocktails" are just regular cocktails.  It was really busy, but for some reason their bar on both sides only had 1 bartender. Took forever to get the drinks, but the place did kind of die down by 9pm.
Not very good, there are plenty that are better within a block or two radius. Gyro sandwich was eh, and not very filling at nine inches.

Hands-down one of the best gyros I have had ever! There are a lot of Mediterranean restaurants all within the same 0.5-1 mile radius. After performing taste tests on all of them, Ayola has had the most consistent, flavorful, and moist gyro sandwich and/or plate.
Great food and great staff

This is one of my go-to lunch spots in the financial district. Their gyro pita wrap is really great and the dolma are really good too. They have Jones soda in their fountain too ;p Ayola is a down to earth joint in the midst of the trendy spots on Kearny so the line is always short, not to mention they put out food at lightning speed, and the prices are very reasonable.

I am becoming pretty used to mediterranean food and I must say that the Gyro platter was very good and well served. Hummus is perfect, the meat is extremely fresh and good. Everybody else at my work seemed very happy with it too.

This place is fantastic. It never disappoints!! Everything on the menu is so delicious. The Gyros Platter and Neptune salad are delightful. The hummus, tzatziki, and salad dressing are so good that I never get bored with them. Very casual atmosphore, great for a quick, yummy lunch.

When I was a work'n stiff on Market Street, I came here once a month or so for a lamb gyro.  They have a loft upstairs and a nice bar.  The seats at the bar have a commanding view of the street and the customer area.  Below the loft is a giant menu of all the things at Ayola.
Best in town gyros, I walk 35 minutes for their sandwich.
Clean place and delicious food customer service they has beautiful smile all the time.
They catered our company's summer "bbq" for us. The staff is friendly, they were on time and brought more than enough food. The prices were good and everyone loved the food!
This is my favorite quick place to eat. The food is great, I only wish there was more seating and that it wasn't so warm inside. I really like the owner he's always friendly.
Namnamnam this makes me so hungry right now
Very good Greek food. Love their salad dressing and the gyro meat and hummus were delicious!!  All five of us enjoyed it and the price was fair. Try it.
Recent ordered: Large lamb shawarma w/ side of fries, and a soda. (meal) about $11-12
gyros is very filling and the fries are amazing.  I usually hit this place up for lunch once a week
Chicken Macedonian Salad - a week work day must and staple.  Great salad - even comes with a pipping hot pita.  RED SAUCE, peeps aren't lying, that stuff is for real amazingness.
Had a hankering for some Greek food and Ayola was conveniently located in the direction I was heading, so I made a pit stop for some yummy fuel.
Normal Gyro at a normal price
All Ayolas are not created equal.  This location gives way less meat than the New Montgomery St. Location.  Also this location seems to be stingy on all portions of the Greek salad besides lettuce.
This place is dope. The staff is dope. The food is dope. Be dope and eat here.

I tried this restaurant for the first time today.  I ordered a lamb gyro. I thought the price was good, I think it was about $7.50 for a 9 inch gyro. Unfortunately, the gyro tasted rather bland.  I had asked to have spicy hot sauce put on it.  The cashier asked me if I wanted the red sauce which she pointed to behind me or the green sauce.  I said the red sauce, and had assumed that they would put it on for me, which they did not.  Was not very impressed with the gyro and wouldn't go back.
My husband and I were in the city and decided that we wanted to eat something fresh, easy and affordable.  We stopped by Ayola and ordered the Gyro and Beef salad with a side of Tabouleh Salad.

A solid spot for lunch. Their menu is simple and not overly complicated which is a huge plus. I opted for the 7" lamb gyro and the meat was flavorful and the sauce was delicious! At first I thought it was a little small, but it was pretty filling and hit the spot. Oh, they have this hot sauce by the door that is basically crack. Don't forget to grab a side of it before you leave.
Really friendly staff and quick service. The food was great and really flavorful.
I really love the location on New Montgomery. I never frequent this location,but for some reason whenever I order delivery or catering for my company I get defaulted here.
Welcome to the latest edition of food kid f.A.A.t city's morning show. Please give a round of applause to our special guest, the Best Fries in FiDi Award winner......AYOLA FRiES!
I had the chicken shwarma in a pita.  The chicken was good quality breast meat, and they put on lots of yoghurt sauce.  It was a good find for a quick and cheap lunch.
Don't underestimate this little shop. The food is solid! Enough said!
Great food and quick service !

Okay, first thing's first -- I'm 1/4 Greek, and I speak broken Greek at best. When I see a Greek place, I'd love to walk in, say "Giassas" and at least get a broken "Ti Kanis?" out of the proprietor. Please note that while three employees were working at Ayola today, not a single one spoke a word of Greek. That's lame... in fact, extremely lame. I mean, not that I have a problem with people cooking outside of their cultural heritage, but unfortunately, the impression got worse from there.
Excellent and very tasty Greek food.

I was visiting Academy of Art university And decided to try this greek place across the street for lunch. Best choice I've ever made. I had the Gyros. I usually don't like lamb, but this sandwich tasted like heaven. And their fries are pretty awesome.
I've eaten a lot of Greek Gyros in my time and these guys put together a great mix of meat, tzatziki sauce and vegetables.  Their fries we also crispy and tasty.

My daughter was looking for a falafel sandwich. Ayola was a great choice: decent portion (we got the small), great tzatziki sauce with lettuce and tomatoes, generous amount of fries, and very fast service. I got the straight chicken, which was a little dry, but the sauce worked wonders, making the whole combo just right!
Seriously. The BEST fries I've had in a long time. Why fries at a Greek place? I don't know, but I'll order them every time.

I went to Ayola since the Japanese Curry place next door that I wanted to go had a line going out the door. Ayola is a tiny spot with a couple of tables inside and some inside. I got the gyro plate and the baklava. The gyro meat was really dry, the pita was hard and overall the meal was not that appetizing. On the plus side, it came out super fast.
I work a little outside of the delivery area, so once a week my coworkers and I use paper scissors rock to decide who has to walk the distance to pick up our order.

3 1/2 Stars. This place is fast and the people are friendly. Very small place. Only a few tables. The food is good, but I just don't think it is my type of food. Maybe it's the spices that I don't like that much.

Kearny Street seems to have a new lunch spot open every few months.  Lots of turnover means the choices tor a meal are many.  Not for me.  Ayola's gyro or felafel wraps get me through the door every time.
Ayola continues to serve 1 of the best falafels around!  And those french fries are absolutely 2 die 4!
Have gotten takeaway lunch here 5-6 times now, and it's been consistently good.  Service is always good - friendly and quick, and the food is solid.
Awesome food. Fantastic happy hour. But prepared to wait a LONG time. 30 minutes for a grilled cheese sandwich...to be exact...

Dropped by for a casual, relatively healthy  but still delicious dinner tonight.  Super flavorful lentil soup.  The Meatballs and polenta was good too - although the meatballs were a bit tough to cut into, they tasted great and the polenta was incredibly creamy.  Only critique is it def could have used more tomato sauce.  Roasted cauliflower was cooked perfectly and not too oily with yummy breadcrumbs and some lemon.

If you're down for a nice, cafe-esque lunch spot (informal), this is a nice option. They take your order at the counter, get your number, grab your silverware, napkins, some cool agua, and settle in for some goodness. I think they are mostly concerned with the quality of food, rather than the service, but for what it is, that's fine. They weren't rude, just not overly attentive either... counter dining at its finest, I'd say.
Work lunch w/ a fun buddy & she recommended Harrow.  Loved everything about it!

Not too reliable. Ordered takeout - first they told me to hold and dropped the call. Then they missed part of my order (but didn't call back to ask what they were missing). When I arrived, the food wasn't ready at the time they said it would be.

Good god.  Do not go here if you want something in less than 20 minutes or anytime around noon.  This is a FiDi lunch place with limited seating and made to order food.  Naturally you'd think they would be prepared for their patrons to take their food to go since there's so little seating.  Problem is it's so small that there is no place to wait while they prepare your food.  In fact, this is the whole problem with the establishment.   Having to watch the expediter and the 2 horribly slow line cooks finagle the never-ending line of tickets is painful to watch.  My salad took 23 minutes to get to me.  23 minutes.

Had some time to kill before my flight home to Denver. This place is small but packs a punch! Nice selection of sandwiches and salads with several wines and beers. The service was ok, considering how busy they were and how small of food prep area they have.
converted a sandwich to a salad ($11) and it was miniscule.
Roasted chicken leg + side of arugula salad or polenta = yummy, fairly healthy dinner for those late work nights!

Super cute and great food! The restaurant itself is pretty tiny but it looks like a lot of people do to go -- it's right in the heart of the Financial District and I saw a lot of guys in suits presumably working late picking up food to go. Worked great for myself and my friend as we were able to be seated right away.

Stopped in here for lunch today and ordered the BLT sandwich.  Bacon was sliced very thin and sandwich had too much sauce.  I added avocado, per suggestion of the gal who took my order.  Including a dollar for tip, sandwich plus avocado was $14, which is expensive even for FiDi standards.  The portion was small - the sandwich itself wasn't very big, wimpy portion of bacon and avocado, and it did not come with a side or chips...definitely did not fill me up.  Felt I overpaid for what I got and wouldn't return.

I've only been here for lunch, but it was great! Great sandwiches, hot sauces and atmosphere. It's clean, lively, and relaxing all at once. Friendly staff and good people watching make this a perfect place to spend the lunch hour while noshing and having a beer. I'll be back for dinner sometime soon!
I went to Harrow for an early dinner/happy hour with my wife.  It's near where she works some days so it seemed a nice new place to check out.
A bright spot among the tired options for the denizens of 555 Cali and other nearby workplaces.

Harrow is delicious, high quality food and it's apparent the people care about what they are doing.  (If you want something slathered together for lunch, go to Chiptole)  They also can accommodate vegans, and do so graciously!  Also love this place for happy hour, the ambiance is warm and always love the music they are playing.  Highly recommended!
Nice and simple, both in decor and the menu. I had meatballs with polenta and my company had salmon with polenta.

In from out of town and gave it a try based on the reviews.  Lunch did not disappoint.  Arrived a bit after the rush and got a spot at a table.  Pork sandwich was very good and loved that you could get 1/2 sandwich and 1/2 salad or soup.  Would definitely go back.
When one of my favorite architects suggested somewhere along Kearny for lunch, Harrow stood out in my Yelp search. This place has clearly been around awhile but today was my first time eating there.
The Caesar salad...
Tasty chicken leg! and friendly service.  I am going to go back and try the pulled pork sandwich based on everyone's yelp review.

This place is super cute and very hidden. You would def pass this place and probably not even notice, but it's definitely a hidden gem. The sangria which is on happy hour, is very good and they have big windows to people watch. The atmosphere is very cozy and rustic. I thought this place was super cute and a good hangout.
Fantastic seasonal menu and excellent service! I have never had a bad experience at Harrow and it is top of my list when I'm looking for a convenient, but high quality, lunch spot in FiDi.

Just ate here for lunch. I rocked the pulled pork sandwich and shared a side of the Polenta. We got rockstar seating by the window right at 12:30 which made it a perfect lunch. They were understaffed today but still pulled off a line out the door with no one really complaining. Will definitely be going back here
I really like the quality of the food at Harrow.  When it's on the menu I recommend the meatloaf sandwich, it's pretty awesome.
Small place. Not that much seating, but the food is really good.

Their Pork Sandwich is AMAZEBALLS. I am a Jew and I have my pork there. The service is very friendly--I once stayed there for lunch and had me a glass of rose. It does get loud and crowded, but it's FinDi for you. HIGHLY recommend this place. Take all my business and non-business lunches there if I can help it. They also have a good vegetarian option.

Love this place for a casual, relaxed drink and/or dinner. I first came here to get a beer while I was waiting in line for Ramen Underground next door. The staff was super nice and friendly, and one look at their menu convinced me to try this place for dinner. I've been here 2-3 times since and have not been disappointed. Their happy hour deals for wine and beer is great, and everything I've tried from the menu has been good. I've had the quinoa salad, salmon salad crostini, pan con tomate with white anchovies, roasted chicken, fried chicken, and roasted wild salmon.

I'm so lucky this is a block away from where I live AND work. It's the freshest (probably organic) food you can get in the neighborhood. I love the roasted salmon or chicken w/arugula salad. The staff is super laid back and so nice. I think I'm a regular :) I always eat in. It's small, but there's always a spot, even if you have to share with a stranger. They also have coat/purse hooks everywhere. This place must be owned by a woman!
Too few staff to handle call in orders plus a lunch time rush. Waited a very long time for my sandwich. Not how I intended to spend my lunch hour.
Harrow = Happy Place. The owner and Jessica at the register are always nice. 1/2 Chicken salad sandwich & soup w/Boylan Root Beer for lunch makes my day. Can't go wrong with the whole menu.
Great food, fresh ingredients, relaxing atmosphere.  Will repeat many, many times. :)

Good food and a nice option on this stretch of Kearny, but I usually feel like I've overpaid for what I get for lunch. My coworker and I ate here this week and both of our sandwiches were so greasy that they we had to eat with a fork and knife. I've always had good food here, but just not great. Still they get points for convenience, ability to order half sandwiches/salads/soup, nice seating options, friendly service, and a good happy hour.
I was satisfied but not thrilled with my lunch here. I had the Mac and Cheese with a side salad.
What a gem! Feels like your in a cute funky neighborhood cafe rather than in the midst of downtown. Thoughtful, flavor packed good and GREAT music.
I came here strictly to try the polenta, and I left a happy camper!

I've worked in the Financial District for 6+ years now so I always get excited when something new opens up.  Harrow has not disapoointed.  Their chicken leg salad was to die for and their date salad is ridiculously delicious.  I love it so much I've gone back there every day this week.  I love the decor as well.  I've heard that they will be serving wine soon so I can't wait to re-visit and sip a glass of wine with my salad.

Got the Farmer's Market sandwich using the Go Dish App for 20% off and it was all really easy and hassle free. The sandwich was DELICIOUS and gourmet and I will definitely be coming back to try some other dishes! Highly recommend.
Great lunch spot - unique options, fresh ingredients. Friendly and fast service.

Felt like Mac & Cheese so I tried Harrow after reading quite a few reviews raving about theirs.   I got the Mac & Cheese and a Tomato Bisque to go.   The bill came to about $18 and change, no drink included.    I enjoyed the tomato bisque and the Mac & Cheese wasn't bad, but I don't think it was particularly great either.    Now it could be that one really needs to eat on location as opposed to getting it to go, but then again my office is only a couple of blocks away so that seems a somewhat dodgy explanation.    I'm not saying I won't be back, but Harrow is probably not where I'll come to get my Mac & Cheese fix... Wayfare Tavern's Mac is vastly superior.

Last night my girlfriend and I happened upon this place.  I will admit I was very skeptical at first, but she insisted we give it a  try.  I was blown away by the food and the service.  Jimmy, the chef, was not only passionate about us loving his food, but also incredibly generous with paired wine.  We had the crab soup, the fish wraps and the five spice chicken.  Each dish was impeccably done with attention to flavor balance and beautifully plated.  We will definitely return as Jimmy expands his menu.

I have been there twice. Both the food and service are great. Pho Ga is very tasty.  Squab, pork, fish lettuce wrap, and salmon were all good. I saw a little kid in the next table really enjoying the lamb chop. I can't wait to try it next time. They also have a good wine list. I wish other Chinatown restaurants can learn from these guys about service.
While growing up in Chinatown, my biggest fear was walking along the two block radius of Jackson Street and confronting with the Chinatown gangs.

Went with a party of 5 and everyone enjoyed their meal.  Nice modern ambience, nothing like the Chinatown usual.  One member desired a veggie only entree, and one was made up specially for him.  Very large portions.  The bill for 5 entrees  with 3 appetizers, 2 beers, 3 coffees was $129 (not including tip) which is ridiculously low considering everything.   My only small gripe is that service was a bit fast... I was enjoying myself and did not want to leave.   Go!

Finally, a restaurant in Chinatown that's not stuck in time. Modernized: super clean and the interiors are nice. Place been open for about two months I believe. I came here for food, when I sat down they gave me a nice well made menu only to contain wine and a paper food menu that could have easily been made by a child. Reasonable / affordable. Food is pretty dam good. Service was bomb. Just fix the food menu. I think we're finally heading towards the right direction Chinatown.

Great Service and wonderful Food! The rating and write-ups intrigued us to try them and they were fantastic. We had the Fried Calamari for the appetizer which were fresh and Delish. I then had the poached Salman which was tender and in a good white wine sauce. Love the Garlic Noodles!! I could make a meal just off them.

I found a gem in Chinatown coming from  New Jersey.  The food was exquisite equivalent to a  Zagat rated restaurant.  We started with raw oysters juicy and wonderful to taste.  Then we had squab with sautéed raisins and onions.  The squab was cooked to perfection;crispy skin  but the meat  is tender. The chef Jimmy suggested clams with garlic toast.  What a treat!  The bok Choy as a side dish was cooked perfect, crunchy but not raw.  To top it all, we ordered the chicken soup with noodles.  Chicken meat was tender and fresh.  The stock was just perfect.  I ordered one to take home for lunch tomorrow. The dessert flan was light and not heavy.  I give this restaurant a five star.  We also ordered a bottle of white wine to go with the meal.  It was a perfect night.  If you are looking for Indochine  cuisine  you have to try this one.  The decor is nice and spacious.  Waiters are friendly.
Food cooked with passion and culinary expertise!
Chef Jimmy was the best. Very passionate about the goff he makes. Yum yum.
Best new spot for pho!! Super good squab and chicken pho! Clean and fast service! Love this place.
The Bo Luc Lac was so delicious I'm still thinking about it two days later. Great service, excellent food.
BEGONI BISTRO IS THE SWANKIEST RESTAURANT IN SF CHINATOWN!!!
Begoni Bistro is a nice addition to Chinatown. The service was extremely good, and the interior was clean and spacious, especially compared to other restaurants in the area.

Fantastic place: food was delicious, i took  a boun Cha (not sure about the name) and my friend a large piece of meat perfectly cooked (according to her and the menu!). The owner, the waitress and the cook were all charming, and really fun; the place is lovely and they offered us a bonus glass of wine and a desert: I'm french and that´s unusual for me!
We had the fish wrap and shrimp crepe. The chef came to explain how to eat the dish, and everything was beyond delicious. Would go back and make it my regular spot if I lived here!
Ben says this is tastey but a little weird. Under Vermecelli section but called fried pancake

My wife and I just had dinner here tonight.  The food was excellent and the ambiance quiet, clean and stylish.  The waitstaff was very friendly and took pride in discussing the food and how to eat it Vietnamese style.  We had the crispy crab rolls and crispy pancake filled with pork, shrimp, and mushrooms.  Both were delicious.  For an entree we had stir fried filet mignon with onions.  It was also excellent.  I would recommend this place very highly.
I ate at Begoni last night and there was so much to like about my dining experience, I might go again tonight. Here's why:
Fabulous restaurant!  Food was delicious.  Service was friendly and fast.  The chef came out to visit and talk with us.  Would highly recommend.

This place serves very high quality, authentic and very original dishes. As a foodie, I loved the way they pay attention to the quality of the ingredients, and the waiter was very eager to help and pointed out some of the traditional Vietnamese eating customs which can very helpful to anybody who hasn't had this kind of food before.

good noodle soup, reasonably priced.  very clean and modern compared to the rest restaurants in Chinatown...yet it took them 20 mins to get our check..well the computer broke down so in the end we had to pay cash.

Been watching this place since it went under construction earlier this year.  Finally made it over to give it a test run today for lunch.  The place filled up quickly and it got very noisy with the concrete walls and wood floors (and clattering of dishes).  This place is spendier than the average places in the neighborhood, but, the food was very good.  Star of the meal for me was the vietnamese crepe.  Crispy on the outside, not at all greasy and plump with bean sprouts, shrimp, pork and enoki mushrooms.  Nice platter of fresh salad to wrap it in.  Yum!  I ordered my standard test meal, bun noodles with grilled pork and cha gio.  The rolls here are larger than average, so you get one in your salad.  The dipping sauce was delicious and had lots of fried shallots floating in it (yum).  My two companions each had filet, shaking beef and garlic noodles.  I had a taste of the noodles, not quite as garlicky as (for example Thanh Long or PPQ Dungeness) and got cold fast.  Overall, a solid 4 stars.  My plate came out first and we waited about 5 minutes, then an avalanche of plates and utensils.  I'll come back, the chicken pho at another table looked DEEEVINE.
The food is delicious. I like the beef carpaccio，and flan is good. Very good service.

I was recommended to this place by one of the owners' friends. We were also there for the soft opening.  I have to say the menu was very simple, not overly loaded with typical Vietnamese food selections. The atmosphere gives you a feel of a semi formal sit-down restaurant, which of course reflects the price. Yes there is a French flare hence Indochine. I was very pleased with the food from the plating to the taste. Because of the French flare, portions were on the conservative side compared to other "Vietnamese food" restaurants. Usually services don't effect my ratings as long as the food is good and cheap for any restaurant, but because of the $$ to low $$$ for two person meal, I'd like to see the service to be more uniform from seating to paying if not great, and it's one of those negative stereotypes about many Vietnamese restaurants. I'll come back after their official opening and try some more. Happy reading. Cheers.

My girlfriend and I come to this restaurant at least once a week since they first opened. We usually get the Pho Ga ( Chicken Noodle Soup ). The soup is tasty and the chicken is really good. Customer service is also great. You guys have to come check this restaurant out when you're around this neighborhood!
New lunch spot in Chinatown. I love their sister restaurant, Bodega Bistro in the TL already. This place is clean and remodeled nicely.

New place and the owners try really hard to create an A+ experience. The chicken noodle soup was great and the rest of the menu looks even better. It's refreshing to experience such a visually pleasant and clean new restaurant in Chinatown.
Heard the chef came from bodega bistro and after liking the food there, we just had to give this place a try.

I'm so happy that another good restaurant has opened in Chinatown!!! This is not your typical Vietnamese restaurants where they serve mainly pho. The menu is simple but provides variety. I do agree that that it's pricier than other Vietnamese restaurants in the area but I'm sure you won't get the same service, food quality or ambiance. Maybe I'm getting old. I would rather pay a little more to be comfortable, so I can enjoy my food. Cleanliness is also a big factor because I'm a germaphobe. I'm not sure why other yelpers were critical about their service. My server offered recommendations and explained the menu thoroughly. This is already like a 5 star service for Chinatown!
2 visits in one week!
This is a new Vietnamese/Indonesia/ French mix restaurant opened in Chinatown.

Love this Chinese/Vietnamese/French infused restaurant. Came to celebrate a friends bday and everything here was pretty good & decent. Tried their secret menu for the first time and the egg yolk tiger prawn was so bomb-diggity. I hope they put this dish up on their regular menu soon. Another good dish is their squab with the lemon pepper dipping sauce. So yum! If u haven't tried this place yet and your in town, def do!

I question the validity of the five star reviews this place has. They are just so vague, but still overflowing with high praise. Mind you, this place has been open a month and only has a total of 9 reviews so far. Some of the reviewers are so confused that they refer to Begoni Bistro as a Chinese restaurant. Though the restaurant bills itself as an Indochinese restaurant, it is actually closer to a Vietnamese/French restaurant, with standard fare you would find in a Vietnamese pho place and a few "upscale French influenced" entrees thrown in on their one-page paper menu. To add to the "identity-confusion" all the waitstaff appear to be Chinese, as they spoke Chinese fluently.

It is a new restaurant in Chinatown. The decoration is nice and everything is ... new. Ordered the raw beef dish which is $12sth for 9 thin-like-paper pieces of beef, and the crab meat noodle soup (Bun Rieu in Vietnamese) for $9.99. They are indeed pricey. The beef was a-okay, a below average quality compare to many Vietnamese places I have been to in the Bay Area. The noodle soup was the dish that I am very very disappointed at. The soup base was too light, tastes like it was diluted too much with water. The crab meat was not juicy. I have had muchhhh better Bun Rieu at many other restaurants, and I have to say this is the worse Bun Rieu I have ever had. If this place claims to be authentic, make it authentic.

Coming from portland, I wanted to check out the food SF chinatown offered. Located on a busy street filled with tons of restaurants i decided to try out Begoni, the first little restaurant i saw on Jackson street. At first glimpse, i noticed the cool little waterfall in front followed by the mouth watering aroma of fresh herbs and grilled meats.
Very nice to see another new good restaurant in Chinatown. Simple manu , but very teasty food..from appetizers to good bowl of noodles! Love their Chim Quay !

Very nice new restaurant in San Francisco's Chinatown district.  We were there for the soft opening.  The owner explained that food may take at least 30 minutes dispite the restaurant being well below capacity.  We were in no rush and were enjoying the nice decor that is so refreshing in the dated chinatown.

Saturday noon during full moon street fair and no wait??? I was thinking to myself wow we must try this place since mother in-law wanted to try it too and she specifically said there was always a wait when she wanted to go. She heard great things and knew this was the place to take her son and I, since we are huge on decor, atmosphere and of course food!

Great service  and delicious food. Vietnamese food that's fresh and tasty in a nice environment. Wonderful addition to Chinatown options. Will definitely go back. The 5 spice chicken and the green papaya salad were solid options.

Situated in the heart of Chinatown, this is a welcome change to traditional chinese food available everywhere.  Came for a family banquet Sunday afternoon and the food was  very fresh and flavorful.   Apparently they just opened on Saturday so were still working out some issues, but the waitstaff was very accommodating and pleasant.
It's a little on the pricey side but the food is quick, easy and tasty.
ONIGILLY ONIGILLY ONIGLLY!
Wasn't a huge fan of this place. It might be because I'm spoiled by genuine onigiri's in Kyoto...but either way, Onigilly doesn't do the precious rice ball justice!!! SADFACE TO THE MAX.

This my go-to "healthy" lunch in the FiDi.  Fast, tasty, cheap but nothing special.  Still, I'll continue to return because quick, healthy options are few and far between. The Snow Crab is my favorite.
Pretty quick and reasonable for the price. The food is alright, could be a little fresher maybe.
This is a great spot to grab some lunch. The onigiri is fresh and delicious! I came here recently to try it out with some coworkers. The line moves quickly and the orders are made in no time.

My coworker took me here for lunch earlier today since she warned that sushiritto would probably have a line. We walked over at around 1 pm and the line was out the door (literally). I was worried but then I realized how small the place is inside and the register is right by the doorway.
I've been here a few times and every time I wonder, "why the hell did I spend $10+ here? Not worth it."
What a strange little restaurant. I've eaten onigiri before in Japan, this is definitely a bit of an American take on it. I went here with friends and we all ordered a set of three.

i don't know why i waited so long to try this place. i love it! unagi and smoked salmon are both the bomb, and the mustard greens one was really good too. love the free tea, and the addition of edamame and pickles. and the guy who works the register is both very nice and very fast/competent.
The meal is so cutely made, it's hard not too like it before taking your first bite. :)
Food: 2 stars
Too bad they're not open on the weekends and not open for dinner but if you can come here for lunch during the week, you will not be disappointed.
Yummmmooooo. The salmon special was little dry, but the spicy bacon and snow crab was on spot. Keep it up.. you've got a fan.
I got the miso soup lunch with two onigiris.  The miso soup was full of seaweed.  The Hijiki onigiri was good but a bit soggy.  I also had the soboro onigiri.

I wish onigilly replaced sushirito on new Montgomery street. Love their brown rice idea and choice of fillings. Really need to go back to try more flavors! Their tamago was below average, that I would not get again.

Was at Plentea and saw this spot with a line out the door. Decided to try some. I love the concept of a lunch spot that specializes in just onigiri. I haven't had that many in the past, but these ones were pretty good! If I worked nearby, I would totally get lunch here often! Sometimes onigiris have too high of a rice to filling ratio. This one was not too bad. The salmon one and mushroom (maybe?) were good. The crab was a bit hefty bc it has mayo in it. I think they were about $3.50-$4 for one.
Wow this place is amazing. Warm, soft, chewy onigiri with flavor. Just found my new favorite place for lunch in FiDi!
I really wanted to like this place.

Fresh fruit mochi is delicious! The seaweed on the riceballs was a bit too much for me unfortunately :/ On the plus side, they have a variety of vegetarian options so if you're in the mood to try something new/different, this is the place to go in fidi!

I love onigiri. Even though I know better (high school Japanese, anyone?), I have a tendency to refer to it as "triangle sushi." But seriously, something about the rice (not quite sushi rice, it seems) and the filling (usually salmon or another delicious fish) put together into a little triangular package is so delicious. And Onigilly is a great place to get your onigiri fix in Financial District. The lunch line is long, but fast, and the employees are super friendly.
Tucked in FiDi area, can be packed during lunch hour

My go to place for a quick, light lunch in FiDi. I usually get the miso soup set to combat the year-round chilly-ness that is SF. I also like to eat there so I can take advantage of the complimentary barley tea.

I loved my brown rice snow crab da best!! Perfect amount of rice and filling ratio! Really love the side edammame and yellow pickles on the side. I would still love to try the spicy bacon and other flavor next time!
Healthy and affordable lunch date with my boyfriend right after getting tea from plentea. The line wasn't long since we came around 11am on a weekday before workers started coming for the lunch rush.
Love the food here, but the line is ridiculous during the day. And not enough seating :(
Healthy, affordable, and fast! Can't think of anything better for lunch.
This place is absolutely awesome! I actually stumbled upon it while looking for sushirrito but this place dishes out nice comforting food quickly and for a reasonable price.

What is an onigiri you ask? Imagine if a Sushi Hand Roll mated with one of those little Triangle Sandwiches that old ladies serve at tea time... They would produce an onigiri. Replace the bread of the sandwich with triangle shaped brown rice, fill it with some sort of flavorful veggie/meat/seafood  filling and wrap it in seaweed ... Voila! Onigiri!
Ordered the soboro and grilled salmon riceballs. Both were delicious. The salmon more so but I like salmon so I'm just a bit biased.
OMGilly this place is so good! If you like sushi or fish (cuz it's not quite sushi :) they are definitely worth exploring.

I was looking forward to trying this place for a while, and sadly I set my expectations a bit too high. It's a cheap, quick lunch with very friendly service--the cashier explained many of the menu items to me and my compadre. However, and maybe this was just unlucky ordering on my part, I found the fillings to be heavy on the mayo to the point where it was overpowering. I like the idea, so I'll probably be back. I got all fish fillings last time, I'll diversify a bit next time.

Here's a good way to add variety into your workweek lunch. The flavors aren't 100% spot on, but the onigiri should keep you from getting stuck in a rut with sushi, sandwiches, and salads all the time. The toppings tend to be salty, so the saltiness tends to mask the actual flavors (especially in the teriyaki flavors). Honestly, they're good enough to overlook the saltiness

This place is tiny, and it takes some time to look through their entire menu. Take too long being indecisive, and you'll find yourself moving over for the line forming rapidly behind you. Except there isn't much room for you to stand and browse, because again, it's TINY which can get pretty frustrating.

YES! Finally a place that sells ichigo daifuku where you don't need to sit down for a meal (Eiji). Plus Eiji limits you to one. The strawberry mochi was very good and I love how they pack it in a little cup so it doesn't get smashed. Totally worth the price because mochi is a pain to deal with.  I can make these myself but it's a lot of work (at least for me) and my kitchen always end up in a mess. The strawberry was sweet. I've always had not so good tasting strawberries from Two Ladies Kitchen. I also had the unagi onigiri which was very good.  The cashier is super friendly.
After experiencing a delicious onigiri shop in Southern California last year, I was excited to find one in SF! It's a small little shop among other eateries on Kearny Street.

Good deal for good quality. Service is quick. Food, the rice is delicious. It's not the cheapest for rice balls but it's good quality and it's cheaper than most Asian food in the area. I'll definitely go eat there again!

My favorite lunch spot! There's usually a line around lunch time but it moves quickly. Lots of vegan options and always the best customer service. I also love that there's no issues with cross contamination here with the meat/fish/veggies unlike some other places. The fresh handmade mochi are vegan and SO delicious - would highly recommend.

I finally got to try this place and it was so worthwhile. We got two rice bowls and one of their new offerings: the strawberry mochi. While their rice bowls were quite delicious, I was more in awe of their mochi. It's made fresh daily and their staff was thoughtful enough to warn us against refrigerating the mochi. The mochi is the perfect texture and sweet red bean to strawberry to mochi ratio was just right. I only regret not having the foresight to order more. I think this is a wonderful addition to their menu and will definitely be back for more.
This place has such fantastic customer service, I had to give them a review ASAP. The food was fast, warm and tasted very good. :)
The coffee crunch cake is awesome!  Our addition to the wedding cake was more popular than the main because of this wonderful confection!
Not great on costumer service. But the bomb for their goodies. I had the chocolate coconut Macaroons. You want 10 of those. Super soft and flavorful and buttery.

The shrimp in their har gow was dry & chewy, not juicy & flavorful like it should be. Utterly disappointing, so I threw it out since it was inedible. The siu mai was a bit dry too, but at least it was edible. Flavor was just ok.
Simple. They don't care about their customers.
Lotus Moon pies are off the hook. See if you can get one while they're still warm.

The egg custard tart here is by far the best! Custard was lightly sweet with no overpowering egg taste. Crust was nice and flaky. If you happen to get a batch right out of the oven, even better! Nice and warm and the custard still jiggly. Mmm mmm mmm! I'd say even better than Golden Gate Bakery and cheaper too!

Growing up Cantonese in the Monterey Bay area in the 1970s, my family and I used to have to drive up to SF Chinatown to buy groceries, baked goods, and such; this was before the South Bay was populated with so many Asians.
What a gem! This is a fantastic little bakery located on grand Avenue in Chinatown, San Francisco.
YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(272/365) "More Custardy Goodness!"

I was looking for the standard Chinatown walking tour and one of the recommended stops was Eastern Bakery.   There's definitely a cultural difference when it comes to customer service in China Town.   I get the impression they're barking at you to hurry up your order (which may or may not be the intention).   With that said I purchased one butter cream bun, a couple chocolate covered fortune cookies, and a golden lotus moon cake.   I wish they gave me napkins after I paid for the items but once I got back to my room, I noshed on the butter cream bun (YUM....may have to go back just for that) and one of the chocolate fortune cookies.   The combo of the cookie and chocolate is always a winner...and my fortune...
Lots of cakes and pastries to chose from. We bought some bread and buns to snack on at the hotel and they didn't last long.

coffee crunch cake. . . .i don't know why i only bought one slice. me and hubbz walked around the corner to taste the cake. and i wanted to walk back in and buy the rest of the cake. i also adore their custard tarts. but it's all about that coffee crunch cake.. if you don't see in in pastry window. just wait the extra 5 minutes for it. $4 a slice. i think it's worth it. . . .
I work 1 block away and whenever I feeling like a pork-bun kind of morning. I will take the chance of being late to grab a couple pork buns.
I don't know what's so BAM about this place...

Stopped here to buy snacks. I was the first customer. It was deserted. Now I know why. The sponge cake was yesterday's. Old and stale. The dim sum and pork buns were fresh but did not taste that good at all. I threw all that away. The woman at the counter is so irritated that I didn't dare ask for a fresh sponge cake or a refund.   The best thing was the sesame ball.  The cookies were stale too. What a disappointment
stopped for for two moon cakes ($10.75) the day after autumn moon. baked fresh in house, fair price, good help, good taste.

I wasn't overly impressed with the food here. I think since its closer to the Chinatown gates it is a little more touristy. I tried their baked pork bao, a steam pork bao, sesame ball, and a mellon cookie. I was disappointed by the baos, theirs were a little more old school style that had a strong taste of rice wine and the flavor profile was more savory than sweet. Often bbq pork baos have a good balance of both sweet and savory. The steam bao was not fluffy and light, but a little on the denser side.

Very few things stay as good as you remembered from when you were a child. After not having one of their moon cakes for years, I broke down and bought a box for this year's Mid Autumn Festival. Its distinct taste is exactly the same and as good as I remembered as a child.

I have been going here for more than 15 years (during business trips to the Bay Area). It has a tremendous charm in person (a reminder of what Hong Kong bakeries were like in the 1990s before the UK gave it up). It is a warm, alive place: the opposite of cold formality. Everything is good here, but the mooncakes are simply out of this world. All my (Chinese) family love them, all the various kinds. Every year, I mail order 6 or 7 assorted boxes to give away at Harvest Festival time. Mostly lotus (my favorite), but also black bean, winter melon (yum yum), fruit & nut (my niece loves). STRONGLY RECOMMENDED!
Meh.  Expected a lot given this is one of the oldest SF Chinese bakeries in town.  Old does not equal great.  Even compared to some Calgary bakeries it didn't compare.  Which isn't saying much.
I've been eating from this place since I was 7 now I'm 70 and I still come here to buy the best the city (SF) Chinese bakery.  There is none better in the USA

pros...have been coming here for decades now, even when i was a kid some 43 years ago my parents would go here for hard to find desserts and pastries.  as we lived in San Diego, where the chinese community is not nearly as big, we had to made due with the few asian bakeries way back when.

Came here to get some mooncakes and pastries since Golden Gate Bakery was closed. The pastries were surprisingly good, though the mooncake can't beat the ones at GGB. Definitely a good alternative if you're too lazy to wait in the long line at GGB!
Eastern Bakery is known for making fresh moon cakes year-round. I love how they offer mini size ones because just because you can eat a whole regular sized one doesn't mean you should.

Great little locals-only bakery in the middle of the tourist district.  Can't go wrong with the moon cake, egg tart or coffee crunch cake.  Just stay away from the moon cake with yolk unless you know what you're doing--it's cake with salty fermented egg in the middle.
The best coffee crunch cake in the world.  Eastern Bakery also features many other delectable items.  They have nicest staff too.  We have been huge fans of this bakery for decades.
Bought some snacks/pastries there last Friday and everything was stale!
Very long wait for just ok food.  Do not expect any service, it is non existent here!  Very rude desk staff!
This old time bakery has changed ownerships a few times as the original owners sold the business and retired in the late '70's, early '80's.
Expensive compared to the other bakeries in Chinatown
I never thought in a million years I'll be giving four stars to egg tarts.
An authentic bakery serves delicious Chinese sweets... The lotus filled Chinese cookie was sweet and unique.
This place has the best old lady cookies, okay that is what it is called in Chinese.  The outside is flaky and moist the inside is a lotus filling and it has some crunch.  It is so yummy yummy yum!

The oldest bakery in the U. S.  And it's obvious. Cluttered and dirty inside. Cashier wasn't friendly and was clipping her fingernails behind the counter, yuck. Waited fifteen minutes for bubble tea. The pastries are tasty but I'm sure I could have found something better.
Almond cookies are addicting and delicious!  Buttery goodness. I bet you won't be able to eat just one. Good thing they sell them by the bag! :) Lots of yummy options here!

I don't know why this place has four stars on yelp. As a Chinese I know there are much better bakeries in chinatown and this place does not have tasty food nor good prices. It is over priced because it is in the tourist street, and the cake taste so bad as if I'm eating raw eggs. It is all about the location.
Don't let the outside fool you.  I would go out of my way every time I'm in San Francisco JUST to get one of their chocolate-dipped macaroons.  To die for!
There are quite a few bakeries in SF Chinatown and I can think of two off the top of my head that are at least four stars. Therefore, this one gets three.

This place has definitely seen better days. Despite the old and kinda dingy appearance, they continue to churn out some of the best baked goods around at decent prices. Endless variety of moon cakes, delectable coffee crunch cake for all you sweet tooths out there, and makes the biggest and tastiest deep-fried sesame ball, I've ever had. Mostly Chinese based pastries available here, but they do a decent job with the American pastries as well: Sugar donuts, chocolate chip cookies, palmier cookies, etc.
Love their Coffe crunch cake and their green bean pastry. Definitely will be back for another one of that cake
Lamb & Beef Gyros were dry and heavy on iceberg lettuce. Pita was flat and rather unappealing.
Greek salad had too much vinegar. Taboulah had no olive oil or lemon juice whatsoever. Even the olives on the salads didn't taste good. I won't be coming here again.
