Quite impressed by the store just bordering North Beach, and with the yellow blaring sign above (how I find it)...
Only ordered the shrimp & chive dumpling and the red bean.  Both were excellent.  If anyone knows of another place that has great chive dumplings...please let me know (they're my favorite)!!
xiao lung biao - fatty meat, no juice , skin is terrible - 1

I avoided this place for so long because it looked so dive-y, but my asian friend kept bringing over these amazing steamed buns and he kept telling me the place was right down the street.  Guess I'd have to give them a try...
They have the best steamed buns (man tou) in town -- in fact, best I've ever had in my life!
regular pork siu my is the best.   I enjoyed buying however many of each item as I wanted.

I don't make it out to Chinatown that often but when I do, I try to get some takeout dim sum and of course, steamed chicken buns.  Louie's seems to specialize in steamed buns though they have dim sum too.  They had a plate of dim sum on the counter that looked like it had been sitting there for days.  The potstickers looked big, greasy and doughy.  The shop has been here forever and looks like your typical old, run down Chinatown takeout dim sum shop.
The Mantou -- fluffy, warm, sweet (kill me!) -- are the only reason I come here!
best man tou's ever.
stop # 4 on pork bun marathon. ranking: 6th out of 6 places.

I've been to my fair share of these no-frills take-out dim sum shops.  They come in handy when I am making my rounds in Chinatown.  The shrimp dumplings were among some of the best I've had, and the sausage roll was tasty, but the pot stickers were an absolute disappointment.  If a shop like this can't do pot stickers right. . . .

Craving Dim Sum and forgot that today is Wednesday and my go-to spot DDS is closed.  Friendly woman at the counter and plenty of selections and the good sign of Chinese patrons sitting at tables.  Bland, weird tasting dim sum, I ate one piece, then two.  I tossed the rest of what I bought when I tasted the distinct flavor of moldly in the food (piece two).  Glad I stopped for some veggie noodles elsewhere as a side.  I won't be coming back.

Decent place to grab a QUICK bite. We got a plate full of shrimp dumplings, fried dumplings, soup dumplings, pork and shrimp balls, bbq pork buns, etc. Everything was decent, not the best. It's cheap too. I'd stay away from the boba though, everything is just stored in the fridge in large containers and poured into a cup when ordered.

We should have taken a hint when this place was quiet during the lunch rush. In any case, we took our chances mostly because we were too lazy to wait in line, and we paid for it. I don't even have dim sum that often and I could tell that the food didn't quite taste right. House of Dim Sum fell short in almost every possible way. The flavors were bland, the textures were all wrong, and weird substitute ingredients were often used for traditional dishes.

It is good for what it is, a cheap and quick dim sum place. The service was not bad. The Chinese lady serving the food was pretty friendly and gave me some good suggestions. The options were rather limited.
Awesome dumplings. The facility could be cleaner, however the food is great (and affordable) and the people were very friendly.
Ok dim sum at best. The customer service and cleanliness is terrible. Prices are ok but the lady wore the same gloves to take money, serve food and clean up. Wont come back.

The food is good and cheap here - but eating off a paper plate with a plastic fork goes against my grain... never the less,  the place is okay... but maybe not "A-Ok".  When I first started going there I made a video of the experience:
It could just be me but I did not have a good experience here.

Actually, we wanted to go to Delicious Dim Sum, but there was no table available at that time. That's why we ended up with this because it's just across the street. The ladies serving food were so rude to me. One of them didn't even hear what I was saying - I just tried to figure out how I can make an order! The shrimp and pork something dim sums are good, but not warm enough... I strongly recommend you to take your time to wait for a table in the restaurants with great reviews.
This place is just ok - the price was ok, the food was ok, tge service was ok. But i bet there are restaurants with much more tastier dim-sum around and even across the street.
COLD. Cheap tasting. Not good.

We ate some food here while waiting for Lai Hong to open. It was very bland and there was a fly crawling over our rice. The law muy gai had very little meat and the chow mein is dry. The portions were big, but who cares if the food sucks?

This was probably the worst chinese restaurant I've ever been to. The food was perfectly equated with the service: HORRIBLE. The lady who served us our food was rude and unclear. Sadly, the food she served us didn't make up for her bad attitude. I hope anyone visiting the beautiful San Francisco will never find themselves eating in a place that represents chinese culture and food in the city as badly as this place does. There are millions of better places to go. Believe me.

I can't comment on the quality of the dim sum, but we did stop in here for a boba and were disappointed. The line is short yet still slow, and the woman at the counter was rather unpleasant. Our milk tea was super saccharine to the point of being undrinkable, and the boba seemed stale and tasted a little off. If that's the kind of disregard they take toward the beverages, I'd be somewhat cautious toward the food.

Avoid this place! Went on a hunt for good dim sum in Chinatown and sadly ended up in here. Dim sum was very oily and flavorless. With Delicious Dim Sum right across the street serving more inexpensive and tasty dim sum, there's no reason to come here.
Filthy!!

First time in SF's Chinatown so dim sum was on my agenda. This place had quite a selection. The best thing I tried was the cilantro shrimp.  Worst choice was the chow mein.  Doesn't seem appealing when they have to zap it in the microwave (in front of you).  By the time I got to it on my plate, it had gotten cold/hard so I left most of it. Also the flimsy paper plates weren't a big hit, since some of the things I was putting on my plate were quite heavy and moist. The place did have frequent customers, which should be a good sign, but I'm rating it an OK only.

Overall this place it's like 2.5 stars but because they didn't deserve a 3 I.didn't round up so here's why..when you walk in here you are definitely a little intimidated because you don't expect this type of setup especially when I'm used to being catered to..not that I mind but just a little different. From other people I was aware that dim sum sit down restaurants were super expensive here in the BAY so your best option is to go where they offer the pink box full of goodies and take it togo.well they had a sit down area to eat here but boy was it straight ghetto.. the place was old and they gave you paper plates plastic forks and it seemed like when you sat down to eat here it just felt like the place hasn't been cleaned in 20 years..but as for the food it was decent but not your best.
There is additional seating upstairs. One of the few dim sum places with seating available. The food was fair, but can get a little pricey.

Decent dim sum joint. Pretty old school from the looks of the place, so it's a good place to go if you're look for some old school traditional style dim sum. The inside is relatively small, with only 3 small tables, so it's definitely not a sit-down kind of place (note the large "food to go" sign right on the entrance).

This place was my first taste of dim sum in San Fran and I was disappointed. Nothing I got tasted fresh (ie buns were stale), they were out of a bunch of things as well...I got the feeling that the dim sum sits there all day.

No frills hole and the wall dim sum to go place.  The dim sum was sub par in my opinion and they charge you for tea.  But if you just want some dim sum quick and don't want to spend too much money, then this is definitely the place for you.
Ran out of noodles at lunch time.  They had to micro the plate they did give us.  Blah

Sadly, we blew it.  We visited SF's Chinatown and managed to find crappy dim sum.  Dang it!  We actually walked into Delicious Dim Sum, but they only had 2 (occupied) tables, so we wandered over yonder to find somewhere else with seating.  Curses!
Some of my food was cold, and I feel like it wasn't as cheap as other places, but it was tasty, and the meat was of decent quality, which tends to be one of the most important factors for me.
Not too expensive

The worse!!!! Cold food in this resutrant!! Worse service ever!! Really really bad attitude toward the costumes!! There is a Chinese Woman being so rude!! I am Chinese but she seems to hate life n work there. Never want to go there again! I will give zero star if I can.
I only suggest eating here if you're super hungry and if you do to get the wonton soup it's the only thing worth eating. Other than that I'm sure there's a better place around to eat.

WOW!  WOW! WOW WOW!  Seriously?  Amazing little clouds of bbq pork that just melt into your mouth wanting more.  So delicious, that you just eat them on the go, while walking around the fabulous Chinatown.  I went back and bought some to bring home.  Oh what a buck can do!  This is the first place I'll go to when ever I go back to San Francisco.  :)  Remembering the taste brings a smile to my face :)
Keep in mind this place is cash only. We had  to withdraw cash from an ATM to pay for our meal. The dim sum was delicious, but cold. Our meal was only $12 though and it was enough to feed two people.

I love this hole in the wall dim sum place.  It's a good place to stop if you are traveling on a budget and want to try some of the local fare.  My favorites are the steamed pork buns and the sponge cake.  They have a menu board with pictures and English now, which is a plus.  In years past, we used to point at anything that looked good and hope for the best.  Sometimes you end up with something you may not have initially wanted due to an occasional language barrier, but that's part of the fun!
Just stop here cuz saw some
Not an expert in Dim Sum but they were very good and inexpensive! We tried about 10 different ones and all good and fresh made!

Amazing quality dim sum and incredible price. Chinese locals eat there for a reason. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Poor decoration and furniture and dirty restrooms but you should go there if you are looking for authentic dim sum.
Awful!   I would rate this no star.  Found a bug on my hard steamed pork bun.  Waste of money even a bum wouldn't take my left overs.
Oh House of Dim Sum, you disappoint me.
Really inexpensive, large selection, very friendly accommodating waitresses - who stand behind the counter and plate the  selections you point to .

If you want to actually sit down and have some dim sum instead of the typical grab and go in the area, this is a good spot. It's definitely a hole in the wall, but every dumpling I've had has been great.

Warning-Do not use the restroom or you will lose your appetite. That being said, the dim sum is good. The two  of us ate for lunch for $12.50. Both stuffed. Love the shrimp filled steamed dumplings. Good place for a quick lunch.

Worst dim sum I've ever had, paired with horrible service. I know Chinese waiters aren't the politest folks, but this was absurd. We really should have just walked out, and if you're reading this post while standing in front of the counter, you should too.

After reading fellow yelper anthony a.'s review I knew I wanted to stop here for drinks during my brief trip to chinatown. We made it in time for happy hour (where the drinks and food are half price in the bar). I ordered lychee mai tais and they were great. Plenty of alcohol and very fruity, though I didn't taste any lychee. The views were as good as promised and the bartender/waiter was top notch. The decor was stylish and dated in a wonderful way. I felt like with the right lighting and crowd it could be featured in one of those Heineken commercials.

We sat in the bar while waiting for our dinner reservation. Once it came close to the time we had reservations I closed out the bar tab. She brought me the ticket which showed $60 for drinks and an appetizer, fine. I gave her my credit card and it came back charged $87 with the 0 through the tip. She automatically added what she thought she deserved as a tip to my credit card. Who does that! I will never ever ever go there or recommend that to anybody ever!

Was really not impressed with this place. I gave it a second star because the view and the decor are great, but other than that save your money. Prices run from $18 to $22 a plate and the portions are not that big. The waiter never came back to the table after dropping off the food. I'd rather find a little mom and pop chinese place where the prices are more reasonable and the food tastes better. Also we only had 4 people and they added a 18% gratuity to our bill then charged us extra to split it.
I went to a lovely wedding + reception at the Empress last night.
Went for Happy Hour. Drinks good. Food crappy greasy, meat tough. View great. Grumpy server!

Went for Happy Hour, drinks and appetizers were 50% off.  Drinks were okay but even with half off $18.95 for the combo appetizer, it was not worth it.  Won ton, egg rolls etc. were greasy.  BBQ pork spareribs were very dry, seemed old.  The place is very old also.  View was nice but the place needs renovation.
I only been to this place for once for my friends birthday. It is a great atmosphere and definitely a different style bar. They're happy hour is very well-known.

This place is horrible. It is located on the sixth floor so the view is good. Other than that, I was not impressed at all. The place had a weird odor to it. Decor was old and not the good kind. Customer service, not friendly or good at all. We stood there for almost 10 minutes waiting for someone to acknowledge we were there. finally an old and angry lady told us to sit down. We sat down at a table by the window and she handed us menus. We sat there for almost 20 minutes as a table of employees sat around laughed and ignored us. We walked out. It was probably best we did, because it was pretty dingy and scummy looking. You're better off going to the Golden flower. It's just a block over.

I think the beautiful view and the classic, professional servers/service makes this place.  Otherwise, the food is good but not mind-blowing. It's traditional fare and nothing amazing about it. I think if you go, you are going because you want to experience the restaurant, it's history, the view, the service and the fact that it is in SF Chinatown.  If you're ok with this, then I think you'd enjoy it.

There was an Empress of China in my hometown. It was led by a pretty terrifying woman by the name of Mrs. Wong. She didn't suffer fools, children, sunshine, or puppies. She was to be feared! She was a very successful business woman (intimidation pays well) and sponsored a float in the local Derby parade. As part of the float, she wanted to have local children perform the dragon dance. I was one of the children picked to perform. As we practiced, we endured long, grueling hours of holding heavy dragon parts by a mounted stick and suffering insults and threats of discipline because 'Dragon look HUNGRY!!!' after our little arms were unable to keep the beast aloft. It was a traumatic moment of my life. One, I suppose, I never quite got over. So, when my friend told me we were coming to the Empress of China, I began to shake.

Underwhelming food. Out of town guests were disappointed. You get a sense that nothing is fresh. For 3 people they added on 20 percent gratuity, yet we never saw our waiter between him dropping the food and getting the check. They need a Gordon Ramsey.
Best happy hour! Most drinks are $5 and this is a wonderful, historic building. Don't miss the celebrity photos or the view from the lounge. Love this place!

Our group of three had the opportunity to eat lunch at the Empress of China last Monday. On a positive note I will say that the quantity of food we received was quite large. On a negative note it was bland, the pork tough and all three of our orders were served lukewarm at best. The service was ok if your standards are average. They never did ask if we would like a refill of our drinks or how is your meal?

Loved this place.  Right out of the '60s for atmosphere, but it was so cool.  The menu was authentic and the food quality was great.  We had a great view and the prices are spectacular for SF.  The staff is really old school and very professional.  It is little hard to find, but the view of Russian hill was a great surprise.  I'll make it a point to visit whenever I'm in SF.
If I could give this place no stars I would.
Hmmm..
The food; nice and plentiful.

Mainly for tourists.  Food wasn't that great. It didn't taste authentic Chinese cooking.  Ingredients were not fresh.  If visiting SF and looking for good Chinese restaurant then go elsewhere.  I did not see single Chinese customer eating here. I only saw Caucasian tourists.  That a red flag not to eat here.
All they need to do is play a little Rat Pack and we'd be transported back to this bar's origins.  A Mai Tai, a professional bartender, and a cash register that rings from the '60s. Perfect.

I went to this place with my co-workers for a large birthday celebration for my supervisor (~100 people). As others mentioned, the view is pretty good but that's all you get. To put it lightly, the food tasted worst than it looked (and it didn't look good at all! The crab for example was slimy and gross). The service was horrible too. There were several vegetarians in our group and they did not have any vegetarians options for these people so they put something together last minute, which from what I understand, was disgusting! Furthermore, the waiting staff were extremely rude and lacked any level of professionalism. I asked for an extra bowl of rice and the waiter responded with "I only have this one." I estimate our supervisor spent several thousand dollars on dinner that night and it is appalling that I couldn't even get an extra bowl of rice, especially considering the fact that none of the other food was edible. If I could, I would rank this place a -5 I would. Fast food like Panda Express is probably more worth your time and money than this atrocious place. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place!

Great view but slow service then food was served cold.  They didn't seem to care, either.  Decor was circa 1970 but comfortable.  I would recommend trying one of the many other restaurants in Chinatown.

Ummm.... I would take my chances next time at one of the grease kitchens with yellowed windows.   The staff is confused, the menu is limited.   If you are eating here the empress beef is actually tasty... Otherwise I would give this place one star.   Makes you wish for a time machine back to 1989.  Maybe it was good then.
Decaying opulence.
I've never eaten here but the happy hour specials are great and the views are even better!
Decent food, not exceptional. Beautiful view of COIT tower & around, from 6th floor. Service is very good & swift. Loved the Chicken Fried rice.
I have never eaten here. I have no interest in eating here. I go for the mai tai. It is $5 during happy hour and tastes pretty good.

Carmel U. sums it up perfectly when she talks about the "penthouse view". It is truly amazing. The views from the bar of Russian Hill, Coit Tower, North Beach, and parts of the bay are to die for. Although, if you really want spectacular, a table in the restaurant by the windows is really the way to go. Not just the waiters are old school. the whole place feels like it hasn't really changed much since the 70's either décor-wise or intent. If you look, you CAN find some modern touches, like Tyku in one of the cocktails. Now, they do make a pretty good Mai Tai, but in general, the cocktails are kind of lackluster. So were our bar snacks. Service was OK. They were nice, but kind of slow considering we were the only customers in the bar area.

Best penthouse bar in all of San Francisco.  The views of Coit Tower, North Beach, Russian Hill and parts of the bay are incredible.  The waiters wear the old school red serving jackets and the drinks are STRONG.  If you are lucky enough to get there when it isn't busy make sure you sit along the far wall (by a huge window).
Great view, that's all you get here.

I came here with a large group a few months back. It did the job, and we had a great time. The food was good enough, but not really anything to write home about. Because it was all served off table instead of on a lazy susan, there was a lot of wasted food (one person didn't like a dish, the next person didn't get enough of that dish, etc). The dessert was so icky that we're still talking (and laughing) about it. Congealed bright pink pudding? THAT'S FRIED? Oh man.

I love the empress of china! lovely American Chinese food in the heart of chinatown, table-side serving, great cocktails, a beautiful view of Coit Tower, beautiful carved-wood furnishings. the wait staff is attentive and kind. try the mushu pork, the sizzling rice soup, and the Empress salad.

One of the best (if not, the best) of SF Chinatown!!  I was scrambling to find a decent place as everywhere else seemed to be really run-down and only 2 or 3 stars on yelp... I know, I know-it's Chinatown.  I shouldn't have my hopes that high in the first place.

It was really pretty inside and had a great view but that's about it. The staff were rude and did nothing but chat together...we waited about 20 min and no one came by our table for drink/food order so we left. Also kind of pricey :(

We came back here for another banquet style dinner but this time is for my father-in-law's 80th surprise birthday party.  Two of the dishes were reprise such as the special wonton soup and lo mai gai.

First time here in San Francisco. I didn't think it was the greatest place to eat. The food was weak and a few pieces of chicken that wasn't cooked all the way. The dishes had barely any meat. Service was alright but way over priced for what you get. The waiter told me the appetizers were suppose to be half off then after my meal he said its only at the bar. They lie to get you in the door with 50% appetizers and drinks but they don't tell you its only valid at the bar. This place smells and I found hair in my food. Avoid at all costs!!!!!!!

I can't speak to the food, because we've never eaten here - but the bar is great! Empress is on top of a hill in Chinatown with the most amazing view of Telegraph Hill. The drinks are average, but happy hour is a good deal - 3-6pm every day, half off everything. Also, be sure to note the retro vibe, the chandelier in the dining room, and the old celeb photos downstairs!
While there are a few drawbacks one can hardly ignore the opulence of the Empress of China. This is an elegant room with a view that is a wonder.
Came here for a nonprofit event.
Our waiter was very helpful and provided to great care to make our meal enjoyable. We relaxed and watched the crowd strolling below and experienced great food.
I've been going here and bringing friends for 10 years. This place has an amazing dining room that looks out to the Coit Tower.
Small place, could use some love and attention but the food was good. The service was friendly.  Generous portions...I had leftover for 2 days.
The slow cooked Beef Stew in Clay Pot was tender and delicious. This is one of my favorite dish here in Utopia Cafe.
*CAN'T USE CARDS FOR BILLS UNDER $20*

What a colossal disappointment!  They used to have the best won ton soup in town.  I don't know what happened but it was horrible! Pot stickers were doughy and tasteless. Chicken salad was a mound of wilted lettuce with a few tiny shreds of chicken.  Never again!
Good, nice they stayed open so late for us...asked waitress her favorite dish; Mongolian Beef, meat was tender (not norm elsewhere) and tasty but it was pricey considering...tourist area perhaps.

OMG, best duck ever! I asked the waitress what type of style this was and she said just Chinese roasted duck.  The chef only spoke Chinese so I gave him the thumbs up and $10 tip.  The only reason for going to San Francisco would be for the roasted duck and Pier 39 on the weekend.
Came here because babe and his friends really wanted clay rice pots (and because they had to run errand in ct).

Like many other yelpers, we were sucked in by the lady handing out flyers. The place wasn't too packed and we were seated right away. Soon after a big group comes in and they are immediately served their drinks. About ten minutes passed and the waitress finally comes by to take our food and drink orders. The food was decent, but in all honesty the service was horrible. The waitress was rude, pushy, and never checked back on us to see if we needed anything else. The cherry on top of it all...when paying for the tab we took the advice of another yelper and paid with cash and the waitress advised us that our tab did not include a tip. She ended up taking what we had given her even though we intended on receiving our change back.  My advice for future customers: please be sure to always have change when coming to this place because they will NOT return your change if it does not include a sufficient tip.

I was fiendin' for clay pot rice so I ventured to Utopia Cafe as per 7x7's recommendation. It was packed at 6:30pm on a Saturday night, so that was reassuring. Service was quite slow, but you are quite foolish if you expect attentive service at a Chinese restaurant.

This place was such a disappointment. First my chicken in lemon sauce was nothing more than a bunch of over fried chicken nuggets with some bottled sauce dripped on top of it. The waitress dropped off the food and never saw her again for 30 minutes until she brought the check by.

So here I am because this place showed up on 7x7 because of the salted fish and minced pork clay pot. I thought the dish was just ok, the rice on the bottom of the claypot wasn't as crunchy as I expected and the service was mediocre, we were seated right away and given menus but we asked for water and it took us asking like 3times before they brought us any water. Overall experience, a typical chinese  restaurant with meh service.

This place is just ok, nothing spectacular or special. In our case we had been walking for hours in Chinatown, with all the hustle going on....horns going off like crazy, tourists like myself walking around shopping.  This happen to be the first place we see and by this time we were on the verge of collapsing from not having eaten. Even so it was just ok. The water tasted funny, it was pretty warm that day and they gave me like 2 ice cubes with my water. Come on! If you happen to be walking by and need food ASAP and feel like you can't take another step, go on in....it won't kill you but it won't change your life for good either. Just something to quiet your tummy until you can get some REAL food in you. Oh and careful when paying for your bill in cash, we paid the lady and she took it upon herself to assume the change was her tip. She never came back with our change so I had to go up there and get my change.
This place was great! The food was fresh and priced good! The owner and workers were all so friendly we will definatly be going back!
Service - 5 stars
I love this place, it's simple Chinese food done right. You cannot go wrong with their clay pots and chicken wings :)

I came here with my family and we got the Salted Fish Chicken Fried Rice, the Fried Chicken Wings, Curry Beef Stew Clay Pot and Beef Stew with Wonton Noodle Soup. My favorite was the Chicken Wings, they were a tad bit salty, but they were super crispy and juicy :) Another notable mention is the fried rice, which was very tasty :) The server was nice too.
I like there hot pot steam rice when I come to sf with a craving for that.. I love the black bean sauce chinese spareribs hot pot rice with veggies in it.

On the last Wednesday or Thursday night of every month (you need to check as it does vary) from 7:30-9:30 pm they have open mic night and some of the city's finest musicians are on hand to perform. Totally hidden gem and amazing evening. Next one scheduled for June 26! See you there!

Such an awesome find amongst a ton of eating options in Chinatown. Had the Hong Kong style beef chow fun and duck with Chinese sausage clay pot. Both were incredible and fair priced. Menu is huge and mostly in mandarin which makes me feel like I found a legit spot. Doesn't make sense I know but it works for me. One bathroom makes it interesting when it's busy in the restaurant. Great for groups with their lazy Susan family type tables.

We were walking through Chinatown the other night and saw this place full of Chinese customers and figured it must be better than the last place we tried on Grant. I saw on Yelp how mixed the reviewers were, but we decided to give it a shot. We had the Chinese sausage and dried duck claypot and the "wet" beef chow fun (or, what I think is more commonly called "beef chow fun with gravy") that some Yelpers recommended.
I love the food. Huge variety of clay pots.

The tea was nothing special. They gave us some kind of free mystery meat soup, which was weird. The ingredients in the wor wonton soup were nice and hefty. The e-noodles with seafood were ok. But their signature dish, the clay rice pot, was incredibly salty and a huge disappointment. Their bathroom was also a storage closet near a bunch of dirty fish tanks. So, should you try now? Nah...
Top notch! Great service! Came with a group of 11ppl.

I like their HK style clay rice pots! They offer a large variety of clay pots. My favorite is frog rice clay pot. It takes a long time to make (30 mins), better to call order ahead! You can also order on line.

My Clay Pot Rice eating adventure has brought me back to Utopia!!! And its been a while that... I  have eaten here until yesterday which was on a Sunday night and several times I haven eaten lunch here in the past!!! But this is my very first time ever that... I have eaten dinner at Utopia!!! And this time I tried three different kinds of Clay Pot Rice and no I did not eat up all three Clay Pot Rice all by myself... Its because I shared it with my family!!! If you plan on going to Utopia for some Clay Pot Rice you gotta try the Clay Pot Rice at Utopia and just by the smell of the Clay Pot Rice would make you wanna drool over it!!! And just one more more thing that I have to say about Utopia is that the restaurant staff are friendly to us and of course the Clay Pot Rice is really good when it comes to being really hungry!!! I also forgot to mention one last thing besides the Clay Pot Rice if like soup go for the West lake Minced Beef Soup its really good when it comes nice and hot right out of the Kitchen!!!

Woman handing out fliers for this place told us if we spend $20 we'd get a plate of wings for $1. Another woman with her said yeah and she'll get commission for bringing you. So we thought why not. Good deal and we're helping this woman out. We ordered sesame chicken and calamari which were actually pretty decent. We get the check which came to $21 and figured great we'll get our $1 win gs now. The owner or manager laughed when we asked for our wings and said oh that girl tells people that all the time. You need to spend $30 and walked away. Food was decent but plz don't pull a fast one on people.

the salted fish and minced pork made it to this year's 7x7 big eats list so i had to come try it. not sure if i came on an off day but you can barely taste the salted fish! it was just a pork patty with two tiny pieces of salted fish on top. i know the clay pots come with the soy sauce you can pour over but i dont like to drench my food with it.
Was looking to satisfy my wonton noodle soup craving and failed. The noodles hadn't been cooked through and were still clumped together and the wontons were teeny tiny. I won't be returning.
For the price it is good enough, it's cheap compared to the higher end Chinese restaurants which is a perk but last time I went the food was sub par.
yeah, this place is probably not that clean.  oh well.

My friends and I were in Chinatown during the new year festival on Saturday.  We were looking for a place to eat and we stumbled upon this restaurant.  We were tired of thinking of where to eat so we decided to give this place a try.

Came here yesterday for a late lunch early dinner before the parade.  I love the clean no frills atmosphere and friendly service.  It is a small place with a small number of employees, so expect to wait for service at times.  The pot stickers were a bit doughty, not crispy golden like I am use to; the filling was good but spectacular.  The egg rolls were crispy with a perfect vegetable filling and well balanced sweet & sour sauce.  The salt & pepper chicken wings are crispy with a light sprinkling of five spices.  The beef Hong Kong noodles are good with tender beef, bean sprouts, and chow fun in a light sauce.  All & all okay, I have experienced better.

So the salted fish and minced pork rice in clay pot ($7.95) showed up on 7x7 Big Eat 2014 and here I am. So though I didn't try anything else I feel confident in recommending the clay pots here as their specialty.
Had a walk around Chinatown during Chinese New Year and a woman off the street offered us a flyer to come into the cafe along with a menu. Said that we're walking around but will check the cafe out.

I've been looking for a HK clay pot place in Chinatown and FINALLY found one. Their claypots are definitely comparable to the ones in HK. :) The chinese sausage and spareribs ones are definitely the best.

Tourist trap. So sad. They rip you off in price. My bill had extra charge for a very small bowl of plain white rice $1.65... Something that other Chinese restaurants give for free. Female with colored hair was rude and extremely impatient. They charge extra for as many things as possible. Never go back.

I will say the food was excellent. However the service was horrible. The waitress was super rude! Chow Fun on the menu is what drew me into this place. When we sat down to order, they said they were out of Chow Fun.

I go there for their clay pot rice, cooked traditional style.  Takes 30 minutes to make so order it when you sit down, or for large groups make reservation and order the food in advance.   The kitchen isn't that huge so sometimes things can be slow. The price is reasonable for what you are getting.
The worst service I have ever had. Waitress always argued. It's expensive and worthless. I would never go back to this restaurant. Never!!!!! Their food is the worst too.:((
Everything tastes like a petting zoo

This is literally the worst restaurant I've ever eaten at. Let's start with the food. This was BY FAR the worst restaurant food I have ever had. The quail appetizer was so dry that there was virtually no part of it that was edible. The chicken was lukewarm, extremely dry, and completely tasteless, not to mention it looked like dog food. My boyfriend's dish had almost no meat-- just tiny scraps of gooey looking beef thrown in with a bunch of onions and cold, greasy sauce.  Now on to the atrocious service. First off, there was no water brought to the table, and I ordered cranberry juice which the waiter brought out at room temperature in a tiny glass. There were only a couple occupied tables and the waiter was just standing around, yet he never once asked if I needed a drink refill or if I was enjoying the food. He also had a very rude and impatient attitude when I was ordering. At the end of the meal, the waiter brought out stale, unwrapped fortune cookies and the bill. My boyfriend paid with cash and expected the waiter to come back with his change, but he kept all the change as a tip without giving us an option.

Should be ZERO stars. Avoid this place unless you are starving, have no other food options, and are willing to pay for the worst Chinese food imaginable. The food and service were both awful. My friends and family left wondering if they were just served dead carrier pigeons from WWII and alley cats. Luckily I'm a vegetarian. This place is so bad it's almost comical. The owners and chefs should be ashamed of themselves.

Do noooooot eat here unless you love wasting money for below subpar food. Everything was tasteless and greasy and the whole restaurant smelled like it had water and carpet damage. I was nauseated just sitting in there from the smell. The service was awful and we literally had to go get our own water from the tables next to us. The waiter also laughed at us for what we were ordering and got our orders wrong.

Not too good experience.  3 of us went last week while visiting china town.  The food is so so.  The service is all right.  However the waiter put down 15% tip himself without asking us.  Never had such experience in the bay area restaurants before.

Went here because it was located off the main street in Chinatown... figured it was good  since it was one of the bigger and nicer lookong restaurants from the streets (corner location); however, do not let the location and decor fool you. The food was bland, everything needed salt, and no distinguishable flavors. The sweet and sour duck which I ordered was drowned in a sticky cool - aid like liquid. The chow mein was dry, colorless, and looked like it was put in a blender before served onto a plate making it almost impossible to grab the noodles. Panda Express taste better than this garbage.
Not that good.  Everything needed salt.  The service was sorta blah and the air heavy like it was a smoking restaurant back in the day, meaning maybe yesterday.
Walking around Chinatown I was looking for a nice place to eat.I look up and see this place on the second floor with windows all around called Cathay House. I thought that would have a nice view.

Like many reviewers, we stopped by this place because it was the first place we saw.  We had two adults, two seniors and two toddlers in our group.  And everyone just wanted to sit down after a morning of sightseeing.  The food actually wasn't too bad.  Not the greatest but it's not by all means poor.  One reason for the mediocre rating was the place is old and it felt it.  I'm sure the place is clean but it just didn't feel it.  And the waiter made a comment (joke?) that some may have taken offense to.  The toddlers and seniors in our group don't eat a lot so we ordered "only" three dishes.  I guess the waiter thought the three dishes weren't enough and asked if we wanted a lot of rice.  We laughed it off when he said it but gave each other that WTF look afterwards.  Needless to say, next time I hope to doing a better job of planning so we can avoid dining at this place.

our experience started with an expressionless host who demanded we wait and sit down. A Few minutes later, we sat and waited some more. Then a waiter hurriedly came by and took our order. The food came a while later and for a moment I thought my taste buds stopped functioning. I had chicken chow mein and fried rice--two dishes I was sure they couldn't mess that up. My partner had sweet and sour chicken. He found it mediocre but I really think he means tasteless.  What bothered me the most about this place is the poor poor service. I'm sure they can find more decent employees somewhere in China Town.

I should have checked the reviews first before going to this restaurant, but looking from the outside, the place was inviting. The first person who greeted us was nice but all of the other waiters weren't. We asked about what's in the menu and one waiter dismissed our inquiry. He was rude. We should have walked out right then but we were already seated and we had 2 kids with us so we stayed.

Horrible Terrible and do not come! If i can give a negative star, i would have given it. The waiter put his own tips there by the bill and sum up the amount. He charges like 20% tip lunch time? Panda express food taste better than it. Stay away people

Tasteless. Stopped here for a quick bite before heading back to the hotel. Tasted like I was eating plain rice. The sweet and sour pork stained my lips and tongue orange! Would have rather gone to the 7-11 down the street. Don't go here. There are so many other options in the area!

I took some friends of mine visiting the city here while on a day trip.  They enjoyed the food and the service but the portion size was awful.  I live in sf and I have had MUCH BIGGER serving sizes from family style restaurants.
Awful

We had come here before about a year ago and the food was good. We decided to come here again this week and we ordered cashew chicken and seschuan (however you spell it) and halfway through our meal I bit into the worst tasting piece of chicken !! It Had gone BAD, it was the worst taste I had ever experienced. The chicken was old or rotten or something! NOT fresh at all, the rice was really dry and we complained about the rotten-tasting chicken and he had the nerve to give us the FULL total on the bill !! He apologized but did not even discount it one bit. I complained and said I was not paying for the plate that had the rotten chicken in it and he finally discounted it. NEVER AGAIN.

Nice view, but the food tasted like it came from a bad buffet. Everything felt dusty.  Water was poured from an old plastic container and our waiter grabbed fortune cookies with his bare hands from a tub of unwrapped cookies. Don't risk it, keep walking.
came for a banquet.
This place really wasn't special. Something's were under cooked, covered with way to much sauce and the rice was kinda dry.

Id give it a zero, but it is not allowed here. First, I was served undercooked wonton soup with hair in it. Bad start. Then comes almond chicked that smells like spoiled milk. Wow. The pork and beef tasted.sour.and the meat was fatty and terrible. Finally, I asked for plain whit rice. You cant mess that up right? Wrong. They freaking messed up the rice. It tasted like moth balls. Worst experience ever. Good job making play dough look like chonese food.

I stumbled on this restaurant while I used to travel to SF for business.  And now that I moved to the Bay Area, I still enjoy coming back.  The staff is super friendly.  I've seen lots of people hanging out at the bar for happy hour.   Around summer time, they have lots of French tourists.  So they have fortune cookies in French!  It is always a special treat to get those because I used to be the President of the French Club in high school.  lol

As a Chinese native, that's the worst food I have ever had, why the lowest rate is one star?! I wanna give 0 for them. Also the services are really bad. What's more, they did add tips themselves , around 20%!!! That's shit! Guys, listen to me , never try here!!!!!!!!!!!
Service was not good. Although, the hostess smiled at us.  Food was cheap tasting. I guess if you are really really hungry and want Chinese food this place is OK.

I went here for dinner before checking out some of the Chinese New Year's festivities. It seemed like a decent restaurant from the outside, but this place is a perfect example of never judging a book by it's cover. The host and waiter were friendly but the food was embarrassing. We only wanted a light meal, so we ordered an appetizer sampler, vegetarian chow mein, and the vegetarians delight. The sampler came quickly enough, but everything tasted so bland. No big deal, I thought, but then the entrees came, and they made the appetizers taste delicious. I have never had chow mein that was so tasteless. It was also chopped up. None of the noodles were in long form, making it impossible to eat with chopsticks. Their texture also felt like they'd been boiled for too long or something strange like that, just way to soft and almost soggy. The vegetarian delight was equally bland. That's really the only way to describe the food there. Maybe their chicken, duck, pork, or beef dishes would have been a better choice, but there are dozens of restaurants in that area that I would rather try for the first time than come back to this place again.
Inflated rating? Yes, but hear me out.
The worst peking duck I have ever tried- expensive and taste horrible!!! The plates looks very old and dirty.. Disgusting tea as well.. So disappointed..Dont bother come here and waste your money!!

STAY AWAY!!! This place is the worst place i have ever ate at. We ordered the sesame chicken (ZERO flavor), mongolian beef (salty, had no onion, no scallion, and no dry pepper) its was just beef on a plate. The service was horrible, the glass of water that they brought out was really dirty. This place should just closed forever.

Really should be ZERO stars.   What a disappointment ... Great location over looking Grant St.  Right in the middle of Chinatown....but.  It ends there....waiter was rude and unhelpful, seemed annoyed with our presence, brought us filthy glassware that we couldn't drink from- food was beyond lousy... Filthy inside, terrible food- skip this joint!!!!!

I didn't have a chance to look at the reviews before choosing this place. We were starving and this was the first place we saw.  I'm glad because I would not have gone to this restaurant had I read the reviews.  And my meal was quite enjoyable.

The view at this place is incredible.  My friends and I go every year after the Chinese New Years parade.  We get a window seat and close the place down with lots of food and drinks.  We've had the same waiter every year and he is very warm and friendly when we start talking with him.  We enjoy the food, and find that with the portion size at that price point is a pretty good value.
Oh my where do I start?!?

Another 4 suckers went here before checking reviews!  Don't be like us, be warned!!!!!!!!!!  Eat here if you enjoy cheap leftover microwaved buffet food and mediocre service.  They don't even ask you if all is ok, because they know the answer!  Can't give it a zero, which is what it deserves.

This is the first Chinese food restaurant you see on your walk up Grant after the "Gateway to Chinatown". So naturally this is the first place tourists stop to eat. BIG MISTAKE! People of the world unite! Keep walking just a couple more blocks for real awesome Chinese food.

This is a great place to go for Happy Hour especially if Chuck is working. Nice for a drink and some greasy chinese food while sitting at the bar. I've never eaten at this place in the restaurant area at all.

This place is ok. We ate there because it was there, after mass and we had to get to the airport. I wouldn't go again but not because it was terrible as much as because there are so much better places to go in the neighborhood.
WORST PLACE EVER! SUCH A TRAP FOR TOURISTS!
I would give this zero stars but it won't let me so ill go with one.  This place was HORRIBLE!

How can dim sum taste THIS bad??? We messed up real good, picking this place. So spoiled, coming from Vancouver...I don't think you could even accidentally BUMP into a place this bad in our city. It's most unforgivable when it's run by Chinese people. How could you conscientiously serve food this horrible? I have never encountered dim sum that tasted like this. Never. Do NOT come here.

The definition of TERRIBLE. Soup tasted like chalk, Sesame Chicken was soggy and perhaps old, and the service was even worse.  Waiter slammed plates down, spilled water, soup etc.  When the waiter brought the check it was $50 for three people and we all felt ill after.  SPARE YOURSELVES from this TOURIST TRAP!

You know there's a problem when you walk in and the place smells like cat piss... We were starving and had to eat...but should've walked 2-3 more blocks to another Chinatown restaurant.  The food was like leftovers.  Not fresh at all.  What do they do, prepare it all the day before and then microwave it?  That's what it tasted like. 20 bucks, plus $2 gratuity, for a big plate of leftovers.  I wasn't even full when we left.
Literally the WORST chinese food I've ever had...and I've had a lot of chinese food.

Restaurant was at 75% capacity on a Saturday evening when there wasn't a big event such as wedding. For dinner, the four of us shared lobster with ginger scallions, half peking duck, walnut prawns and gai lan, and we were quite full.  Service was very attentive.  For the restrooms I had set my expectations fairly low, so I thought it was fairly manageable.

Was in Chinatown on an errand, stopped in here for some dim sum. Wow, I had no idea how bad food could be prepared and served. Flavorless, greasy, completely lackluster food, served by bored, completely uncommunicative waiters. Left 5% tip, because I know how difficult making a living in this city can be. Will not EVER return. Please if you value your tastebuds, don't even send your worst enemy's dog to this restaurant!
Great dim sum for a good price.  A lot of old timers come here. This is one of the few dim sum places in the Bay Area that is open early.  They open at 8am on Sundays.

The food was delicious but the service was less than average. It took FOREVER for our dim sum order to arrive and I had to ask the waiter three times for water. Having said that, the dumplings were really delicious - the tofu roll, BBQ pork bun and har gow were the best! Just a shame the service doesn't match the food.

Overall, I'd give this place a solid 3 stars. Their food is probably a little better than that, but their service brings back even to 3 stars. I will say that when we came at around 12pm on a Sunday, there was a huge crowd waiting. The line definitely moves, but be ready for a wait. All in all, nothing fancy, nothing terrible. Just a run of the mill 3 star dim sum place in the Bay Area.

You know you're in the right place when you walk into a Chinese restaurant that is packed with local Chinese people.  I grew up in Chinatown so I'm pretty choosy when it comes to picking a Chinese restaurant.  I avoid those that are tailored to tourists since they are generally much more expensive and quality is often mediocre at best.  I also avoid those that are visited by big-name politicians since those are often the biggest rip off.

My brother and I went on a trip to San Francisco a few weeks back when I was in town and we decided to drive into the city to get some duck. Its been many years since I've eaten in Chinatown so I wasn't very familiar with the restaurants. We decided to try Peninsula since there wasn't a line and we were hungry. The interior is what you would expect with many Chinese restaurants. The wait staff was very attentive and gave excellent suggestions for our meal.

If a negative ranking is available that is what I want to give to this place.  Worst service.  My family of four signed in at 11:10am on a Saturday morning, noting there were 3~4 groups ahead of us on the sign-in sheet.  We waited for 30 minutes still didn't get a table!  While we waited at the entrance, many groups were seated, but not us!  People came in later than us were giving smaller numbers and were seated in front of our face!  Those people spoke Cantonese.  If you don't speak Cantonese, don't go there.  You will be treated awfully.  Bring your business to many other fine restaurants in Chinatown.  We left after realizing what went on.
Omg, best place in Chinatown and very inexpensive.  Adventurous food, great service, and authentic dim sum.  Loved it!

Came here on a Sunday at around 1:30pm. My family of four decided to try this place since there was a small line wait of about 15 min compared to the 30-45 min line at the Greater Eastern Restaurant two doors down.
Worst service ever.

Worst place ever! This is a cheating and illegal operation. The food is aweful and we asked for the receipt but they refused. They also tip themselves 20% when charge my credit card. This place doesnt pay tax to our government and should be shut down. Totally illegal!!!! Plus the service is aweful. Sucks!
Service SUCKS here, no one seems to be paying attention and listening, had to ask the same question repeatedly!!! The taste for the food is just ok but certain food are cold, can you imagine

Stopped in since we were seeing a show across the street and were pressed for time.  I was a little nervous walking in since inhabe my Chinatown go-to' sans this wasn't one of them and resembles a strip mall Chinese takeout on the inside.  I was surprised to enjoy most of the food that we ordered though.  The spicy eggplant in clay pot was great, as was the taro with chicken and pea sprout with fresh garlic.  The chicken and sweet corn soup was good but a little too sweet for me.  I'm not sure if I'd come back since there are other restaurants in the area that have menus that I enjoy more but the food was good and the service was friendly, fast, and accommodating.
The food is " SUCK " And the services is ok. I went there Sunday, 11/25/12.
Sunday @ 2PM, Dim Sum w/ the extended family. No line. Busy but got seated right away with the roaming Dim Sum pushing ladies appearing seconds after we filled the seats.

Decent dim sum at pretty reasonable prices, though nothing stood out.  I'd say the shrimp-based dishes are the best here and tasted freshest. It was also on the oily side, even for dim sum, though I ate everything I ordered, oil and all.

Best Chinese food I've had so far in Frisco! My parents where visiting me for the weekend and they wanted to eat Chinese food seeing as they heard it was the best out there. Anyway the food was amazing hence the four stars. Service could have been better so I took a star for that but I would def come eat here again! Maybe takeout next time though...

Won't be coming back. No service, waiter shouting over your head and worst of all passing dishes over your head too. Noisy and tables are placed too close together. Getting the attention of a waiter is like catching a fly, it sees you taunt you and fly away. Just horrible experience.

Their dim sum is amazing! It doesn't get pushed around on a cart until it gets soggy and cold like most places. They bring it fresh from the kitchen once you order it. You can also get your parking validated which is great because parking in Chinatown is a pain.
I like the fact that this restaurant opens at 8 am, which means no crowds to deal with.  The restaurant was filled with older Chinese locals, so you know the food must be good.

been to this place for many many years, it was remodeled I think couple years ago which makes the dining experience much better(before remodeling it was pretty run down), it is my go to place in Chinatown for dimsum, I would not go to any other ones. All their food is authentic Hong Kong/Guangdong style. The owner always talk to us and the other regulars whenever he has time to, very rare quality in this business these days.
Not a place I will be returning to
Food was ok and not worth the hassle of going into Chinatown for.  EXTREMELY SLOW service.  It took us over 35 minutes to get any food.

This place is very interesting. Ordered duck app which only had spine and neck pieces. We ordered the shrimp and walnuts in a honey glaze, it was covered in MAYO, which was hot...so confused. I ordered the shrimp egg foo young which was alright. Hard to mess that up. After waiting for our good for an hour we realized we should have just waited in line at a better place than just choose a restaurant because we were hungry.
I feel regret not to wait to the line for other restaurant. It has weird food and only give us necks and spine for the duck.

Seriously the worst chinese food i have ever had. And some awful service to match. They took forever to bring out everything. Egg rolls were frozen in the middle. Crab was deep fried like a damn corn dog. We ordered a 1/4 duck and they literally gave us all spine and scrappy tid bits. The honey and walnut shrimp was slathered in mayo. MAYO?!? Whyy? Im so confused. I literally feel i'm either on drugs or on a reality tv show. This place is terrible. Run.

So we were in Chinatown looking for dim sum, but we failed to consider that all the good, cheap, dim sum places were bakeries and would be closing by dinnertime. By the time we arrived at the place we intended to get food from (which was closed), we were hungry and tired, so decided to just eat at the first half-decent-looking place we saw that had dim sum, which turned out to be here.

Giving a one star is already too much to me... My English is not that good but hope u guys can understand what m I trying to say. The food was ok but this is the baddest service ever! Probably I'm Chinese too so that's why ppl are not Chinese thinks is pretty good.
Well our relationship started out rough, but ended well.

We were really happy to find this place last weekend, we remember going a few years ago but forgot the name.  Almost everything we got was great.  Spring rolls, roast duck, pork buns, su mai, chinese broccoli, pot stickers, sesame puffs.  The only thing that was so so was the soy sauce lo mein, it was kind of blah and if not for the spicy chili sauce on the table wouldn't have been much of anything.  It was nice having a pot of tea on the table too.  Lots of places don't provide tea anymore.

Stopped by here for a late dinner last night after visiting the Org nearby. Though there are a billion restaurants in Chinatown, this was one of the only ones we found open at 9:20PM- they actually close at 9:30 but didn't mind us coming in and were helpful throughout our visit, even though we didn't leave until just after 10. They were moving furniture around and cleaning up for the last few minutes of our visit, which we did not mind.
Pricing: Good. Not too sure since my father and uncle "fought for the bill."

After coming here I can see why it averaged 3 stars.  The food here is really good and tasty; you only saw Chinese people here, which is a really good sign.  However, the service here is ridiculously slow.  Like snail's pace slow.  I could ave sent mail Priority Mail faster than this.  WE came here for dim sum, and unlike other dim sum places where they push the carts around, the servers here actually come around with the dishes on trays.  not very efficient.  And to add to that, they put us in the way back corner, so we hardly saw anyone pass by.

Was visiting SanFran, and decided I needed to get some Dim Sum for dinner.  Originally, I was gonna go to Delicious Dim Sum with someone staying at the hostel I was in, but for some reason it was closed.  At 7 pm.  Weird

I would not even give this place a one because it was a terrible experience. Mongolian beef spicy..... My dry green beans dish was spicier then that.  Food is mediocre at best slightly below Panda Express at least there the food is serve hot. She adds her own tip to every order what she thinks she deserves... Go figure that. I thought tips were based on your service to the guests. In this case she should have paid my family to eat here. If you complain about the time it takes to get your order right the same response " Sit down and it is cooking" hmmm never been told that before, if it is cooking then why does my order show up and Luke warm at best. Her daughter is sitting at another table with friends and everything is delivered to her sizzling and having steam coming from it. Terrible experience do not go here try cooking t home because at least you know it will be hot and flavorful.

My mom and I came here for dim sum and had a pleasant experience. My boyfriend told me that if you want to eat at a good restaurant, look inside, because you know it's good if you see people eating in the restaurant, which is exactly what we did today. We were seated immediately and they had servers at every table serving dim sum. All of them spoke Cantonese, but once they saw our forks, they explained what everything was in English lol. The service was prompt, and one of the waitresses saw that my mom barely ate the chicken feet, so she brought my mom the warm chicken feet instead. Great service! Our total was less than $20 for dim sum, which is how it should be!

Looking for a great taste of authentic Cantonese cuisine after a tiring stroll in Chinatown? A clean restaurant with tidy and prompt service? Look no further. I've been here a number of times and I can easily say that I am a big fan.
If they had Zero stars, this is it!
Food----- one star
I ordered takeout on a Sunday night at 5:45 because I felt lazy. My order promptly arrived at my doorstep in only 25 minutes! Wowza, I'm loving the Eat24 app. Note: order minimum is $15

Ordered Chicken Salad and Vegetable rolls with strict instructions not to ring the doorbell. They took well over an hour to deliver the food. Chicken was covered in fat, vegetable rolls were cold and yep you guessed it they rang the doorbell multiple times. I won't be going back.
People were nice and the delivery was quick.

Extremely fast delivery, within 25 minutes.  (I think ours came in 15-20).  It did arrive lukewarm (Chinese restaurants throw extra oil on the food to keep it hotter).  I've never known any Vietnamese place to deliver so this was just awesome in my book.  Notice the name is A Taste of Vietnam--which infers it's a fusion restaurant.  It's an East meets West kind of menu; so keep that in mind when you order and it'll taste just fine.  The garlic noodles is actually pasta with garlic butter; kind of interesting with the honey pork.
Worst vietnamese food I've ever had.

I ordered Saigon Noodle with Honey Pork and Vegetarian Rolls and curry puff.  The noodle was a little too soft but the rest was pretty good and the portion was more than enough.  I couldnt finish it.  Delivery was quick too so overall I recommend this place.
I've ordered delivery from them twice.  It's been alright, not my favorite viet food ever, but good.  Prices are ok.  10% cashback from eat 24 is definitely a plus.

Just got my first delivery from here.  Ordered shrimp imperial rolls and chicken noodle soup.  Wish I had yelped it first, because I spent $20 and it was probably the worst meal I've ever had for $20.  The soup was awful.  The eggrolls were alright, but nothing special.  I'm still hungry and I am out $20. :(  This was literally the worst food I've ever had in San Francisco.

I'm really wavering here between 2 and 2.5 stars.  Tried time for the first time for delivery a week ago.  Not a true Vietnamese place, but a fusion of neighboring countries.   Got the veggie imperial rolls, garlic noodles, and the lava beef.  Honestly, this should have been enough for two people.  I don't think we are porkers, and our appetite is healthy, but splitting appetizers, a side, and a main should have been enough to fill our bellies.

Boo. Boo to A Taste of Vietnam. 2 stars for having very fast delivery and for being edible, but that's about it. Total rip-off in comparison to other Vietnamese restaurants/any other restaurant.  I could tell right away when the delivery guy handed over the bag of food that I was being gyped. It didn't have any heft to it at all.  You know why?  Because half of the take-out box was filled with a pretty (useless) [and fake] green "salad." I wanted garlic noodles and honey pork, not salad!

They came within 25 minutes.  That is FAST in my world of delivery orders.  It may be because they're not that busy yet, but that was certainly promising.  I had the garlic noodles, lava lamb, firecracker chicken, and duck imperial rolls.  Can't speak to its authenticity, but all of it sho is tasty.  And I wasn't even hungry.
This is a review of delivery from "A Taste of Vietnam".
I meant to post my review regarding the Hing Lung restaurant that was located on Broadway St. My apologies to the owners of Hing Lung company on Stockton St.
I remembered Hing Lung being a dirtier place such that I've never patronized them before but I think they've cleaned up their act some so much so that I decided to give this Chinese deli a shot.

I saw the duck hanging in the window and decided to give it a try.  I bought half a duck and 2 chicken wings for $8.  The duck was fresh tasting and had pretty good flavor.  It was too fatty for my taste though.  The chicken wing had been sitting out for awhile and was ok.  This was a cheap pretty good meal.
Been back to buy their ready cooked items.
(See pic)

At this point, I have bought roast pork from all the take out places up and down Stockton St. and I have to say that Hing Lung is the best of the bunch.  The pork has just the right amount of flavor without being too salty.  The skin is crispy and not dripping with grease.  The meat has just the right balance of lean and fat.  They are also very accommodating where others were less so, agreeing to sell me a small portion when I told them I only wanted $2.00 worth of meat the last time.  Today I ventured out of my ordering rut and bought their barbequed pork cheek (face side :-)) and their cracklings.  Both are sensational!  I just have to unclog my arteries for the next few days by eating better and by diligently taking my red yeast rice pills so I can have all that porky goodness from them again soon!
So I really wanted to get good duck... So I walked up and down on Stockton st in the china town.

sanitary?....very questionable......judgin' from the volume of rotation and crowds....assumed food to be equally pump'd out.....only non-chinese (non-asians) even near hing lung appears to be tourists takin' snap shots of the array of trays fill'd with various dishes in the front window display....and ducks and ribs hangin' over the trays.....drippings droppin' below to the trays....

Do not go here!!! The waitress showed us a small menu card indicating several dishes included for $9.95 per person. The dishes were poorly prepared and the beef was very stringy. Then the bill came with charges of $19.95 each, plus $6 for tea. The waitress avoided me when I protested to the waiter. Of course, he brought out a menu card that said $19.95 per person. Scammers knowing tourists will never return. We are locals and will spread the news of these crooks and bad chefs. Would give negative star rating if able.

The food is good and made fresh. the only negative thing I would say about this place is, the restaurant is upstairs and the restrooms are downstairs. Also, they add their own tip no matter how many is in your party and when you charge it to your visa, it ask for more tip. so be aware that tip is already added so you don't double tip.
Not good at all.  Food is oily, not fresh.  Decor and carpet are old.  Felt gloomy sitting inside.  Service is ok though.

We were just walking around town checking out the hype of Chinatown. When we got there it was a busy street filled with people, music, and lights! People were handing out fliers from random restaurants this was when we got suckered in to a coupon..  Free potstickers and ice cream with an entree purchase.

Looks like I should have read these reviews before coming here, but the truth is, it was my first time in China Town and I was so hungry, I didn't have a chance to yelp nor did I know my way around the city, I was too busy looking for parking. I parked my car down a block inside a garage and after taking my walk around in search of a good little restaurant, I was approached by a few kind Chinese women on a corner from different restaurants, all selling me their menus and all trying to get me come to their spots. Well, I was overwhelmed with the choices but then some one from China Town restaurant said "you come eat here" and I took a look up and seen the balcony seating and thought to myself "oh my goodness, I want to eat here" done deal. As we stepped inside I thought it was rather different that you take the stairs up leading you into the dining room, cool and it was nice a bit fancy but I seen Asians not tourist so I thought nothing of it, then the server took me to the balcony and I absolutely loved it, across me I could see the shops another restaurant with hanging chickens and on the side of me the alley where Chinese kids were playing. I tell you the experience was epic. But, when I looked at the menu, I noticed they were not too many choices and nothing was really different or new to me. Oh well, I was in a good mood, we made our decision as is and I still ordered meals, now I'm not going to come here and tell you that the food was terrible because it wasn't. It had nice presentation, colorful and flavorful, but it took them a while to bring my order, it wasn't all at the same time which I hate and seems like as soon as they brought me the food they had forgotten all about me and never once came to offer a refill on my drink or check on things. They forgot my kids apple juice, no condiments and when the check came they did add a gratuity on-top of it being super expensive for typical Chinese food I could of had elsewhere, don't let the looks of this place fool you into thinking your in Shanghai lol we definitely could have something with more heart at a mamas and papas place with much much better service.

**Warning** this place has to be shut down ASAP. I would give no stars but that's not a choice. We got pulled in by one of the flyer ladies outside so decided to try it out. Servers wore rude we ordered long story short there were FRUIT FLIES in our food! We told the waitress and rudely accused US  for putting them in there for a "free meal" I never been through this in my life!  She told us we had to pay for the whole meal We didn't even eat any of it! She also said she was going to call the police I said call them but then she threw us out when We started getting loud. We walked out disgusted and grossed out! if you look at more reviews there are tons of them having the same issue with the fruit flies. No one eat here!

We made the mistake of eating here last night.  The food was not good. Some of it was too salty to eat. They give you a coupon for free dumplings and green tree ice cream on the street. It was pricey and not authentic at all. Don't waste your time. I wish we would have read the reviews before falling for this tourist trap. The best thing about this place was the ice cream.

I laugh my ass off every time I walk by this place and see the dumb arse tourists sitting on the balcony eating this crap because some illegal handed them a coupon for 4 free dumplings.  Go ahead, try this place.  I dare you!!

horrible!!!!!!!! do NOT go here. the food is extremely overpriced and not good in any way. Seriously people. also they are very rushed and won't let you see the check.. this is because they add a tip and don't want you to know. If the food was decent this wouldn't be a problem but it was literally horrible.

HORRIBLE!!! Total scam of a place .. They convince you to come in off the street with a coupon for a free appetizer. The coupon is not honored because of some fine print which makes no sense.. Food is terrible and dry and tasteless .. Servers are rude .. Plus they add a tip!! What?!! I left spending  way too much $$ and feeling very angry .Avoid this place at all costs ..

This place was absolutely terrible. I was visiting from out of town (before I moved here) with a friend for work and we were lured by the balcony seating. Our biggest mistake was not checking yelp first.

Awful restaurant. Went in because it is close to the Hilton nearby where we stayed but it turned out to be one of the worst restaurants I've been to in my life. The chicken still had large pieces of fat. The staff was horribly rude. A star is generous.

This is the best place in Chinatown to bring groups!  The $13.95 per person special was amazing.  They brought course after course of freshly cooked plates to our group.  We were all full and they brought out even more.  The staff is super friendly.  I have been to other places in Chinatown.  This is the BEST for groups.  For couples, ask about the seating out on the upstairs deck with fun views of people in Chinatown.
Worst food ever.
The restaurant was very busy but service was good. Food was properly cooked. Service and food were fine. Nothing fancy but not as horrible as the reviews I read.

STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE. We were lured here and the food was not very good and they price gouge you on everything. My niece had a bag of t-shirts that she had bought and forgot to bring them with her when we left the table, by the time she got down the stairs and went back up to get them not only had they taken them they had put them in a backroom to keep them. A DECENT PERSON WOULD HAVE RUN AFTER US TO RETURN THEM. The staff is very pushing and rude. I cannot emphasize enough to stay away.
This is the Worst restaurant I have ever been for years!!! Food is terrible, portion is tiny, service is rude... Rice is uncooked and u have to pay for it???? Wtf

It was fine, but nothing special. I can get better Chinese food in my home town. There are far better places in China Town.  They should put more effort into food and service and less into the corner people trying to heard you into this place.

DO NOT ENTER IT!!! I'm serious! Eat here is like paying a high price for Panda Express. Very bad and low quality food. Price is unclear and additional tip is high. At lease Panda Express's price is reasonable. It's really not a wise choice to eat here.
So, this restaurant was suggested to my family by another business in CT.

We were coaxed in to this restaurant by the free pot sticker coupon from a lady on the street . The food was OK but I expected better especially being in Chinatown. We had the salt and pepper calamari, pork bun, snow pea leaves, shrimp balls, sweet and sour chicken. The prices were a bit high for the dishes and they also added the tip automatically. I don't think we will be back here the next time we are in SF.

I was in San Francisco's Chinatown, taking pictures until I got hungry, instinctively I start looking for places to eat. I didn't do much work actually because at one of the corners of an intersection, a Chinese lady grabbed my arm and gave me a handout that said "free pot sticker and ice cream." She also said it was the best restaurant in Chinatown. It was called Chinatown Restaurant afterall. So we went inside and there was quite a few people. We took a seat - my party of 3 including me- and took a look at the menu. The waitress comes and asks us if we'd like something to drink, so we say water and notice small tea cups on our table so we ask fot some tea also. This is where it got annoying... The waitress aggressively started asking if we'd like anything else to drink, like sparkling water, bottle of wine? Beer?! She does the same thing for the food. We got fried rice, orange chicken, and black pepper beef. She keeps asking us if we want more! As if what we ordered wasn't enough! Then the free pot stickers came and oh my Lord. It was the worst tasting dumplings. It had the texture of a smore with  gross inside, horrible! We then realized why there were so many people inside, all of them were walking in with the little free flyers! I wanted to tell them to turn back but our food came and we tried it. It was TOO DAMN SALTY! Honestly, Panda Express is better. So I just asked for the check, multiple times... We ordered 3 plates and our bill came out to $62.45!!! I asked them what happened so they said they included the pot sticker since it was after their promotional hours?! They charged $3 for the tea! And so I asked them what that little $8.10 subliminally written on the bottom was, and she said tip. No way mother father! We have a party of 3! Tip shouldn't be included, so I complained and asked the tip to be removed. They did and when they brought. Back my change, it was all in pennies. This topped the cake. So I handed them the pennies and said "here's your tip." We walked out and the laty came after us with the pennies and grabbed my hand and placed it in my hands. So I threw it on the ground of the front door. Walked out. And saw a couple getting dragged in and I quickly told them to turn back, and they did. Worst dining experience of my life!

Worst service and unethical practices. What a rip off! We were expecting spend around 20 bucks like in any other place in chinatown, but we ended up there because we got some flyers on the street. First the waitress throw the straws at me in a rude way. Later, we wanted just an appetizer and a entree and the waitress asked what type of rice I wanted with that and she said, fried or white? I said fried, the she asked if we wanted wanton soup and I asked how big it was and she said not too big, one cup for each. She made it seem like these items were side orders, like normally are in any other place but when we got the bill, we got charge $50.00!!!! are you kidding me? 9 bucks for soup and another 10 for fried rice? Ridiculous. I don't tend to complaint but this place does not deserve customers. Don't make the same mistake!

DO NOT EAT HERE; here's the deal. I will rarely say this about any restaurant I go to, but I hate this place with a passion. Here are my reasons: the wait is insanely long, the prices are absurd, and the food was OK. My family and I had been walking all day and were starving, so having to wait 10 minutes for someone to at least order our drinks and another 40 minutes for them to bring our food did not settle well with my family. After they finally brought the food we realized how small all the portions were, and we ordered family size! The food wasn't even hot, it was warm as if it had sitting for sometime. When we were finally done the check came out to $81.55!! I was insanely pissed at my entire experience here and will never be back.
I wish I could give this 0 stars.
Awful place !

I have never made a post on a restaurant, but I felt compelled to let everyone know that this is the biggest scam/rip off in all of San Fran. The food was garbage the service was rude then the check came and looked like I gave a pen to 5 year old and told them to write it out. Questioned the check and she made it out to be that I was stupid. Home of the 5 dollar bowl of white rice, seriously??? It's a trap!!! I would not go back if someone else was paying! TRAP! Been to better 5 dollar buffets!!!
OK so many people here say this place is horrible. I assure you it isn't! The food was decent, the prices were ok also.
I had the misfortune of going here, without checking on yelp. We were seated by the balcony with an open door. It was very breezy and cold.
We ordered the smoked tea duck and black bean spare ribs.  Very bad.

I came here after wanting to go to House of Nanking and not wanting to wait an hour to sit down.  I got lured into "China Town Restaurant" by a free potsticker appetizer and green tea ice cream.  When I was finally seated, it took 15 minutes for the waitress to come to my table (it was a party of one) and take my order.  Except when I tried to order what I wanted to eat I got a "no food, drink only" yell from her.  Thinking someone else would take my food order I thought that was somewhat reasonable at the time.  When she came back 5 minutes later with my tea, she took my food order.
One of the worst meals of my life. Horrible food, exceptionally bad service and the staff was amazingly rude. Never ever go there!

Worst restaurant ever!! The waitress are fu3king rude! They add unreasonable charges into our bill. Their food are bad, but are more expensive than other place. We have 5 people and they charge for $26 for tip, that's really unreasonable!
