This is definitely not what I would expect from a chain restaurant but it does exist.
Best subway in sf. Staff is always friendly no matter the time of day.  Food is tasty abs a great value.

Very okay. Been here twice. I'm not adverse to it or drawn to it. The last time the bread was a bit dry and the buffalo chicken lacking in sauce flavor. Yet, I expect the buffalo sauce to be quite tame somewhere like this, so that didn't surprise or bother me much. The tea ran out with half a glass--that was disappointing, but the glass was still half full. But it was clean with 100% rating on the inspection card. Subways seem to have been going down on cleanliness in general in my experience, which is a major reason I try to avoid them. So this was a bit redeeming of Subway and kept my rating at three stars.
Subway, here in a pinch when you need cheap eats, in an area where reliable cheap eats are really not that plentiful. Also open on weekends when a lot of stuff nearby isn't.

Best. Subway. Ever.  I have certainly never reviewed a Subway before, but I felt the need to go out of my to review this one.  I went here a few times while I was working in SF over a 2 week period.  Every time I went in, the workers were extremely friendly and engaging.  Keep it up guys!

You know the staff here were really nice and funny. My sandwich tasted great and everything was too my liking. The only reason why I am giving this place three stars is just the set-up of the store it self. It is really small and the windows were open having the shady people on the corner just stare at you. But hey, maybe I am just nit-picking. I love subway.
Subway Sandwich location here is decent. Although my sandwich was a bit soggy, it was only the mustard that made it soggy. Service was okay and the dude behind the counter wore gloves.

I work a block away and this place is a good lunch option for me.  I'm underemployed and "cheap" is the rule.  All the same, I went to this place twice a week even back when I was working full-time just because its a reliable outfit.
Terrible service!

I know that all Subways are pretty much the same, but I am writing this review to compliment the outstanding staff.  I have worked in the Financial District for almost two years, and frequent this Subway periodically and/or sporadically frequently.  It has always been the three gentleman who work during the lunch shift.  They are fantastic.  They have a great sense of humor.  They remember your regular order.  They are guys you'd want to have a beer with.

I had never thought I will have to get on 'Yelp' to review a 'Subway' restaurant but this one literally forced me to do the same! Before I even proceed I must clarify that I love 'Subway' and have dined at their numerous restaurants globally.
This review is strictly for Subway and on Kearny St. in SF and their breakfast. Because otherwise, I like Subway.
Do not EVER get the pastrami here. :(
This is the best Subway in the FiDi, the staff is really nice understands my order and the bread is always fresh.

Fast, friendly, tasty, cheap and clean - just like a Subway should be.  Plus the guys there will talk your ear off about soccer if you give any kind of acknowledgment that you've vaguely heard of the sport before.
I started ordering just the 5 dollar footlong meatball marinara. Delicious and cheap!
This subway gave me stale bread which killed the whole sandwich.
Subway in general is an alright lunch option if you want something quick and healthy, not to mention cheap.  Well, today I definitely paid the price and much more than I bargained for.
Cheap - which I like

The employees here are a bunch of horny pervs so if you want extra spinach on your sandwich, show off a bit of boobage or leg and you will get it at no extra charge! Come here if you like to be gawked at and feel free to order a $5 foot long, they might even offer you another kind of foot long! LoL
Been here once. The worker who took my order didn't like to talk to I had to guess everything he was saying. On the plus side, good sandwich and one if the subways with no tax!

The girls I have lunch with most of the time and me come here when we are getting low in the wallet, usually right before payday.  I always get the food long turkey sandwich and it's enough for two meals.  The cookies are kind of gross and the bags of chips are small, but the meal deal is a pretty good amount of food for the price.

I've grown to become a big fan of Subway, but not every Subway is made equal. One of my friends made note of the enormous amount of men that come in and out of this Subway. Apparently, it's the "unofficial" place to meet successful, ambitious, financial district men. Not that you should come here for this sole reason (as their subs are quite good), but I suppose for those that are looking it's extras on top of the tasty sandwiches.

This is the best Subway in the Financial District!  Unlike the others (ahem..the one on Montgomery St.), they're very generous when making your sandwich.  The guys are always quick and the manager (I'm assuming that's who he is at the register) is always friendly.  Make sure you ask for the Subway club card.  You can get a free sandwich after buying 5 (or 6 I forget).

After walking all around SF yesterday we got hungry again after having gross chinese food earlier for lunch.I saw a subway across the street and said we should go there and split a $5 footlong if it wasnt busy.

So today, I felt like eating salad instead of a foot long sandwich! This place is never busy even during lunch time. This place has never been a friendly subway from the every beginning. Today, their customer service is even worse than before. So I ordered turkey salad and I saw my plate was only half-filled (I ordered this salad from other subways around many areas, and I KNOW how much is their serving) and the guy was about to close the lid of the plate. I asked him if he can give me a little bit more letuce. Then he picked (not grap) like 2-3 pieces of lettuce onto the plate. Man... if you guys ordered from subway before, you know how tiny those lettuce are.. and he just picked like 2-3 pieces. My eyes were wide opened and I am surprised! He closed the lid and threw the plate to the cashier. I asked the cashier about the serving, he answered "this is not all you can eat..." I told him other subway I've ordered from, they have given me a fuller serving than this. He handed me the plate from his hands and asked me "don't you think it is a lot?" with his eyes wide open. He was rude definately. He kept repeating that this is not all you can eat. Then I ended the conversation with him because he was non-stop about it, so I said I'm not trying to argue with him and paid and left.
One star for being non-chinese food in Chinatown, because some times I ain't feeling the dim-sum.
I am not reviewing this particular location, but Subway in general.

This location is friendly, clean, and efficient. I've never stood in line here for more than 5 minutes. The sandwiches are large and they will add more of just about everything if you ask. It's my favorite Subway around the FiDi--and I've tried just about all of them. I've encountered very stingy Subway's around town and this one stands out for being generous and yummy.
More space and friendlier staff than the branch on Montgomery St., great place to get takeout from if you don't want to fight the crowds in Chinatown.
mgr and sandwich makers are great people.  work hard and seem like they are happy making the footlongs.
Oooh!  My new favorite Subway shop!  I've had a falling out with my old favorite shop on Mont'y street, as it seems they believe three pieces of turkey on a 6" sub is adequate.  It is not.
I read somewhere that there are now more Subway restaurants in the US than there are McDonalds. Considering how there are still so many obese people, something is not right here.
Great food for a reasonable price, salt and pepper shrimp, hot and sour soup and peppered steak cube are great

This place is a great value for the food. I was able to get a meal for six bucks during lunch time. It came with rice, soup, and a meat dish. For me the meat dish was sweet and sour pork. The pork came out crunchy, so I know it was freshly made. The rice was just right, not too dry to too wet. My meal came with a soup, but I did not try it because today was a hot day. Overall a great place for the value.
I went and got food. Food was good.  All the negative reviews are for the majority competitors looking to bring great dish0nor to name. Anyways I smoked a fat blunt and ate my heart out.

I enjoyed my first-ever visit tonight! Had the Yang Chow fried rice and combination sizzle platter with squid, prawns, broccoli, scallops and beef and I enjoyed both entrees. Service  is good. Lovely, lively packed atmosphere on this Saturday night. I will return next time I visit San Francisco!

Well, it seems that a lot of the reviews are about the bad customer service, and I hate to add fuel to the fire, but the service we got was not bad at all--probably because we're Chinese-American. Taking this into consideration, I suppose my comments about the customer service can be disregarded if read by someone of another ethnicity.
Let me first say that I'm rating Chung King's service and not their food.

My family LOVES the food here. But the service here is ridiculous. I believe I have a high tolerance for bad service, especially in Chinese restaurants. So when I say the service is bad here, I mean it. You can thank the boss lady for the horrible service. She's not the nicest lady, so you can only imagine how motivated the people that work for her must be. Anyways, they have The Best Honey Walnut Shrimp that we have ever tasted. I also love their Ginger Scallion Crab. But seriously, the service is crazy. On a busy night many years ago, we sat at our table for half an hour, and tea wasn't even served to us. Half.An.Hour. Quite unfortunate because the food is unbelievably delicious!!

Stay away. Horrible experience. What a waste of money: service was plain rude. I never had such a horrible dining experience in my entire life. The food is "okay" at best. The owner and waiters ignored us, yelled at us and lied to us about the stuffed tofu being vegetarian - and when we asked very politely about the (shrimp) filling they just walked away. We asked twice and were ignored again. Don't go there. Unlike you like bad food and the abuse of greedy and rude owners. There are plenty of decent places in the neighborhood. Read some of the other low rated reviews if you don't trust my review.

I wish I could give ZERO stars. Let me say that the food is quite good but the service is the worse I have ever seen! I went there with 2 students of mine and at the door the person who greeted us did not look happy. For some reasons she didn't want us there and her face could not hide it. I found strange her face but we sat and ordered a fixed price menu for 3 people. She immediately replied saying: "you don't want that! That is for Chinese people." I insisted and she got angry and said "you want that? Okay!!" and left not liking that we insisted. The food as I said was good and include a fish, shrimp, pork, etc. all good tasting. I thought we were over but when paying our $64 check I asked her to split $24, $20 and $20. She said she would only take one card. No splitting! At that time I lost my patience and said she could not do that because her sign said $20 minimum on a credit card and all cards were above that limit. I then told her that if she does not allow splitting she should have a sign indicating it. I also said she has to be "nicer" to people and that if she doesn't want non-Chinese people in her restaurant she should open the restaurant in another country.
Came in here, fairly hungry and with fairly low expectations (stemming from the preponderance of Yelp reviews).  Overall, was pleasantly surprised;

My family's and I have been going to Chung King for more than 15+ years.  I love their Honey Walnut Shrimp, Dry Scallop Soup, Dungeness Crab and Steam Catfish.  My boys can't get enough of their sweet spareribs.  You get large portion of food at a reasonable price.

Came here for lunch.  We had the broccoli and mushroom and the salt and pepper pork rib.  The veges were cooked very well and tasty. The pork rib was nice, just a little oily. Overall very good value. The food is quite cheap so we didn't fantastic quality.

Came here for a snack with my parents. Ok good. Quick service but the waiter looks like he really hates his job. Giving us dirty looks when we ask for more tea or more soup. I wanted to ask him what his problem was. But until all my food was out ill call him out. Don't want to find anything extra in my food.

I had a combination fried rice and salt and pepper pork chops here. I felt that the entirety of both dishes was drenched in oil, and my mouth definitely had a slick feeling at the end of my meal. I suppose a positive point is that this restaurant was open on Labor Day...
Good food, reasonable price, friendly service.  Had shrimp lomein, calamari and mongolian beef.  Very satisfied.  I will definitely be back.......
I'm just in general not a fan of chinese food...but this place is supposed to be cheap, I guess so for a few different plates..
vey friendly...food was Great !!  Price was extremely cheap..lunch for 2 with drinks  out the door for 24.00.....

I have been here two times. The meal was cheap. I loved the extra sauce on the clams. The honey walnut prawn was decent. The mongolian beef was okay. The vegetables were fresh. However, I was very disappointed that the best part of the meat from the lobster were nowhere in sight. The kitchen kept the best part to themselves. It was unbelievable! I guess I won't be ordering the lobster dish anymore.
Don't worry...good for tourist.

Please don't tell Hunan Homes I came here. I feel like I cheated on them by going to their next-door competition, but I was lured by another place that serves steamed chicken. That was really it plus the fact that Chung King has garnered quite a bit of praise according to my fellow Yelp reviewers. I figured it was worth a try, so Jamie W. and I sauntered over there last Friday hoping the proprietress of Hunan Homes would not be out on the sidewalk having a smoke. Mission accomplished. Once we entered, we noticed the set-up was similar to Hunan Homes except the walls were white and the tablecloths pink. But I was having a panic attack since I didn't see steamed chicken on their menu. I was starting to hyperventilate.
Great restaurant on the edge of chinatown. I have only been here 2 time but both times were very good

We found this restaurant via Yelp and we were not disappointed!  We had a wonderful meal and the price was EXCELLENT!  My favorite was the Mu Sho Pork and the dumplings.... but i don't believe you would be disappointed in any of their selections. We ordered about 6 and all were awesome!
I still like the place, pretty decent food & inexpensive (no bad experiences ever).
DECENT and CHEAP CHINESE FOOD!
This is my all time favorite Chinese restaurant experience.
Thanks, Yelpers!

This is my second time that, I have eaten here... I came here yesterday when they had the San Francisco Chinatown Community Street Fair... The funny part is that it is still the same lady who took my order from the very last time... I came here to eat lunch and this time... I ordered myself a Yang Chow Fried Rice and ate it up with no left overs because... I was soooooo hungry after all the waiting in lines from some of the free givaway games that... I played at the 2012 San Francisco Chinatown Community Street Fair!!!

I feel I have to begin with the fact that I'm Caucasian, not Chinese, so this review may not be completely fair, given the fact that we had dinner on a Friday night, the place was full (both upstairs and downstairs) and we were the ONLY non-Chinese people in the place, which must mean something significant re the food!
What a surprise!
Stay away! Service was terrible! The food was bad and they added an 18% gratuity to the bill.

I've been coming here since I was a kid. The same lady still runs the place, it's nice to see a familiar face :) My family and I came to eat dinner on a weekday. There were only 2 people working, the boss and a waiter. That's it. They have a basement which they use when there are more customers. The first floor was almost full when we arrived. The tables are pretty compact, with tables for 4 people next to the walls and round tables for larger groups in the middle. With only 2 people working, you would think that their service would be insanely slow. It was actually alright, the boss took our order and she didn't seem at all tired or irritated. She even suggested a few dishes for us. The wait for the food wasn't that long. We ordered a seafood dish, garlic stir fried vegetables, green onion & ginger crab, salt & pepper codfish, fried soft tofu with bok choy. EVERYTHING was well prepared and tasted really fresh. The seafood dish had huge scallops, shrimp, and octopus. I didn't taste a hint of fishy-ness at all! The crab was big and had a lot of meat. I think their salt & pepper dishes are famous or something. And the price is definitely worth it. I've been to all the restaurants in Chinatown and this one definitely is the best.
Definitely worthy of four stars.

One of the gems in San Francisco's chinatown. I've been coming here since I was a little kid, wayyyyy back when my entire family would come here and fill up 2 or 3 huge tables with my GREAT grandparents, my grandparents, cousins, aunts, uncles, you name it!
Really good value, well seasoned, nicely executed Cantonese food.

Indeed, a part of our urban hike was nourishment so we stop by Chung King for some Chow Fun and Tsingtao beer (well, I needed three, to the dismay of my 'brothers'), anyhow, the service was GREAT!!, but we all ordered dishes with chow fun (the wide noodle) instead, the chow fun orders came out with thin noodles, like fettuccine - non-the-less - Chung King is a great place - excellent food, service beyond compare but don't order chow fun if you are from the old school of wide chow fun noodles
What I recommend:

I usually do not eat at Chinese restaurants this far down Jackson St toward Kearny; I usually stay closer to Stockton and Jackson.  But I was pleasantly surprised to dine at Chung King Restaurant for dinner.  You cannot argue with the price charged here as you'll pay probably a buck or two less per dish than other comparable Chinatown restaurants.  We had a chicken sizzling platter, braised fish with bak choy, and 8 treasures bean curd hot pot (I didn't count all the treasures but there was squid, tofu, ginger, and fish included).    All dishes were great for the $7-$9 we paid, and I was surprised how much fish we got in our braised fish dish (it was only $7!)   I would definitely get the 8 treasures bean curd hot pot again as it had a great sauce which mixes well with white rice; although I would love to try their other hot pot and sizzling platters.

We ate here based on the reviews here on tripadvisor.  We had the snails and blackbean sauce, beef chow fun, mongolin beef, fried squid and the sizzling rice soup.  The food was good and at a great price.  The staff was very friendly and the food was served quickly.  The server didnt think us two white boys really wanted the snails but when we explained we worked in a chineese restraunt when we were kids and had them before she served them to us promptly. Mmmmmmm they were good!

Food is just okay. But the noise level is insane. We sat next to a large table of drunken men yelling, screaming and gambling. I usually have high tolerance for noise in a restaurant as long as the food makes up for it. But this is too much. And the food wasn't even that great.
One of the best deals in San Franciso.  Great tasting chinese food at very reasonable prices.  Try their sizzling plate rock cod or black bean sauce clams!!!

Terrible, Terrible and Terrible.  What made me come to this place was that it was on Grant Street and I was shopping for souvenirs.  Unfortunately, I could not find quickly.  I bought a coconut boba yes it was filled with syrup and the water was made from the tap mixed with hot water.  There was no ice in my drink and tasted horrible.  There was hardly any boba too and only drank half of the drink.  I used the bathroom too and it smelled bad and dirty.  It was gross as hell.  I paid $3.21 and I would not drink this stuff if someone paid from me.
mango boba for $3.21. Horrible. Made of mango syrup in ice water with some chunky boba that stuck together. don't go here.
I was walking down Pacific Ave. from Grant in Chinatown SF, when I looked in.
old Chinese Senior Citizens that eat at this place don't do yelp....  otherwise,they'll be giving 4 to 5 stars.
Disgusting!!!  Cold food, dirty dishes- avoid this place at all costs!
Cheung Yuen doesn't have the lines but  they have the cheap eats. there's seating available, menu on the wall is in english and the pricing is legible, though faded.
Introduced to this place by my co-worker, Bob.  Bob, you rock!!
(See pic)

Sorry but serving bad food is not acceptable.  The lady behind the counter was nice and helpful but the brown sugar pudding cake was foul - it was spoiled, YUCK!  I can't spit out the bite I took fast enough!

So I came here this morning to buy my usual dim sum.  I waited for about 1-2 minutes for the lady in front of me's larger order, then it was going to be my turn.  Except right when I was about to order, some lady swooped into the store, stopped directly in front of me and started ordering without skippin' a beat and the lady behind the counter let her.  What the heck!?

I was first introduced to this place by Shirley Fong in her "eat your way through china town" tour. It is *dirt* cheap. For example, today we ordered 4 different things (each with 3+ pieces), and the total was only $5.70. There are a few tables in the restaurant, but I recommend you get your food to go. In the summer, it's nice to take it to a park or something like that. The staff are friendly.

The food (Two varieties of chow mein, sweet and sour pork, general tsaos etc.) was standard fare and generally tasty if unremarkable. I insisted on leaving a tip for the woman who served us as she was generally working hard; portions were a bit small, but I still nonetheless would have given this place 4 stars if not for the insistence that the waitress count the money we left on the table twice over before she let us go. How rude! Never again.
The atmosphere isn't anything to get excited about, but that has to be the best pepper beef I've ever had. Service was fast and very polite. It's a great place to go for a quick bite.

Came here one night with my bf after finding capital closed and I'm so glad we did! Couldn't find the yelp page on the app for this place even though I was right outside and sorted by distance (hmm?? Suspicious). But it was a good thing I didn't cause we would've probably skipped this place had I found it earlier.

This place was alright, certainly not the best Chinese food I've ever had but not the worst either. I came to this place after Outside Lands so as you can imagine everything else was closed and I had no other option than to eat here. I'm not going to comment on the decor because there was honestly nothing exciting nor hip about it, it just looked like a very small and basic restaurant.

I have to give this restaurant a good review. I'll admit the place is small but it's Chinatown. The restaurants in the area are small and it hard to get a bigger place when you're in a historical area like Chinatown. Would you rather have the entire area be remodel? Beside the streets are small and in a hillside area.

I was starving in Chinatown and just stumbled upon this restaurant, I sat down and ordered, then while waiting for the food, i noticed on my phone that the yelp rating was so low. i started to FREAK OUT! Then after awhile, the food came and it looked okay....then i tasted the food! OMG the food here is so good!!! I cant believe such a small restaurant has such good CHICKEN WINGS!! The waiter was old and she was moving very slow, but she had very good service. I can't expect much with a one man server. I went here 3 times again and the CHICKEN WINGS was the same as the 1st time! Very good can't stop eating Their wings.
I had a bad feeling about this place even before I stepped in the door... And then the food confirmed my suspicions.

I dont know what to say about this cafe. I was in Chinatown for the Chinese New Year festival. We got hungry and walked by and saw a sign that says Ox-tail stew rice platter. The rice came out lukewarm, and very stale, like day old rice. By that time the rice has hardened and was not edible. My husband got the codfish rice platter. He seem to like it, but then again, you'll put anything in his face and he'll eat it anyway, no questions asked. My oxtail stew wasn't really ox-tails stew. It was a couple of bones with some meat attached to it. I counted it and it was thee tiny pieces (mostly bones) and everything else was soybean stuff. Luckily, the prices aren't too expensive otherwise I would have a fit. No way I am coming back.

Omg, I have been here quite a long time ago and was mediocre. That server was really rude just throwing stuff on the table as she served. Recently, I've went by and saw that they were under new management with new waitress and cook so I decided to try there again with my bff. I was totally amazed because there was a 360 degree turn from service and the food. Although their new construction might not be the best but my bff and I felt that this place was amazing. I got the imperial spareribs and she got the pan fried noodles. And of course, we had to share the fried chicken wings! It was all too good and too much to finish, and surely, we took it home. Yummmyyyy!!! We will definitely be back again!! Yumm!! Oh yea, I forgot to say, their prices are very reasonable and affordable! =DD

Their restaurant is simple and fairly priced.  Something just needs to be said for a 1 cook and 1 server team that can run a restaurant on their own!  Their service was good and the lady running the restaurant is very nice!  Also, they made 50 chicken wings for our company and every single wing I ate was surperb!  I hope hard working people like them will stay in business.

A few weeks ago I came here with my friend during lunch hour. Walking in I knew we were in trouble already. The restaurant only had one table occupied and they weren't Asians. When the waitress walked toward us with a huge smile, I was thinking what did we get ourselves into? This is lunch time, how can it be so quiet? We ordered some dim sum and I gotta say, their Hai Gao and Siu Mai was actually pretty fresh and good. However, I can't say the same goes for the rest. One order came out cold and they had to bring it back into the kitchen to re-steam it. After they brought it out, I tried half a bite and didn't even want to eat it anymore. I have ordered that specific dish at dozen of other places before and this is by far the worst ever.

Wow, this place is bad. Talk about cheaply made Chinese food at ridiculously high prices. I should have known walking into this Chinatown restaurant on a weekday evening, with only one diner inside. Should have gone to R&G instead with the amount I paid.
